Others have commented that the Honeywell’s phone Support is a problem. I have not needed to use it, and can’t comment. But it’s certainly something that concerns me - thus 4 stars. I will update this review should I experience problems with the units or otherwise.

title: New version seems much more stable
text:
I have been using this app and matching thermostat for a couple of years now and it seems that this most recent version is pretty bug free. I have not had any disconnect or failures in a long time.   

I do wish it would send me an alert when my Wife or Kids make a change at the thermostat such as temporary or especially a permanent hold.  It sometimes takes a while to recognize that the thermostat is not running the program because of manual intervention at the thermostat.  

I did request a feature when I first bought it which would be to set a tolerance of sort so that it would not come on and turn off for every 1/2 a degree change in temperature because by the time the A/C turns off the compressor and runs the fan for a few minutes after and finally shuts down, it is then 1/2 degree warmer and it turn right back on.  They kindly suggested insulation for the house I do not own.

title: Works, kind of
text:
I’ve lived with this app (and its thermostat) for about a year, and it works, sort of. The problem is that anywhere from one to two hours before the next scheduled change, it turns on the furnace (or air), and it isn’t because it’s lost track of the time or program.

For example, I have it set to turn on at 6:00 AM. I get up at 5:00, and very shortly thereafter the furnace comes on. The app shows the target temp at 68 when it should still be 60. But it hasn’t officially started the heating period yet, because if I take the phone and punch it back down to 60 and hit submit, it will show that it’s going to hold 60 until its next scheduled change, which it says will be at 6:00 AM. This is driving me nuts. In the afternoon it begins almost 2 hours early.

Some have suggested it turns on so it will be at target temperature at the scheduled time, but why would anyone create a remotely programmable thermostat with that kind of feature? I can set any time I want. I don’t need it to “think” for me.

title: Happy purchase
text:
My old digital thermostat in a vacation home failed and I found this one at Home Depot. I did watch the videos and read all
Instructions so this went in in about 20 minutes. And I am only a basic tools person. It does require a very small flathead screw driver  to open and tighten the terminals- this was not mentioned or demonstrated anywhere- like a sewing or jewelers screwdriver. After a week I can say that I love being able to see& set temps remotely. I'll be able to leave on minimum heat but warm up before going there!  Note it is best to make sure you have started the Internet process before mounting on wall, then complete after putting on face plate. Before purchasing I was worried about no battery power to back up. I called Honeywell who told me none needed! However, In it has a "watch style" battery which holds the program even through power outages.

title: Wi-fi thermostat 9000
text: It’s 29 below outside and 58-65 degrees inside.  Not comfortable at all.  Our programmable thermostat is not communicating with our furnace.  I can only see the display from my cell phone but can’t adjust the temperature.  I’ve called Honeywell support, got messages that say the system is in maintenance mode and there’s nothing that can be done and to call back later.  Tried a different number and was connected to Yvonne after a 40 minute hold, she was in tech support located in Mexico.  Her assessment was that either the voltage was off or the unit is defective and that I should contact the contractor who supplied and installed it, and on the positive side she informed me that we have a 5 year warranty on the unit.  Luckily for us we have another furnace in the lower part of our home that has an old thermostat that allows us to turn the dial to a temperature we can be comfortable with.  In summary, this new High tech thermostat is not worth its bells, whistles and features.  Unreal you can’t send your review unless you rate them higher than one or two stars.  My rating in one

title: A feature we could use…
text:
I give the app four stars as it works great. My wife and I find it very easy to use.

The one feature I would like to see is the ability to have the A/C lower the temperature slightly over night. The reasoning is the area we live, inland South Carolina, in the spring time and sometimes through the summer, the nighttime temperature drops below our system set point / temperature. This makes it so the system does not come on as the house remains cooler than the outside temperature. The problem is that the humidity creeps in and makes it very uncomfortable. So either my wife or I as we’re older and need to get up often during the night, we will drop the system temperature by one degree every few hours to take out the humidity. So for us and our climate, we would love to see a feature that automatically drops the temperature by just one degree, say every three hours.

title: Good app but outside temp is horrible
text: I have installed this thermostat in both my upstairs and downstairs locations and they both seem to be working well as far as inside temperature accuracy and the ability to operate several settings from the app.  One major flaw in the units themselves is the outdoor temperature shown on the unit and app. Not sure what weather monitoring station Honeywell is using but the temp is always off by about 5 degrees from what the actual temp is outside. I can look at the Weather Channel app and even my local news station weather app and they are always within 1 degree of what the actually temp is outside my home. I confirmed the units have my correct address as well so it has to have something to do with how often it’s being updated or it’s just using a really bad source for temperatures in a given area.  If Honeywell could fix that issue I think the unit and app would be 5 stars.

title: Can’t edit from app when on vacation mode
text: I like all of the features that this app offered. It allows you to make changes while you are not at that location which is great. However if someone holds the temp for more than a day it puts the system into “vacation mode” and you can’t change anything from the app. The whole idea of the app is so that you can change it when you are not there. If you actually go on vacation and temp hold for 5 days wouldn’t it be nice to change the temp back to a comfortable level so you can return home to a good temperature? I don’t understand why it won’t allow you to change the temp when it is set to any mode. My kids don’t pay attention to the time frame of the hold so they lock it for more than a day and leave the house. I try to go in and use the app to change the temp and it won’t let me since it now considers it on vacation mode. It would also be nice to track run times. This could help understand costs and save more money.

title: So glad to have found this
text:
We’d had our Honeywell T-stat for three years and I hated it! Not because it didn’t work, but because we understood the packaging to mean that we could set the entire week at once.  Nope..had to set it day-by-day.  No option for M-F, etc. What a pain every time it needed to be reset!  (And I’m the one who always has to.)
I recently had to call Honeywell about a problem we seemed to be having.  The technician was extremely helpful in resolving it.  And then inquired if we were using the app.  I told him I’d tried to set it up years ago but I could never figure it out. 
After about 20 minutes, he had the issue resolved and the t-stat set up and now I just pull out my phone and can make changes whenever I want with ease.  Wish I’d called years ago - I could’ve avoided years of frustration.

title: Up until today, when I really needed it, it seemed fine
text: Seemed to work ok & loved having an app to control from out of town or just upstairs. The coldest snap I’ve ever seen, and I’m off work because of it—so I wanted to override the schedule and have it “hold” til the evening, when it would resume comfortable human temps. The app said 65, though I set a 70 hold. Told me it was on when it wasn’t. Told me it was Off when it was running. And the thermostat itself read 70, as if it had reached temperature, when my other separate thermometer (right above it!) said 68. And it shut off again. I changed the Return time to 12 minutes later(1:30PM), and now 20 minutes has gone past and it STILL said it’s on hold til 5:30. It SHOULD NOT have a hold on it now. It’s the COLDEST DAY OF THE FLIPPING SEASON and MY THERMOSTAT WON’T FLIPPING WORK RIGHT because the APP IS GLITCHING. **FIX** YOUR **SH^T** Honeywell. People are depending on this to keep their homes liveable and safe, whether they are home or away. You advertise the peace of mind “knowing” what’s happening ... but if it’s THIS INACCURATE right now, how can I ever trust it?

title: No Longer iPhone X Friendly
text:
24SEP2018 Update:

The intent of this purchase was to eliminate the need to travel up the stairs to adjust the thermostat.  The app stopped working two days ago and we’re back to going up the stairs to adjust the thermostat.  It’s pointless to have a WiFi thermostat without being able to control it wirelessly with the app.  The thermostat itself is excellent WHEN IT WORKS.  Otherwise, it’s just a regular thermostat with a fancy screen.  The app is so unreliable and there’s no way to know if or when the Honeywell servers are down.  We haven’t been able to control our thermostat wirelessly for more than two days now. 

Original:
A wireless thermostat made it possible for us to make adjustments without having to run up the stairs, where our one and only thermostat is physically located.  This was a real game changer while recovering from back surgery during summer time!

This app is great when it works.  There are times when the app simply does not work and you have to physically interact with the thermostat, which defeats the purpose of having a wireless thermostat!  

The app is often buggy, stuck on the login screen, and will not allow you to sign in.  Whenever you leave the app and come back to it, there is ALWAYS an error message of some kind.

After the most recent update, the app is no longer iPhone X friendly!  When you click on “SYSTEM” or “FAN” to change HVAC settings, the “cancel” and “submit” buttons are no longer visible!!!

title: Some Problems
text:
The thermostat on the wall reads the correct time. I set a schedule but had to adjust the time on the app by a couple of hours to make the schedule work on the correct time. I have reset the wall unit several times, still doesn’t work right. 
I’m glad we have an A/C person as a friend. He’s been here to see why we can’t change from heat to air conditioning without shutting down the whole system using the breakers, letting it be off for a while, then restarting the whole system. Learned to either leave it on heat in the winter and adjust the temperature so the unit responds, or leave it on air in the summer and adjust. I’ve learned never to use the app to turn off the unit or turn it on. Just have to leave it on!
Quirky to say the least! Been a year and I think I’ve got it figured out, quirks and all. Nobody else in the house is allowed to touch it. They just have to tell me what they want and I’ll get it done.

title: After 4+ years, review!
text: So I’ve had this since I purchased my home about 5 years ago. I’ve never had an issue with the app and have been super satisfied. It works as advertised with no real hiccups. A few years ago when the iPhone X was released, I noticed it didn’t support the new screen size. Kinda bugged me but no reason to dislike the app. Finally, today, almost 3 years later, it supports my screen! My brain almost couldn’t understand the difference when I opened the app! I had to check the apps that updated to see if it really just happened and sure enough! I’ve always been happy and would recommend it to everyone, even if this update wouldn’t have happened. I’m only really writing this as a thank you to the developers for finally adding this support. Keep up the great work.

title: Irregular sleep hours
text: I’ve worked the night shift for 20 years and wish I had gotten this system earlier for my irregular sleep/wake schedule.  Programming the system doesn’t work for me since I get up as soon as I am awake regardless the number of hours slept, then nap before work or if I get tired on my days off.  The best thing about the HW App is I am able to turn on the heater remotely before I leave from work at 7:30 am if I am heading home and arrive to a warm home in the winter.  Can adjust the heater or AC from any location, mostly from within the house depending on my activity level.    Would be nice to be able to turn on/off push notifications when the temp is changed as I travel a lot and have others taking care of my dog and house.  Have had a few glitches lasting 2 days each, and received notifications HW was working on the problem.

title: App meets my needs; still areas for improvement
text: The app does everything I need. It could load quicker. I bought this thermostat because it works with IRIS and it does. Although the interface is limited in IRIS. Adding the feature to change the system for s fixed period to the IRIS interface would be an awesome improvement. Customer service also needs help. A lot of help. I have an electronic background. The technical support staff did not seem to have a useful electronics background. After many calls and emails with pictures and diagrams I finally have up and hired an air conditioning professional. He was amazed at the ineptness of Honeywell's technical support response. These other issues are an aside to the app. I mention them because they were part of the experience. The less than satisfactory experience did not effect my rating of the app.

title: This App is inadequate.
text: This app offers only the most rudimentary controls for the thermostat and misses every chance to be helpful. The thermostat itself has a much deeper internal menu of options, none of which are accessible with the app. Yesterday I had a router malfunction and, on restart, one of the thermostat settings related to identifying the type of unit it controls was reset incorrectly. As a result, the thermostat failed to activate the heat. This is exactly where this app could have been helpful, but just wasn’t. An ‘advanced settings’ option where the thermostat’s internal setting menu could have been accessed, would have saved me an hour of hunting down the internal menu key (the thermostat only displays numbers). Even a direct link to the instructions specific to the thermostat so that the user could troubleshoot would have been helpful. This app has none of that, although it does have a misplaced ‘marketplace’ function where I can shop for related accessories. Find a thermostat with a more sophisticated app to interface. This one’s is junk.

title: From a tecnician
text: Anyone that can read should. E able to install the thermostat and this app andget them to work together properly. I have access to almost all system and this is the oneI chose for my house (actually two sysrems).  The temp variance at first seemed a little tight at one degree so I kept track with my second unit thatwas identical except i had not insralled the Honeywell thermostat sytem and it had a Hunter programable that had a variance of 2 degrees.   Yes the Honeywell cycled off and on more often but runtimes were shorter.  Energy usage difference including starting surges were probably negligable  but I found the additional air circulation made all areas seem mor comfortable.   As for all the other features or lack of them I found nothing significant to be lacking and all functionality spot on.   Since getting mine I have probably installed 25 or so with never an issue.

title: Works great and reliable
text: I own 4 Honeywell Smart thermostats; two with humidity readings and Heat/AC controls. All work as expected. I owned a Nest and had lots of trouble with it. Can’t say enough good things about these Honeywell products. I can monitor my homes’ heat and air conditioning while away, and make changes on my phone. If the humidity level gets too high, or communication is interrupted due to power issues or failed internet communication, I receive an email alert every hour until the issue is resolved. Thankfully my furnace has never failed so I have never received a low temperature alert but I have full confidence I would receive an alert if that circumstance occurred. If the internet goes out, once the modem and router reset, my thermostats reconnect without assistance. Good customer service help when needed.

title: Works great!!
text: This is a great purchase if you compare it to the other brands that look fancier and who knows what else they do. I’m extremely happy with this thermostat but there’s something that I dislike and that’s why I gave it four stars. Sometimes while using the app the thermostat doesn’t follow instructions and you have to change the temperature manually, maybe it’s due to the application or maybe it’s the thermostat having problems connecting to the WiFi, who knows. I thought my internet was the problem but everything else was working fine. Overall this item works great, and the price is excellent if you compare it to other brands, I’ve had mine for over a year and the only issue is the one that I mentioned before and it’s occasionally. I would say that it’s very convenient to adjust the temperature when you’re not at home from anywhere, I highly recommend this product.

title: Good but needs some user experience updates
text:
I’ve never written app review before but this app could be so much better if they made a few tweaks.  Hopefully someone at Honeywell actually reads these reviews. 

1st, you should be able to rename the name of the thermostat within the app.  Just a simple feature to allow me to change the name by clicking on the text and changing the name. I have one thermostat labeled “downstairs” and one labeled “household”, I want to change the “household” one to “upstairs”...but right now, if I want to change the name, it looks like I have to delete the thermostat and re-add it back to the app.  That’s annoying.

2nd, when you click on a thermostat in the app to adjust temps or adjust the schedule...at the top of the screen it just says “THERMOSTAT”.  It should say the actual name of the thermostat so you know all the time which thermostat you’re adjusting.  It’s annoying that it just says “THERMOSTAT”.  It should say “Downstairs” or whatever name you’ve labeled your thermostat to be.

3rd, you should be able to totally customize your schedule see -> Nest app scheduling features.

Other than those three things, I think this app is good.  It’s not as intuitive as the Nest app that I had with my a/c system at my old house but it’s good enough.

Honest review and I hope that Honeywell will make these changes...especially the first 2!

title: Beyond expectations
text: I bought two of these thermostats hoping to be able to monitor my high summer electric bill. I was blown away that I could turn up thermostat while gone from my phone if I forgot to before leaving the house. The best part was being able to turn my thermostat down 15 minute before I got home so I could walk into a nice and comfortable cool house. I absolutely love these thermostats. My bill dropped over 30 percent and paid for the thermostats within a month. See the electric company gave me a rebate on my bill for 2 months since I had 2 thermostats and the final cost for thermostats was $4 each. My electric bill went down over $100 a month using these thermostats. Thank you Honeywell. Been using these thermostats for over 2 years now and never had one problem. 5 stars !!!!!!!!

title: Convenient to use
text: When my AC went out and new one installed,  I also had installed the new thermostat. Which I find very convenient to use. Someone mentioned about not getting push notifications. I don’t see the need for them. I can  see what the temperature is set on and what the temperature is outside from my phone where ever I am.  You set it for cool or heat. Both are not running at the same time.  I like that when I’m away from home for extended periods and just before returning i can turn the system on from my phone.  I love that when I’m down stairs I don’t have to go upstairs to change the temp, or if I get uncomfortable with the temp at night I don’t have to get out of bed to change it.  The irritating bug that kept my app from working occasionally seems to have been taken care of. I haven’t had that problem in a while. So overall I’m satisfied I’m pretty happy with this app.

title: Thermostat doesn’t follow schedule
text:
App is convenient, but mediocre and I question the consistency between the app and the thermostat. Many times, if I make an adjustment via the app, I’ll get an error stating the changes I attempted to make did not work. 

Also, I have my schedule set so the heater will turn on when the temperature in my home drops below what was set. Currently, the thermostat will only follow this during certain hours, definitely not overnight, regardless of what my schedule says. For example, my schedule says between the hours of 11 PM and 6 AM, maintain a temperature of 70°. When I wake up at 8 AM, the temperature in the house is at 65° and it will not turn on the heater if I manually adjust the settings via the app or directly from the thermostat, but it will turn on randomly in the middle of the afternoon. Power to the device is adequate. I will be purchasing a new thermostat even though my current WiFi 9000 Color Touchscreen thermostat is only 3 years old.

title: Own 4
text:
My first one was replaced with Honeywell’s blessing 3x. The tech couldn’t help me and said the units were bad. They were resetting after every cooling cycle. I already had a nest at another home and I’m not really a fan. Turns out I figured out my new ac unit was wired to shut off at the compressor and not the control panel. After figuring that out I bought three more for other homes and I installed another 3 at friends homes. 
Their app is getting easier to add another location to it. I just haven’t figured out if it’s possible to add one without being onsite, and I don’t know if it’s possible to program the range stop settings remotely. Speaking of that, the Honeywell website doesn’t list my model as setting this, but it does. 
As is the case with most call centers, the person your speaking to is most likely an untrained intern reading from a TelePrompTer.

title: Works great once it finally connects to my device.
text: This thermostat is very convenient and it’s great especially when I’m away from home and the weather changes.  I can remotely shut off, lower or raise the house temp not only for comfort but also to save on my energy consumption. I love being able to come home and my house is at a comfortable temperature. BUT the only issue I’ve been having is that about more than half the time I use the app it fails to connect or submit my new changes successfully. Whether I’m trying to change the temp, settings or schedule from my phone or tablet via 4G cellular, public WiFi or even while I’m on my home WiFi network which both my device and thermostat are connected to. It still takes a few try’s to connect or keep changes successfully when I press submit.  Other than that, once it does finally connect and keeps the changes I submit it works great. It just takes a few try’s sometimes.

title: Not Worth It
text:
Basically get what you would expect from a company that leans more toward commercial controls than individual consumer/residential. I had another competitors WiFi enabled thermostat prior to this but had to switch to the Homeywell Prestige due to dated wiring in my home when the furnace was upgraded. Prestige would have been an appropriate name in 2008. 

The app interface is clunky and feels like it harkens back to early iPhone apps (would look great on a 3GS). There are some key features missing with not being able to see furnace run times or learn my habits and suggest more efficient timing. Some view this feature as intrusive but should be offered for those that want it. The outside weather in the app doesn’t present well but is accurate. The largest knock is that nowhere in the app is there a place to set alerts if my home temp falls outside a range. In the end, this is just slightly more  functional than the ole Honeywell Round they perfected in the ‘50’s.

title: Perfection without huge price tag!!
text: I read the other reviews.  It may be an operator issue.  This was my first WiFi thermostat.  I purchased 2.  I love having access from my phone.  When I would be at work my children would decrease the temp to 68 degrees during the summer.  I could change the temp from work.  Then I utilized the passcode feature to keep them from running up the bill.  We have went out of town for short trips and left our furry babies at home.  I can schedule the thermostat for several days and check the temp outside and inside the home to make sure the furry babies were comfortable.  I love that you can change the colors and background.  I don’t know know why anyone could complain.  I installed myself (a woman) just simply following directions.  Piece of cake and offers more than more expensive thermostats!!

title: MY THERMOSTAT IS A-W-E-S-O-ME!!
text: I really like this thermostat. I thought I was going to be missing out from the competition. I realized most of the others are just in the name. I do everything all the others do and more. I really like that if it loses connection from my WIFI I can use it in manual mode and not lose my central AC. I also installed it myself and it took me only about 20 minutes from start to finish. I also had to modify something in my furnace and the video Honeywell provides is super easy to follow. The thermostat was up and running in no time at all. I can access my thermostat from anywhere and know that my home will be cold or comfy warm when I get home. I also have saved money on my bill with the scheduling and the app on my iPhone. Thank you Honeywell for not making me spend hundreds of dollars on the others to get the same if not more. 👏

title: It's not working!!!!
text: 87 year old grandmother had to install a new furnace January of this year and found out she HAD to install a digital thermostat. She can not see the numbers, so we spent approximately $400 more to install this wifi thermostat so that I could control it thru my phone. I realize that I have an option to program the thermostat, but again, she's 87 years old, so one minute she's burning up, the next minute she's freezing. Has worked fine up until about 2 weeks ago as it lost wifi connection and wouldn't reconnect to the router. Customer care was able to walk me thru reconnecting, but I have yet to be able to reconnect my app!!  3 calls, 2 of which were hold times over 1 hour, then a 45 minute long chat(again after approx 30 min wait time to chat) and still my phone shows "device is off". In the meantime, this is fall weather in KY, which means it can be 85 during the day and 55 at night. Was told by 2 customer care reps this past week that they would research and email me the next day, and still no email follow up. Totally frustrated.

title: Great info when we are away
text: We love this Honeywell thermostat and it’s features. It gives us the info we need whenever we are away from home especially for long periods of time. I like that we get alerts when something is not quite right according to the limits we preset for temps, and especially being able to view humidity levels. I also like seeing the outdoor temp/humidity levels in contrast to what is going on inside my house.  Another great feature is being able to control features when you are away, like being able to raise/lower temps, adjusting fan, changing from heat to a/c.  The unit also runs very well and keeps us totally comfortable when we are home. We are happy with our purchase of this product, it does everything we want it to do.

title: Nice but...
text:
It works great. I can view from anywhere and have never had trouble connecting. I like the app better than the thermostat. 
I have to agree with another review where it doesn’t provide usage history. Something I had on the prior Honeywell thermostat this one replaced.  Voice control only gets in the way. Can’t find a way to disable it.
One year later...
You can disable voice in settings. Never had any problem with maintaining temperature as stated by another review.  I also would like to see daily usage reports. 
One other detail probably more to do with the thermostat and furnace the fan shuts down when the heat comes on if the fan is in the on state. It waits for the heat to come up before the fan starts again.  It’s a fully modulating system.  My thermostat also has lots of detail about error messages and filter replacement that this app doesn’t support.

title: So far, so good . . .
text:
After some research and shopping around, picked this unit up on sale.  So far, no regrets whatsoever.  Installation and set up were straight forward and simple, the only glitch was activating the phone app and that was easily resolved with one phone call.
My wife works from home, so we basically only have it programmed for weekday/weekend - wake/sleep, but the ability to monitor/adjust remotely is a plus.
Aesthetically, the design is rather small and simple and the ability to coordinate the screen color with the surroundings is a nice touch.
Functionally, so far it does exactly what it is supposed to do, so no complaints.  I also like  that the screen also displays the outside temperature as well as the inside and outside humidity.
I would definitely recommend this thermostat.

title: Daily Energy Usages
text:
The thermostat works great, much more accurate then my First Alert thermostat. But the First Alert thermostat does have one of the best software I have used. It gives you great information and web site is always available. The First Alert support is also second to none phone and device support. I had one out three First Alert go bad and none of the Honeywell has ever gone bad. But when i did call Honeywell, it wasn’t as good as First Alert. My review of First Alert is 4 years old, and they could have fixed the dead zone sensitive module. Honeywell has a great dead zone of .5 to 1 degree, the first alert was testing at 2-4 degrees at ting of testing.

This thermostat needs to say how much energy heat/ac is being called for. It would be nice to put in ac size and SEER or kilowatt and heat therm so could see how much we are spending on energies.

title: Great app and thermostat
text: We have had a Honeywell lighted WiFi thermostat for several years and this app has worked very reliably to control it. When I am away I can check on the temp and humidity and change if necessary. It was very easy to setup and to connect to our home WiFi network.  Easy to add or remove thermostats.   Be sure to set a secure password so no one can guess it.  I like that I don’t have to enter the password every time I check the temp.  The WiFi connection does go off when power is down (although the thermostat retains all settings with the battery in it).  When the power comes back on it always connects itself again. I don’ t want to use the voice commands so can’t review those.   I do think the Contractor is a waste of effort.  I have my own furnace guy.  Overall I think it is a great app.

title: First smart thermostat
text: This is my first smart thermostat and very good one with the app you can control the thermostat very easy and simple to use the only one complaint is with the thermostat it self the screen is not very sensitive to touch with my fingers and also with the wife’s that’s really the only complaint I have with this system I did look at other systems for more money and they had more options that I felt as though where not needed like geo sensing that would only work with one phone not two. Again a very simple system that is user friendly I travel often for work and with the kids at home at times this helps me make sure the house is either warm or cold enough for them with out having them change the temp and cost me more on energy

title: Slick and reliable but needs additional functionality for multiple stats
text: I’m in the middle of changing out all (about 15) thermostats at my church for WiFi functionality and to help control power bill with better comfort.  Thermostats are Good quality as expected from Honeywell.  Here is my wish list to make the functionality top-notch.  I need the ability to create a profile for a tstat as I would like to make a simple change to multiple stats at once.  Also, I’d love more than 4 periods a day although that’s probably limited by the thermostat I purchased.  I’d also love the ability to lock down everything on the thermostat except for local user ability to adjust temperature temporarily + or - 3 degrees or so.  I understand that a building management system could accomplish all this, but the high cost associated with that eliminates that as an option for us.  This app could be perfect with a few added features.  Thanks

title: Four thermostats
text: We have four thermostats in or large home. Purchased 2 of the less expensive wi fi (they look just like the one I was replacing) and two of the newer digital units for our master bedroom and primary living area. Very happy with all of them. The only negative was the light is bright in the bedroom for sleeping. Had the background set for Black. Around 2 am it would go to bright white and the room was totally lit up like daylight. Nothing in manual. Emailed customer support twice and no response. Finally called to discover that at 2 am the unit goes to a white setting automatically to help save the screen for a longer life. Had to take the unit to 0 display in preferences to make our room livable again. There is absolutely nothing in the manual. They should be very open about this. The totally black screen is ok as we use our phone interface to check temperature.

title: Update was a downgrade
text:
I really like the functionality of this unit and would give it 5 stars. But, when unit was first installed, it worked great and would display on the Total Connect Comfort App when the cooling, heating or fan circulating was on. This was a great feature for monitoring since working out of town and being a second home 80 miles away. However, about 1 year after installation, Honeywell did an update to App and stopped displaying when the unit was on or running. This was aggravating as we didn’t know if the unit was having a problem or if working properly. I, too call support and was not impressed by the the person trying to resolve the issue. He said the app developers were not going to fix problem...Please fix this bug in the Total Connect Comfort App!!! I really like the display on unit and ease of use and navigation through the functions!!!

Wade Carrington

title: Huge improvement!
text:
I’ve been having a blast hooking my house to cameras and controllers for my mini-splits through WiFi apps in my phone. The last step was the forced air heater/AC controller for the whole house and I hit the mark with this one. Connecting was involving for a bit, I would suggest giving yourself a half hour or so to download the app and integrate it with the thermostat.

It’s awesome now to be able reach over to my phone while in bed and adjust the heater without going downstairs to the thermostat. I like the way this one controls the heater too. Much better than my last one, a better sensitivity to temp changes. My last one was a solid state, manually set thermostat. 

Really pleased with the phone app controls so much that I’ve hardly used the thermostat manually.

title: Don’t know what people are complaining about.
text: Maybe it’s because I am an IT guy who deals with issues all day and know how to resolve them but I figured it out and so far ‘fingers crossed’ it works great.  Honeywell does need to update it hyperlinks so that they take you to the correct page to create an account.  That’s on you Honeywell!  But they have been bought out by another company Respero so I went to their webpage and created an account and Boom! It worked.  My 70 year old mother and I are loving it!  I set up the Schedule and had the most comfortable nights sleep that I have had in a long time.  Granted, I did have an electrician install the two that I have and I am an experienced IT guy but a little common sense goes a long way.  Google is your friend don’t get mad get Google.

title: Almost a 5
text:
Just 3 things missing, and I am most likely the only person looking for 2 of them. I control 3 different homes and all 3 have TCC functionality.  
The 2 homes with 24 volt control voltage work great but it would be nice it the fan function had a circulation function.  My stat only allows for on or auto.  
The second issue was based on the home with electric baseboard heaters.  There is not a line voltage stat available, I had to add a separate drop contact for each stat. 17 in all and then run control voltage to each room to control the heaters.  It was a massive job.  But done is done and it works.  
The 3 issue is on of the function of the app.  In the home with multiple stat I have to load each stats page individually to see the rooms temp.  The app bings each stat and reports back.  And with 17 it can take 5 mins to turn the heat on for the weekend.  
Just my 2 cents

title: Last update a disaster
text:
After more than two years of flawless use, the last update (August 2018) to the app is an unmitigated disaster. I use these devices in two homes and after the last update, they both failed to work. Not only can I not adjust the temperature remotely via Wi-Fi, one of the thermostats actually turned my heat on instead of air conditioning. There has been no communication from Honeywell, calls to their obviously off-shore tech-support are useless. They keep saying they’re working on it. I have heard nothing after 10 days. Honeywell should be ashamed of themselves.

Well...after 21 days and about 15 hours of my time, I figured it out. It turns out that Honeywell’s last app update was not supported by Netgear, the manufacturer of my router. The firmware on my Netgear router needed to be updated to support the new Honeywell app and then Honeywell had to help me reconfigure/program my app.  Would have been nice for Honeywell to have checked all this out prior to pushing out its latest update.  It’s working again, but wow, what lousy customer service.

title: Functional
text: The most recent update did finally add iPad screen support making the app look a bit cleaner and more functioning on an iPads larger screen. Otherwise the app works and does most of the major features. However, the thermostat itself has tons more features beyond what the app has. It also struggles to update app side. Example. If I am off site and my wife says she is coming home early. I would set the thermostat back to its higher heat or lower cool temp. If she happens to get home before I do so and changes it at the thermostat. Sometimes the app doesn’t show that change/hold and thus I override it. Not a deal breaker but it is something to think about if you are buying this new. I likely will look at other options when replacing this device down the road but for now, it’s smart enough I guess?

title: Fan Scheduling
text: I wish the fan could be scheduled. As it works right now, the app allows the fan to be set "on" or "off"; so if I set the fan to "on" it will run indefinitely until I remember to turn it off. I would like to be able to schedule the fan on/off times. For example, my house is usually ~5 degrees warmer on the second floor than on the ground floor, so at times when I'm upstairs (such as sleeping at night) I may want to keep the fan running to keep the upstairs temperature comfortable. I can set the fan to "on" to accomplish that, but the fan will not turn off automatically after that, it will run until I remember to change it to "off". If I leave for work in the morning and forget about the fan running, it will run all day which can get expensive. A scheduler that allows the fan to be scheduled on/off for at least 2 periods a day would be great!

title: Honeywell wi fi thermostat
text:
I’ve had this thermostat in service for about 4 months. I installed it on my heat pump/gas pack backup unit with air conditioning. The installation instructions were easy to follow and I didn’t have any problems with the thermostat. The app works well. I haven’t had any issues with it or the thermostat. I like the idea of being able to see the house temperature when I’m gone. Especially while on vacation. I set the temperature down so the furnace doesn’t run much and adjust it back when we’re coming home.
Our internet isn’t the best. We lose connection often. But the thermostat still connects after the Internet comes back. Despite the issues I have with our internet service the thermostat works flawlessly. 
I recommend the thermostat for anyone looking for a wi fi thermostat.

title: Overall good product
text: I got these thermostats (2) as part of a purchase of a new HVAC system, two zone system. In order to use the app, you must register online and enter the MRC and CRC ID Numbers for your particular unit.  Different versions have it in a different places apparently.  Directions on how to get numbers are awful.  Dealer did not provide card initially then only sent one.   (I have an upstairs downstairs dual unit).   Instructions for unit itself have wrong information As to where ID numbers were located. Finally found where to find them in installers manual.  Since you can find them on the display screen by scrolling through the registration program the directions should be crystal clear on website, in app and on paper directions.   Except for this torture for two days, I really like the app.

title: Cool Domicile on Hill
text:
The Honeywell system was the system recommended by the technicians (Service Champions) who installed our duct system with top of the line infrared scrubbers and a very robust air flow system. After this was completed the only remaining item left to do was install a top of the line wireless thermostat and the Honeywell was the singular choice ! It works beautifully and compared to the popular ones that control each and every facet of one’s by calling out a robots name that seems to be do everything including taking your children’s school test, I said no, rather have cool and warm home and not all that other extraneous rubbish. I am very delighted and glad for this device and I would unreservedly and unequivocally recommend this product to any in the market. 

Edwin R. Alexander

title: Great App and Thermostat
text:
The app and thermostat work great!! We have relatively high and low temperatures here, and the temperatures are easily kept where I’d like them. Being able to control the settings from my phone is really convenient. 

PS - While I only read a few of the negative comments, most concerns appeared to be due to technological misunderstandings. (i.e., one complaint was the outside temperature reading wasn’t the same as shown at the three thermometers on their house. The thermostat does not read “your” thermometers. It’s getting the information from a weather station, that could be a ways away, just like the other weather apps for your area. That’s the information that is available via the internet that the system can access.)

title: LOVE this thermostat!
text: So easy to program. So easy to set up. So easy to read (even from 20 feet away). So easy to control remotely. What’s not to like? We have had this for almost three years and I did have one instance when the stat lost its ability to connect to the internet. I emailed Honeywell and got a response within four hours, along with detailed instructions on how to fix it (dummy-proof). I got it up and running properly in five minutes. Other than that, it has performed flawlessly. I also love the ability to change the colors when I see fit. I don’t fall in love easily, but this device makes me happy because it is very cool and works like a dream. I’m in my 60s, and I have no problems reading the bright display. It’s also great to have the outdoor temp readily available on the home screen.

title: Completely Satisfied!
text: It is nice having the Honeywell Wi-Fi thermostat and this ap. Makes my life so much easier and comfortable! We replaced it from the old type of thermostat where you manually set the temperature in the morning then all throughout the day you manually adjust it...not fun at all. This was actually my parent's home but my husband and I had to move in to take care of my mother after my father passed away almost 3 years ago. Anyway, having the ap has made it soooo nice to be able change the temperature from my phone during the night without having to get up from my bed if the house gets to warm or cold! Even though we have only had this new thermostat a few weeks, I highly recommend both the thermostat and ap! Now the next stage...turning this house into a smart house!

title: Works great! But local temp displayed is way off...
text: As a wifi thermostat, this one looks and works great. It connects easily to wifi and was easily programmable. As far as “looks”, this one looks great in our home and I love all the data displayed. Unfortunately though, the outdoor local temp displayed is way off. Apparently Honeywell uses accuweather as its source, and accuweather uses a somewhat nearby faulty weather station as its source; and not only is this station faulty, it only updates its temp once per hour (not real time!). I contacted Honeywell but they say the souce can’t be changed, so users of this thermostat are stuck with the garbage data displayed for outdoor temp. It’s kind of embarrassing when we have visitors who see and comment on our thermo, I just tell them it’s a Honeywell design flaw and Honeywell won’t fix it.

title: Power failure recovery
text:
I really like the thermostat and use the WiFi remote control feature a lot to save additional energy. 
Recovering from a power failure is not robust. It seems every time I leave for a week, there will be. Power failure the first day. When power is restored, the thermostats come back on quickly - but the Comcast internet router takes 10-15 minutes to be totally operational. Seems the thermostat must try to connect to WiFi for a couple minutes then gives up. I then get a failure email from 2 thermostats every 30 minutes the entire week I am away and I have NO control to check or adjust, based on the weather “at home”. The only recovery mode is a power down of the thermostat when I return. Frustrating, as the above issue really negates much of the reason I bought this thermostat, replacing previous Honeywell programmable models.

title: Fejay/Builder
text: I built our family home in Texas, and my HVAC sub recommended this smart thermostat with WIFI capabilities. As a builder I don't like surprises, so I was a bit skeptical in the beginning, but after trying the smart system I am totally    impressed with it's performance and information reliability as it relates three different zones with three units in the home. Because each thermostat control a specific area and communicates information independently for comfort according to family members needs and send that information to our smart devices allowing us to reducing energy spikes from children changing the system arbitrarily. And because we have full control of the system at home or away, with the ability to speak in passing and change the climate is a game changer. We enjoy it!

title: Needs work
text:
I have 10 thermostats.  I connect wirelessly from my iPhone using a red link device.  Many times when I open the app, there are errors saying the app can’t communicate with multiple thermostats. I tap on the thermostats and then it connects. If I close the app and open it again, I get the same error but in different thermostats. Very frustrating.

Update-  turns out there was nothing wrong with the app. I had replaced a few red link devices and they kept the old information and the new information at the same time which caused the error messages. The developer deleted the out dated info from my account and all is working as it should. Phenomenally fast response from the developer as well. Thanks very much!

title: Stuck on “Heat on”
text:
I love the I can control my temps when I step out when not scheduled. I love having control over the system via internet. That part is awesome. The app works for me but I do realize that for some reason I once put on the furnace and it never says the correct thing anymore. All the temps and info are correct minus that the system will off..and it’ll say “heat on” or the fan will be on and it’ll say “heat on”. I’ve been turned on the a/c and it still says “heat on”. So that info isn’t correct on my app. It always says “heat on” regardless of what system is on. That part I REALLY dislike. I haven’t called any number or talked to any professional about it. Hopefully, there’s a way to fix it. That’s my only complaint.

Update: I did switch to the app Honeywell Home and linked my account from this app and began using the new app from Honeywell. SOOOO MUCH BETTER!

title: Convenient but slow
text:
It’s sure nice not having to run to the Thermostat to change the temperature. 
Now I would have given 5-Stars had it not been for two things that are still slightly bothersome. One is the speed it takes getting to the screen which actually allows you to change the temperature. First you have to click on the specific thermostat, and I only have one. Then another screen asking is this the thermostat you’re referring too? Then again waiting for the “actually” screen I wanted in the first place. 
Second, is there a way to remove all those empty red boxes below my one and only thermostat? I’ve looked and looked and just can’t find a way. Totally unnecessary to have 9 slots for thermostats when I will and forever only have one. 
Thank you

title: WONDERFUL WONDERFUL WONDERFUL
text: I really like this app. I can change the temperature while I’m in my chair, in town, in the bed, or even in the tub!!! It lets you schedule when you want the temperature to change. If you are on vacation and have the temperature set on something and then the weather outside takes a sudden change then you can change the temperature remotely from wherever you are. Another good example is the temperature in the house is set at a certain degree and you are sick in bed. All of the sudden it gets really cold, because you are sick in bed. You don’t have to get up to change the temperature. You can change it remotely from right there in bed!!! It also tells you the weather for the the next five days. I find that it’s more accurate then the weather channel.

title: Okay app
text:
I think the app itself is okay and the functionality works as designed. The interface is a bit dated looking and rather unpolished but it gets the job done for the most part. I have a three zone system however I’m only able to set/modify the schedule for my main zone. This may be more of a reflection of the type of thermostats I have in the other zones though. Manually setting the temperature on those zones via the app works fine. 

The biggest issue I have is that there a “phantom” thermostat on my system and I’m unable to get rid of it for some reason. It has been there for the four years since I’ve had the system and it’s driving me a bit crazy. I’d like to have the ability to at least hide it in the interface if I can’t remove it entirely.

title: Great thermostats
text: I love these thermostats. Since installing the units on my 3 systems (two split systems with gas furnace and a heat pump) my energy consumption has been reduced. I’m able to monitor the systems remotely and adjust the settings when I’m away or have a schedule change at the house (day off, holiday, etc.).  I also no longer have to worry about the thermostats getting jacked up because someone is cold/hot and running forever. The temporary hold feature is outstanding. My minor reason for not giving it a five star rating is I’d love for my Honeywell Lyric water leak detection system to be on the same app. If you don’t have a Lyric Water Leak sensor get one!  I have a basement mechanical room where my AC units are located along with my whole house water filtration system. The Lyric device has saved me on 3 occasions. Inexpensive device for a HUGE peace of mind.

title: Not always reliable
text: Nice when it works. It was nice to be able to control the thermostat from my phone but a few days ago I could not turn my heater off or down, which was unfortunate because I had turned it up somewhat high to get it to come on and get the dampness out of the air earlier in the day. Could not get the app to communicate. Kept turning it off at the unit but it would jump back on. It was getting hotter and hotter in the house and my possessed thermostat would not turn off no matter how much times I stood there trying to make it happen   I got this for Christmas last year and have never had this happen. Finally deleted the app on my phone and was able to control it at the unit again. Re downloaded the app just now and it is having issues. In the past deleting and reinstalling the app have fixed app issues although I have never had it trying to over ride what I would do directly at the unit. That was a new and scary one. Doesn’t always work well with Alexa either.

title: This works well for us.
text: We bought the Honeywell thermostat when it was on sale, figuring it would be good to have a WiFi connected one.  Then we found out about the Total Connect app and installed that.  We like it indeed.  I can adjust the temperature from anywhere in the house and also whenever we travel!  If we are visiting relatives and the night turns cold, I can check the temperature at home to be certain the furnace is operating correctly.  We like the temperature anticipation feature that kicks in when the time for a setting adjustment happens.  The app also tells outside temperature for the city and gives a 5-day forecast!  Also, the thermostat gets its power from the furnace and doesn’t need batteries.

title: Rarely Works Anymore
text:
I’m in IT. My network and thermostat are working fine. Something with this app is majorly hosed. Occasionally would get “Thermostat would not acknowledge” alerts, but as of the last few weeks, they are CONSTANT. I know a few weeks ago there were app notifications about issues they were aware of - yet, at that time, I had no issues. Now, it’s unworkable. Here’s the funny part: the phone number listed in the alert and in these response to reviews is unreachable & a non-working number.
Prior to this - the integration with smart services was already bad. Out of 100 attempts to adjust the thermostat from say, Google Home / Assistant, it MIGHT work 4 times. The rest returns an error of “Sorry, I couldn’t reach Honeywell Total Connect Comfort US”
So much for smart automation with this thermostat/app combo. Time to shop for a more reliable thermostat with working companion application and integration capabilities.

title: Works really well
text: This thermostat is very good especially the Wi-Fi feature it also has the capability to set the number of cool and heat cycles per hour which reduces over and under shoot. The Wi-Fi feature allows me to monitor and change temperatures when I’m not in my house which has been very useful as I am gone for extended periods of time. The only shortcoming is it’s not clear where the thermostat gets the outside temperature is it appears to lag the temperature on the Internet when it’s rising and stays warm when it’s falling longer than the outside temperature. I agree that the technical support on the phone isn’t always clear but given all of the capabilities the thermostat has even the installers are always super knowledgeable.

title: Awful
text:
We’ve had so many issues since the install in August 2018, I can’t even list them all. Summary: we get an error message that the Internet disconnected and we cannot control our thermostat remotely with this app at all. I try connecting with Resideo and they state it’s a problem with our internet provider. I contact our internet provider, and they state it’s not them, it must be a hardware issue. I reach our to our HVAC guy/installer, they replace the unit and modem but still can’t get it to work. This morning, I thought to contact our firewall company (McAfee) and they got it to connect for about 10 minutes, and then we’re back to no connection. McAfee states it’s not a firewall issue and directs me back to the manufacturer, Honeywell/Resideo.
Meanwhile, we have a thermostat that works in our home but not via WiFi, which is a main reason to buy it!!! Tired of the runaround, and I’m back to trying to contact the manufacturer.
I recommend looking at other options...

title: Frustrated
text:
I’ve had this unit installed for almost 2 years. I live in AZ and don’t really use the heater in the winter so it isn’t really something I deal with then. Anyways, every summer, all summer long I get so irritated I think about tearing it out of the wall and replacing it with something that actually functions the way I want it to. I guess, I should have realized before purchase that you can’t just set times for it to change temps and have it work. 

I’m on a time of use plan with my electric company and during the summer I pay peak hours from 2p-8p. I have the thermostat set to lower the temp from 78 to 73 at 9:30 pm. It starts lowering the temp at 7:15. It takes roughly 20 minutes to cool the house those 5 degrees. Why can’t I just say “at 8pm cool to 73.”? Not before then. I shouldn’t have to program and reprogram making the time later and later in hopes that by telling it not to change temps until 10:30 it’ll at least wait until 8 to start that. So frustrating.

title: Worked well for 48 hours, not anymore
text:
On Oct 2 at 9:30 PM I got an error message that said the unit had lost connection to the internet at 12:55:51 AM on Oct 3. What?
Checked and the unit was still clearly showing connected to my network, but the app would no longer function, alternately having the temp control arrows grayed out or not even allowing me to log in (telling me that my phone wasn’t connected to the internet, even though it was). 
Went through the steps to reconnect (despite actually never losing my connection) to the WiFi, but nothing changed. Called the customer support number at 9:30 PM eastern time (which is 8:30 central time), only to get a message to call back during their “normal business hours” of 8 AM to 10 PM central time...chat was equally useless, despite their posted hours for that service ALSO claiming to go until 10 PM (an hour and a half LATER than I was trying to contact them).
I’m extraordinarily unimpressed with both this product and Honeywell’s support and will be returning it.

title: Good idea - poor implementation
text:
The app is handy because you can change the temperature from wherever you are, all you need is your phone.
However, I keep getting alerts saying that the thermostat did not recognize a change I made. The reason I gave that app two stars and the second thing that really annoys me is the schedule function. Again, great idea but practically useless..
For example, if you set up the schedule for 10pm to cool the house down to 67 degrees and not exceed it and for the wake time it’s supposed to turn on the heat to 72 degrees, the app won’t automatically switch from cold to heat or from heat to cold.
Meaning, if you want the heat to turn on, you have to do it manually on your phone. But that way there is no point in setting up a schedule since you are on your phone and could to the rest on your own?
I hope that will be fixed soon, app would be great otherwise.

title: Pretty Simple
text:
I have the Honeywell Prestige 2.0 thermostat. If I was rating that system I would give it 5 stars. This app, however, not as much. As a purely digital thermostat for someone that just wants to change temperature from their phone occasionally, it works. For anyone that wants more, it doesn’t.

I don’t understand why the thermostat in my house can tell me when I’m using the main heat or the auxiliary heat but the app can’t. I don’t understand why I can pull performance logs and heating history from the thermostat but can’t do it on the app or website. The information is clearly being collected, why can’t I access it?

I’m coming from a Nest E thermostat. In terms of thermostats, I like the Prestige better for the most part, although only being able to program four periods of the day is as asinine. In terms of app, however, I give the edge to Nest.

title: One and done
text: I’ve used Honeywell products for years. We have had our current WiFi stat for about 4-5 years without issue. I use the app solely to control the system. I couldn’t even tell you how to make changes at the stat physically because I’ve used the app the entire time. I love the season changes because our heat pump will switch from ac to heat on its own based on the temp I’ve scheduled. Those times of year where it’s hot in the daytime and chilly at night the schedule and auto settings pay off 100%. In the winter I schedule the heat to kick on just before we wake up in the morning and just before we arrive home in the afternoon. Makes the whole house more pleasant in the bitter cold months. This is a great app and the service we have received is flawless.

title: Great for a 3-thermostat house.
text:
Had three different programmable thermostats that required reprogramming when time-of-day rate periods change, all slightly different process and a major pain. Replaced with 8580wf units and I couldn’t be happier. Software is easy to use and programming from the desktop application is a breeze. Mobile apps in iPad and Galaxy S8 are identical too.

I could have had more functionality and data from the newer $200 Honeywell thermostats, but I got mine on sale at Home Depot and on eBay for around $75 each. Smokin’ deal!

One caveat: it’s easy to set and forget, which may lead to a little extra use if periods and set points are too generous for cooling. Pay attention and tweak the program after the first week or so for better system performance.

title: User interface is from 2004 but it works I guess...
text:
I feel like Honeywell has had zero creativity with this app... It would take me about 3 minutes to white-board a cleaner user interface with all thermostats and controls on one screen...  it also seems like it would be fairly easy to capture user info like trending data... “how long does it take to drop 1 degree on average?” 

Also what’s with the parallel apps with similar names?  TCC 2.0?  It’s confusing, make 1 app and focus on making it great...  you are aware there’s competing products like Nest right?   Can you please take a few notes from them and then look in the mirror?  

Honeywell your app developers have been surfing the internet, playing video games, loafing and cashing your paychecks instead of working for the last 15 years and it shows.  I’d recommend firing them and getting a whole new crew with some actual ideas and stuff.

title: Very effective tool!
text: This app allows adjustment of the temperature from within the building or from across the country. Whether you’re on your way home from work or returning from vacation across the world, you can adjust your thermostat and maintain cost effective energy savings from your smartphone or tablet. When you return home, you enter an environment that’s set to your exact desired temperature. Adjust for and accommodate unexpected weather changes in the blink of an eye.  Never enter an uncomfortable home or office again. Forgot to reset the thermostat before leaving?  Do it from your phone at the restaurant. Have to have an unscheduled meeting in the morning?  Make sure the office is comfortable for everyone before getting there.

title: Great Adjunct To Honeywell Smart Stat
text: Like being able to see what is happening to the environment in our home from my iPad.  Can adjust schedules and set points on the stat screen but it is much easier to do on the iPad and then download changes to stat.  An added plus is I don't leave fingerprints on the stat's touch screen!  Also, like to check status of system from wherever I may be.  Highly recommend.  This is an update from my previous review.  Still a 5 star thermostat as well as app and am still using the iPad interface.  Have added a whole house Carrier steam humidifier and this app as well as the stat work great together keeping our home’s humidity exactly where we want.  The stat also controls the humidity to keep our windows free of moisture in colder weather.

title: Glad I chose it!
text: Thought about the Nest but happy I chose the Honeywell. Love the look, love the fact it’s user friendly. Very cool looking and sure appreciate being able to control it anywhere from the cell phone on those days I expect to come home but plans changed. I was reluctant to install it using the enclosed instructions since they attempt to cover so many possible systems and wiring configurations but I was pleasantly surprised when I called Tri-County Air as they were the ones that installed the HVAC system for the previous owner of my house, when a tech named Michael said he would be happy to help. I texted him a photo of the Trane thermostat wiring and one of the new diagram and within minutes he told me where to attach each of 7 wires and why. Perfect install thanks to him.

title: Decent no frills basic unit
text:
With all of the smart thermostats out there like Nest this looks like something from 20 years ago.  If you’re looking for something that you just basically will only adjust the temperature up and down this works fine.  It’s very outdated though and for the price you’re paying u can get a lot more technology with other units.  This one actually does for the most part nothing other then set a couple of schedules throughout the day.  Honestly I wish I would’ve bought the Nest when they were on sale instead but whatever this works for now but I would not recommend it unless you pay no more than $99 per unit.

When you set up initially the thermostat does ask you for limits but you cannot turn them off or on later 

If you’re not into tech this may be perfect for you.

title: App is good but one major flaw...
text: Either the app or the thermostat will give a temperature reading down to 40 degrees but nothing lower! I am not talking about the minimum temperature setting, but the reading of the temperature in the house. I am in an area where I loose power frequently in the winter and I would like to know that the inside temperature is at say 35 degrees when the power is restored not just less than 40. When I close my cabin for the winter I want to know that the inside temperature is say 17 degrees not just less than 40. I have a heater in my garage and I usually decide to turn it on at -10 degrees but there is no way to know that the temperature is anything but less than 40. I had to buy LaCross Instruments internet connected temp sensors to make up for this shortcoming.

title: More than just one failure.
text: Both the Honeywell part and this app have failed on more than one occasion. First part is that the app does not show you when you are not truly connected to the thermostat, when it does the email is hours old. Secondly the first thermostat that I installed with the WiFi capability failed in less than a year. Third failure is when I changed the thermostat and the app did not have a way to change the thermostat on the app, it took over an hour and a half to get the old one removed from the app and new one installed. That was of course after waiting 43 minutes to even hear a human voice to try and trouble shoot the system. Lastly today after waiting again to talk to customer support I was informed that the app was not running correctly on their end and there was no estimated time of fix to be given, but the app still shows nothing wrong and that it is talking to the thermostat.

title: Good app overall; needs competitive features
text: The My Total Comfort app is decent app. It does what it intends to do with a somewhat dated interface comparative to the Ecobee and Nest systems. I installed 15 of the WiFi RTH6500 in a church building with ease. Even though those thermostats unfortunately require the C wire, some light rewiring of our existing furnaces was not troublesome. When it comes to the app and having 15 thermostats in one place is nice; however the 3 stars is mainly because of the levels necessary to run each individual thermostat. For instance, it would be great if the app showed the temperature and what program each thermostat is using in the LOCATIONS menu rather than having to click each system to check. It is highly inconvenient to click each of the 15 thermostats to see what temperature they are sensing. If Honeywell updates this feature then I would give them 5 stars.

title: It does just what I need it for.
text:
Been using the Total Connect app for many years to monitor and adjust the heating & cooling at my shore condo. For that alone it's been excellent. I've never had the need to setup variable schedules but it's there should that need arise. Being able to adjust the heat settings in the winter and A/C cooling in the summer months from the comfort of my home in the city is very convenient. Raising the heat setting prior to arriving for a winter getaway weekend or cooling down the condo in warmer months on the drive down can't be beat. 
My only hope is this app isn't "improved" in future updates and make it less easy to use. 
For now I really enjoy the functionality and usefulness of this app. Recommended.

title: Happy, Happy, Happy!
text:
Couldn’t be more pleased with the function and ability of the app.  We had our unit installed a day before we went out of town ... while out of town we tested the remote feature of controlling the thermostat ... NO ISSUES!! Dropped the temp, raised the temp and setup the schedule while 300+ miles away from the unit - couldn’t be more pleased —- new it was working when the Mither-in-law called and asked what was going on with the temp (she was watching our dogs) ... oops!!

We also appreciate the indoor temp + humidity readings, same for outdoors + local forecast, makes you conscious of those readings so you can take the appropriate action to keep your humidity and temp at a level that is comfortable for you!

As you can tell, I highly recommend the product!

title: Lacking features
text: Overall the app does well at scheduling and operating the thermostat remotely. However, I would like to have access to information such as operating times and energy reports for any point during the month. I only get one report each month and it is slightly confusing. The website and app does not allow you to look at past reports or make any kind of comparisons other than in the monthly email. I’d like to be able to see at any point how much time my system has been on or off and be able to see it on a graph based on indoor and outdoor temperatures. The app seems too basic for where we are today in this technological age. It looks like something I would see on an iPhone 3 or older.

title: Convenient and easy to use
text: We have been using the app for 2 yrs now. With 2 furnaces it was always a challenge syncing the temps between the two to keep the house in balance. Gone are the days of leaning on the wall and clicking through heat and cold setting across 7 days on 2 thermostats. It’s now a simple task done over a cup of coffee.  We also appreciate the online access and have made adjustments when out of town during change of seasons when needing to switch between heat and cooling.  Online support was excellent when we needed assistance when our router bit the dust.  I’m sure there are improvements events that can be made but overall it’s an excellent reliable tool.

title: Solid app
text: This app control my Honeywell thermostat via a Honeywell Gateway. There are also two remote sensors connected via the gateway. Though it is a separate issue, putting together the hardware into a functional network is very straightforward, if one carefully reads and follows the instructions that come with the gateway. The gateway hardware connects to a Honeywell server that the Honeywell Connect thermostat app accesses. It is through this connection that the app can control nearly every operational setting on the thermostat. It allows thermostat programming and control of current thermostat settings. I love being able to tweak the settings remotely based on the current temperature and humidity in the house. Also, I haven't gotten off the couch to adjust the thermostat since I got this thing hooked up. It's basic, but it works.

title: Works well, App missing a few things
text: We have noticed significant savings using our programmable thermostat. The app makes it really easy to program. It is nice to be able to turn the system off or on when leaving or returning from extended trips. Recently I noticed my system was not following the program in the app.  I could not figure out why. I finally found that the clock was incorrect on the thermostat. The thermostat defaulted to the schedule based on its clock, not my phone’s.  I was not able to set the clock on the thermostat without completely de-powering it. It would be nice for the app to show the clock on the thermostat and allow it to be set from the app / phone. You could provide an option for the thermostat to automatically synchronize with the phone’s clock.

title: Mostly Great
text:
For the most part we are really happy with the thermostat. We love being able to see and control the temperature of our home when we aren't here, or to do so from another room when we aren't by the thermostat...except when we can't, which is why I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5. At least once a month I'll get an "offline" message that doesn't self resolve and the only way to resolve it is to remove the unit from the wall and replace it. That's not the least bit helpful if we are out of town!! So now I have to teach a neighbor how to do that in case it happens before our next vacation so they can reset it for us so that we can continue to watch out home's settings while we are gone. 
We do like the integration with the Wink hub, which is a big convenience for us.

title: Good Interface, Very Easy to Use.
text: A pretty good interface and very Very simple to figure out and use.  Although with the amount of options and features these thermostats offer compares to the app well there isn’t any comparison.    You can basically only stitch the Heat/Cool setting from Off/Auto/Heat or Cool and Fan with similar Settings from Auto/Circulate/ or On. And than change the temperature up or down which is great to not have to get up and go to the thermostat to change,,, But it would be nice if the app also gave you information/ notifications of things like Air Filter Life remaining, Firmware Updates, HVAC-Heating/Cooling Status and any faults. Just “simple” things like that which you can easily check on the thermostat itself but Not the app.

title: Honeywell Support
text: My advice to all is to steer as far away as possible from Honeywell products.  Their customer support is non-existent.  I have a six zone system installed last fall, and have had nothing but trouble with the thermostats and the red link.  Support from Honeywell is ZERO!  I cannot afford to pay the installer to troubleshoot.  Honeywell recently became Residio, and now I am being inundated with emails telling me my thermostats are not communicating.  Daahh—this has been the problem all along.  Did someone finally decide to get the message?  Did it take a name change to finally hear the customer’s complaints? So now Residio/Honeywell decides to inundate me, the customer, with emails telling me what I’ve been saying all along.  Really?  If I could, I would give Honeywell a negative 5 stars.  Since this email can’t be posted without a rating, I will give them 1 star for having their automated system answer the phone and putting me on hold.  One final statement—use anyone but Honeywell.

title: Money well spent
text: I installed three Honeywell wifi units at my home. It was easy even for me. I had one question and called their support and they were fantastic as well. The app works flawlessly every time. I have had these units and app for over a year and I can honestly say it has saved money a lot of money. Not sure if it's just a more accurate thermometer that has saved me so much money the the power bill is way down since we installed these. Also, if you happen to be away and notice the unit is running yet the temperature in that zone is high, you are able to shut down the unit from the app so it does not damage your AC.  Not sure how it does with heat as I live in south FL.  Highly recommend this unit. My AC repair man recommended these to me.

title: Love my honeyWell Thermostat
text: I always wait a while before I write a review to see if the item continues to preform well. I must say it took me a while to write this one. Not because I did not want to but rather I forgot to. I must say that I am just as impressed with my Honeywell thermostat now as the day I installed it. Not only was it pretty simple to install even for a second rate handy man but the set up and use is even easier. Love that I can control I and monitor my home from anywhere. I did not get the top of the line, I can’t imagine what else I would need in aThermostat. I am so sold that I would never install or have installed any different brand. Sometimes five stars is just not enough.

title: Great thermostat!
text: This thermostat is the best one ever. Last one I installed was for dual heat sources but was not WiFi enabled. Living in Florida now just using heat pump. Love the WiFi features of the app on IPhone. Check or change anything while away. LCD went wonky & within a day the a/c company had it replaced under warranty. UNow it even switches between heat & cool automatically! Would have given 5 stars except for online web page to edit (delete)thermostat so the new one can be added. Almost impossible to find ID info. Customer support agreed and was told that feature is getting changed. I figured it out while waiting for support to answer. About 15 min wait & were very cordial. Overall very happy with this Thermostat! Everything works seamlessly.

title: Good, but could be great!
text:
This app works well. There are a few features that I would like to see added to this app:

1.  Make it easier to switch between locations (for those that have more than one unit).  Currently you have to navigate back to the beginning and then select the other location. It would be easier to just click a drop-down list or button for each location. 

2.  Show which location you are on!  When you have more than one device, you have to select the location. Once in that location there is no label to let you know which device you’re connected to. 

3.  Allow us to edit locations. Once you set up a location you can’t edit the name, devices, or even delete a location.
