4.  Add a vacation or travel ability. Allow the users to set schedule for whole trying. Even add a return date/time, so the system will revert back to the regular schedule before the person returns. 

5.  Add the ability for the devices to notify users if settings are manually changed, temp gets above or below certain temps.

These are good right now, but with the right developer programming I think these can compete with much pricier devices.

title: Ease of use
text:
This is the second Honeywell programmable thermostat I have purchased (the first one in the ‘80s). The first one was manual standing at the thermostat fixing the times. Now with this newer thermostat I use my phone. That is such a great feature. I have had no issues with programming. The only programming issue has been the submit button does not always “take” if you will and the temperature doesn’t change when I need a little extra or a little less heat/cool.

The one caveat is when I lost power twice and had to set up Wi-Fi. I’ve had to call customer service to be walked through the process. Don’t know if this is possible or not but I’d like to see the ability to program this from my phone.

title: Very Happy!
text: I am in no way a thermostat aficionado. I had an older model thermostat that was on the brink. I replaced with this. My hope was that I could manipulate my heat/cool system with a smart device. The directions took some time to read and digest. Luckily I did have an extra wire available to use for the “C” wire. Once installed and programmed, I was very pleased to find that I could turn on/off the system with my smart phone. Also, I can adjust the current temperature. These options come  in handy when at night I decide to turn the AC off due to outside temperatures dropping low and then early in the am I can turn back on the heat to warm the house all from the comfort of my bed! Love it!!

title: Totally satisfied
text: About seven months ago, I had my regular thermostat that was only five years old, replaced with the wi-fi enabled Honeywell thermostat. It has worked perfect. Couple weeks ago we were 300 miles away for a week and set the stat at a higher temp to keep the A/C from cycling on too often while gone. Before I got on a plane for a one hour flight back home I used the app to lower the temp to cool the house down. It was perfect inside when I got home.  My A/C company was also able to connect a two cycle feature on my system that they couldn’t connect with the old stat. Has lowered my bill during hottest summer ever. Have also connected the stat to Alexa, and can give voice commands to the heating cooling system.

title: FIX THE APP ALREADY!!!
text: For well over 6 months now the app has been more offline than on. I have reset my router many times, deleted and reloaded the app and contacted customer service multiple times, to no avail. Please stop referring customers to your customer service team because they do not assist with solving the issue with the app. Update it, period. **UPDATE** This app is the most non-responsive and glich-filled app I have ever had! What is the purpose of even creating an app when it is consistently either crashing or offline for no reason?! I even installed a wifi booster (no issues with any other app w/my wifi, but I wanted to try and do something to ensure that my signal is the most optimal), yet the issues still remain. Honeywell is a horrible company, bottom line. I’m currently shopping for a replacement thermostat with a company that actually stands behind their product. STEER CLEAR OF HONEYWELL...they are the WORST!

title: Convenient and Straightforward
text: Being able to adjust the thermostat anywhere is convenient. Especially in situations where you forget to to turn it off before leaving the house. The app is simple, straightforward, and convenient for a household that is on the go. I’ve been using Honeywell and the app for about two years now and never once had any problems with its connection, even when my Wifi goes out due to high winds. Once my Wifi is back online, the app reconnects itself and works perfectly (I do have the fastest internet service with Spectrum and about 6 months ago bought an Orbi from Costco to extend the WiFi capability in my house)

title: Lack of transparency on outages
text:
When it works I like this thermostat and app but when they have an outage it’s all but impossible to find out. Once again I spent a bunch of time trying to get it working and eventually stumbled on a report of an outage. They need to provide better feedback on their website when the system isn’t working so you know why your app no longer controls your thermostat. Mine still doesn’t work even though they say they’ve fixed things on their side. Updated: going into the second day and it’s still not working. Their website shows all services are running but you get an error when you try to update your password, indicating otherwise. Time to buy an Ecobee.
March 3 - messages all day about degraded performance
March 4 - system down for “maintenance”
March 5 - warnings about ongoing issues with degraded performance, but once again they’re “sorry”.

title: Great WIFI thermostat!
text: I absolutely love this thermostat! I installed it in a 50 by 100 metal building that is by my home. I can monitor air temp, program when to turn on or off or raise or lower temperature. I keep the heat on like 42 unless I’m going to work in there and then just turn it up using my phone. I have a basketball goal in there and my kids would go in to play and turn up heat to 70 and then not turn back down and it would stay that way for days running up a high gas bill, but now no more. It’ll easily pay for itself in a month or 2. I’m going to order these for my home now so I can easily keep up with what my units are doing whether I’m at home or away.

title: Basic thermostat with WiFi
text:
Basic programmable thermostat for multi-stage heat and AC systems.  The apps (iPhone and iPad) takes some getting used to, but they work well once set up.  Occasionally, the app won’t actually control the thermostat but will indicate all is working, so it can be a bit misleading but it usually clears up in a few hours.  

I had a Nest and believe it has the better interface but didn’t like all the data collection (energy usage and occupancy sensor) a Nest performs, collects, and likely sells about me, my family, and my house.

I own four of these Honeywell thermostats in three homes.  Being able to adjust the temperature in a vacation home and monitor the home’s temperature remotely is invaluable.  It’s a nice luxury to be able to do it from bed on a cold morning.

title: Great thermostat
text: Most reliable and stable device connected to our network, and we have many.  Have one in each of two houses for about 7 years now and both work great.  As we split time between the two homes, these devices enable us to monitor and control our heating and AC remotely.  Great to get the home to the desired temp as we arrive there.  Alerts us to power outages and remembers the settings when power is restored.  I never submit reviews but the Honeywell thermostats and app are outstanding.  They have never lost connectivity and required a re-boot (which we can’t do when hundreds of miles away) like other remote devices we use.  Totally reliable.

title: Buggy app, slow fix from Support
text: I've had the thermostat and the TCC app on my phone for 1.5 years.  In the last two weeks, I've been getting a popup warning on the app saying my thermostat is disconnected from wifi and can't be controlled from the app.  That's incorrect, the  thermostat is connected just fine, but I disconnected and reconnected several times to make sure things were ok, but the app still showed the message.  I called the support number listed, spoke with the rep who stated the problem appears on the backend service and will be escalated.  It's been more than a week.  So far, the app still shows the erroneous popup.  Other customers seem to have reported the same issue as seen in the app store reviews.  Can Honeywell dev tem move faster please.  I'm at the point of tossing this system out to get a Nest thermostat.

title: Great System
text: It is by far the best on line thermostat out there.  I love the fact that the display is alway on.  The colors and look of the screen are also user programmable.  You can see and read the display from across the room which is really handy.  The app is easy to learn, understand, and use.  We have a large house with two thermostats, one upstairs and the other down.  I installed them myself.  With even a rudimentary knowledge of wiring it was easy.  You basically use the wires from you all thermostat.  We had one of these for several years in L. A. And when we moved to Vegas this was one of my first purchases.  I highly recommend this thermostat and the app.

title: Great Thermostat
text: I have had one about a year and it’s been doing great.  I did have a situation last night where a component on our furnace failed and shut it down.  We were not staying at the home that night and the outside temps were below zero.  We came home the next evening to find the house at 40 degrees inside and falling.  It would have been nice if the app had an alert function to warn you if your home temp goes below or above limits that you can set, with defaults maybe at 60 degrees and 80 degrees.  Thanks for a great product and please consider this update to the app soon.  We could have had frozen/broken pipes if we had not got home when we did, and this app update could easily avert this situation.

title: Customer support nonexistent!
text: Thermostat is fine but WiFi feature is absolutely awful.  I bought this for the sole purpose of being able to set temps remotely.  After a few months of using the app—and perhaps because of a version update—it stopped working.  Tried on screen prompts, website FAQs, and finally resorted to a service call from the HVAC company that installed the system and sold me the product because the help line provided by Honeywell says “due to high call volume we are unable to take your call.  Please try again IN THE FUTURE.”  Well, in the future, I won’t be purchasing any Honeywell products.  Oh, and my service guy couldn’t fix it either, nor could he get through to his Honeywell rep!!  I want my money back but of course there is no way to get in touch with Honeywell.  What a racket!  Funny how when you write a negative review, it’s almost impossible to post!  Apparently every obscure nickname I choose is “already taken”!

title: Okayish
text:
The app is basic. Set your thermostat temperature and change the system to heat or cool. Nothing fancy and you get 5 day weather in the app. The frustrating thing, is that I have the remote sensor which does not show up in the app to tell you what the temperature is at the sensor nor can you change in the app where you want the temperature to be controlled at unlike other technology advanced companies, I can think of 2, but won’t list them here. I have to go upstairs to get the remote and change the location to thermostat and vice versa. I don’t want s reply back saying that the remote is mobile, since the thing is huge and I have an that I should be able to do that from. Please fix this problem. 

Also, it doesn’t seem to link well with Google Assistant. Every time I ask Google to do something with it, it says that the thermostat is offline or it says it will something, but the temperature has not changed. It’s like you talk to Google about Honeywell and it ignores you. Anything else that I have set up with Google Assistant works. 

The app should send notifications about the system status, if it fails meet the settings that you entered. 

Thank you.

title: make it 4 1/2; update to 5, w/an *
text: Installed the thermostat last December, and tho there were some early problems, none can be blamed on the thermostat or the app. I've got the power company critiquing my usage, so I don't need (nor want) the app or the thermostat putting their 2 cents worth in. Waiting to see how well the air conditioning is controlled, then maybe we'll bump it up to 5 stars. Update: A/C worked fine. 5 stars, as promised. One “yeah but ...” (*); I don’t trust the accuracy of the temperature reading at the thermostat, and I have noticed that it will change rapidly, on occasion, such as when I override with a big change (4-5 degrees or more). Maybe just the sudden movement of air? Idk ...

title: Excellent WiFi Thermostat
text: Since Installing it a month ago, this unit is working great!  It took a few days to “learn” the cooling system characteristics and during that time, set point temperature was not always maintained. But after that learning period, the temperature in the house has never strayed a single degree above or below set point.  It is perfectly steady and anticipates when to bring on the unit in advance so that it never lags behind. I do keep the temperature constant in the house, so the programming of the unit is pretty simple. My wife likes the ability to choose any color you want for the display. Easy to read and easy to program. Highly recommend!

title: Great App
text: I’m enjoying the convenience of being able to communicate remotely via iPhone with my Honeywell thermostat. There’s even a five day forecast in the app. The only reason I didn’t give it a five is twofold. The redlink internet gateway that serves as a link between the app and the thermostat loses connectivity when there’s any kind of power interruption. If you’re not home, you’re out of luck. Set up is actually easy, but made difficult by a few steps needed to access the part of the program on the thermostat that links to the gateway. It’s not intuitive at all. With some help from tech support, all went well.  If you can get by these two drawbacks, this app is great to have, and I use it all the time!

title: Product works as Designed
text: I would say that the app has always worked for me about 95% of the time. I have had the the thermostat for around three years and it has really helped me keep the temperature accurate in my home, which helps me keep my power bill lower than it was before I had it installed. The only complaint that I have is the recent APP UPDATE CHANGED the way the original icon appeared and it is now this AWFUL SOLID RED COLOR with WHITE LETTERS.  At first I thought it had been deleted from my phone, but because it was located in the same place as the previous one I finally realized it was an update.  Whom ever approved this change must have not looked at it regularly or did not consider how important a pleasant color choice can be to the average person.

title: Needs Updating
text: This app used to work great in 2018 when our thermostat was new, but recently we’ve had some major connection issues because they simply won’t update the software. I’m sure if we bought more Honeywell devices it would suddenly improve, but I’m inclined not to buy more Honeywell smart devices and get rid of this one as soon as I have a whole house system from a more reliable brand. I imagine that most people who use a smart thermostat are going to have s 2.5 and 5 GHz capable routers (The developer has commented that it should only be 2.5 GHz!). In 2018 I would have given five stars but now I’m giving a 3 - and that’s being kind. I haven’t changed my password in about a year but suddenly today my authentication keeps failing. Sounds like other people are having similar issues. Ugh.

title: Love it for the most part
text:
To be honest I have had very few problems with the unit I am using. For some reason the thermostat sometimes doesn’t like to listen to the app. On several occasions I have had to pull/power down the thermostat, let it sit for 30 sec to a min and then push it back on it wall mount. This resets the hardware/software connection. This took me a long call on the phone to figure out but is is the ticket to getting them to communicate again.  I have several zones in the house so only one place to go to control them all. 
I wish there was a way to set them all to a permanent hold together at a low temp when we go away. Currently I have to go into each zone and do it manually.

title: Love the thermostat and the app
text: I installed the thermostat over two years ago. It was easy to install and easy to set up the app. I set the alerts so that if there are small changes in the temperature in my house, the app sends me text messages and emails. For instance if the unit is set on AC and outside temperatures drop so the house becomes cold, the app notifies me immediately. This gives me the opportunity to  change the mode to heat, if desired. As an added benefit, the app also notifies me of any interruptions in my internet service.  This product works exactly as expected and is a great value.  I only paid a small amount to purchase the thermostat and the app and notifications are free. I recommend this product to others.

title: Works well so far.
text: I bought two of these to control temperatures in a vacation rental home in another state. I’ve had them a few months.  If you are controlling temps from another place, realize that they are Wi-Fi dependent. They work well as long as I can see them on my phone. My only problem is when my Cox Wi-Fi goes down, which happens a bit too often in this area, the thermostat loses the connection and the Wi-Fi often has to be manually reset. But that’s a WiFi problem. So far, I like them. I mostly use the permanent setting for times when no one is there. I like that I can cool the house down a few hours before I arrive. I will consider 5 stars when I’ve had it a while longer.

title: Remote WIFI Connection
text:
I just purchased and installed my 3rd Honeywell WIFI Thermostat for my primary home and one of two vacation homes. The first two had internal wiring from furnace to thermostat very easy to install. The 3rd thermostat a Redlink Interface Module because I had no wiring from furnace to thermostat. I purchased the following:
  - TH830R1003 touchscreen Redlink thermostat. 
  - THM5421R1021 Redlink Interface Module. 
  - C7189R1004 Wireless Indoor Sensor
  - THM6000R1002 Redlink Internet Gateway. 

I installed all units per installation guide. The connection to the internet is where I have my problem. The thermostat to furnace connection works in the house. 
BUT
When I went to register the thermostat online it continually failed. I would get to the point after putting in the MAC ID and MAC CRC which got accepted but when it asked to go to the thermostat and lower the setting for I assume the final step for WIFI Remote operation it continual failed 5 to 10 minutes of searching for a connection. I also contacted my internet supplier and had them open two “ports” that I had to do with one of my other Honeywell thermostats but still no connection. 
DOES ANYONE HAVE A SUGGESTION TO SOLVE MY CONNECTION ISSUE.

title: Still working out the bugs
text:
I brought this thinking it was a new product, but apparently it came out several years ago, the 404 sever error almost got me to return the product. After some searching found a work around ,  I was  able to register product, did the WiFi setup and finished the installation. I replaced my indoor unit so the air runs every 5 times an hour for 5 to eight mins. And keeps my condo cool, but the setting is set to much cooler than my old indoor unit and themperture control. So looks like  I will need to get a temp. , sensor unit to see if indeed the air temp. Is correct. Will update in two weeks. To see who is at fault for now . At night unit set to 75 feel comfortable, before change unit was set to 78. 
My old unit was 23 years old. Carrier change to Trane.

title: It’s darned good, but could be better
text: It took a while for the thermostat to reliably connect with my phone; after 2 weeks, the thermostat now responds to remote instructions most of the time, but still not all. I would like more time slots in the day to program. We live in Florida. Our heating/cooling needs vary with the position of the sun and how much various rooms heat up as the sun moves. For example, I need more cooling from 2-6pm when the sun is streaming through our large west-facing windows. Once the sun is low, we can back off, but we don’t want to go as low as the nighttime temperature yet. But, there are no more slots to handle this automatically. Other than these issues, I pleased with the unit.

title: Weak compared to Carrier Infinity
text: We have Carrier with iPhone app at one home and Honeywell iPhone app at another home. Side-by-side comparison, Honeywell app is weak. The Carrier is an exact duplicate of the thermostat UI and functions, but it's on your phone. The Honeywell does not have the same function or information as the thermostat. You can not correct date and time from app or thermostat. You can not set up or change a vacation mode. Installer has been back three times trying to correct time. Unit shipped to installer with Newfoundland time zone and he can not change it. It also disconnects from Internet and does not automatically reconnect. You must be home and re-enter wifi user name and password for it to reconnect to Internet. Manual does not match functions and menus. Installer on phone for hours on end with Honeywell and getting very little help. All of this for a $600 thermostat, professionally installed. No problems at all, ever, with Carrier by comparison.

title: Very good thermostat, but the app has glitches
text: The thermostat works great! And Honeywell Customer Support was very helpful over the phone explaining exactly how to wire the thermostat to my furnace (and they got it correct the first time, unlike the guy at the store where I bought it who was so sure of himself but ultimately was flat out wrong about the wiring). Again, the thermostat and customer support is great, but the app needs a little bit of work. The app keeps intermittently telling me that I’m disconnected from the network, even though I’m standing right next to my router and it’s connected with full coverage on WiFi on my phone and the thermostat, and all the other apps on my phone which require WiFi work fine.

title: Works really well for me in my commercial property
text:
Our particular setup was very challenging. We had to link to an older Honeywell system gateway.  This proved to be difficult because of a weak wifi connection  and the installation instructions were actually wrong.  Fortunately the professional plumber we used had installed one of these thermostats before and got it going.

Since then it has worked extremely well despite weak wifi and has saved us a fortune in gas bills while giving us great control over the building temperature.  We were able to turn on the heat while overseas during a sudden cold snap and our tenants are very happy with the better regulation of heat in the building.

title: Does what I need...
text: Except for closing the windows. My father-in-law blew up the old thermostat and fried some components with our old analog thermostat. Kept turning it up (higher temperature) when it was 100 outside and the house was getting hotter. He thought he was turning up the cool. I kept wondering why it kept getting hotter, would check and turn it down. Finally, by not resting it for 4 minutes, many components fried. I purchased the Honeywell thermostat and it has a safety to keep that from happening. Also good software as I can monitor the temperature from work and make sure nobody turned it down to 50 or something. Just need to plan ahead with the windows.

title: Never works, constantly failing authentication. Do not get this
text: Using this garbage can of an app has caused our house so much added discomfort, it cancels out any possible benefit that it might bring. We constantly find ourselves having to walk to the thermostat and set it manually when we want to turn the ac on. Why is this, considering it’s a WiFi AC controller with an app? Because their hosting is garbage. What ever they are using to maintain their network is a nightmare. We went a full week unable to authenticate to their servers, randomly it started working again, currently am unable to connect. If you enjoy buying products that were built to periodically let you down and test the very fibers of your already strained self, this one is for you. If you wanted some piece of mind, easy access to your beloved AC, and the ability to feel like tony stark using Alexa , don’t get this healing pile of garbage

title: Works Well With Multiple Sites
text: We have two residences with multiple buildings on each.  We rely on the Honeywell Thermostat app to help us manage them. Since we put all our Wi-Fi (including Redlink) on power backup (a mix of battery and generator) we have had 100% response and control across the varied mix of Honeywell thermostats plus hvac types and controls, e.g. one residence uses Redlink throughout, the other has entirely independent controls.  It gives us great peace of mind to receive rapid email notifications on hvac issues and corrections.  And, being able to check the systems and make changes from anywhere we get online. We highly recommend the app for its efficacy, simplicity and reliability.

title: Great thermostat
text: Just built our new house. The first Honeywell thermostat had a hard wired temperature probe that was under the eve, on the southeast corner of the house. With the sun shining on it, on a 30 degree day, it might register 40 or 45 degrees. This would not let the duel fuel unit switch from heat pump mode to propane. The installer came back after I identified the problem and install a Honeywell WiFi unit. It connects to the weather service and gets the temperature from our local airport via the NWS. 2 months later and it’s still working flawlessly. The app also allows me to check/adjust the temperature in the house from any location. I would give it 5 stars if you could have both hard wired temperature probe and NWS.

title: Works perfectly on our HVAC system
text:
Put this one on our lake house so that we can remote in, se what the house temp is, & adjust it accordingly.  It is especially nice when away, usually set temp to 85 degrees, then when heading to the lake set it down to 77.  House is all cool by the time we get there.  Also, I ultimately control the house temp, which is handy when “guests” are staying & mess with my settings(I have a daughter-in-law who likes to set it to 73, which is freezing to the rest of us) I can then “secretly” set it back up again.  
It has worked perfectly for me & I have not had any of the problems mentioned in other reviews.  It reliably maintains the temp I set.

title: Delighted with Honeywell
text: App works great and even has voice command on phone. Thermostat holds temp beautifully in Midwest house with massive windows. Temp never varies but .5 degrees either way. Circulate feature is great for upstairs unit when not in use all day and for moderate days when heat or air aren’t needed, or for keeping other rooms at temp by moving air. Appreciate the intuitive feature adjusting temp to scheduled time by anticipating the time needed depending on weather. Nice, big, easy to read display. Seems to know just what it takes to hold temp no matter the weather which are extreme ranges in the Midwest, could be 17 one day and 60 the next. Air or heat come on as needed in spring or fall.

title: Flawless
text:
I bought the Honeywell WiFi thermostat more than three years ago, and the Total Comfort app allows me to use the Honeywell thermostat remotely from my iPhone and my iPad.  The app worked flawlessly as I continued to upgrade my phones.
 Going from iPhone 6s, iPhone 8+ and now an iPhone 12pro,  I have never had any problems with the Honeywell thermostat or the Total Comfort app.  Every month I receive an email telling me what my usage was for the previous month, and the usage for that month last year to compare the two.  I am very satisfied with both the Honeywell WiFi thermostat and the Total Comfort app, and very satisfied with my purchase.

title: So far very good
text:
I selected this Honeywell thermostat after reading the terrible reviews (mostly reliability) on earlier Honeywell models. Honeywell seem to have learned a lot and the reviews on this thermostat were very good and on a par with competitors. It was very easy to setup and I like the programming wizard. It has a bright clear display and I love being able to access it remotely via this app which seems to work well. So far so good. I’ll update this review if anything changes.

A few months on and this thermostat is working reliably and well and the app is reliable also and I use it a lot to adjust the environment. There have been no Wi-Fi disconnections. I’m very pleased.

title: It is the best stat for the price.
text: Does exactly what it’s supposed to and does it well. There are smarter stats with more features but you pay for those features too. Stats that learn when you leave and come home cost $300 +! This one, I set up the 7 day calendar and if my schedule changes I can adjust easily via at home or on the app if I need to. This stat is smart enough to know that if you want your house at 70 (heat mode) by 6:30 am (I set stat back to 63 at night) how long it will take to get it to desired temperature. This stat does not change heat and cool mode automatically. Again, that feature is found in the $300+ stats. Hope this helps.

title: It works
text:
I’ve had it for over a year and it does what I wanted it for. To monitor temp in my house. It’s a bit fussy if/when you get a new router. But recent customer support went fairly smooth. I can only hope it works perfectly as long as the one it replaced. It was a Honeywell and was still working perfect after 30+ years. I’m happy with it and hope it keeps working for next 30+ years for my kids. 

Just read someone wants to have run time of furnace included? Please do not make any such changes or fiddle with anything that clutters it up and could ruin its reliability. My mom always yeld when water pump kicked on for house. So we would turn off water. But who really cares.

title: Works Well
text: I’m using this app to control five Honeywell thermostats at a weekend/rental property that’s three hours away. It allows me to keep the hvac at a money-saving setting when renters have left, and to set the house to a comfortable level just before the next renters (or I) arrive. It also lets me tweak the thermostat settings if there’s a forecast for unusually cold or hot weather. I’ve been using the thermostats and app for about two years and so far the reliability has been 100%. The app interface is very simple and intuitive. Even when I’m at the property I use the app to adjust the thermostats instead of doing it on the thermostats themselves.

title: Works great - not an easy setup
text: We are installing five of these thermostats in a church complex. The thermostat comes with operating instructions, but does not include installation instructions to set it up initially. You have to know more than the normal person does about your heating and cooling system. Then you have to find the “secret” installer instructions on the Internet. The first ones I found did not match the codes in the thermostat. We needed to call a technician a couple of times before we got all five of them installed properly. There are also a lot of codes and passwords to get through before you have it completely linked to your phone apps. That said, once you get them installed, you’ll love the way they work through the apps.

title: Not a Nest but very Good!
text: I had a Nest in my previous home and loved the sophisticated options, display and functionality. The Honeywell is good, very good but not a Nest, they have some work to do if they want to get there. But it works good, very nice, easy to install, sweet display, I like that it shows indoor and outdoor temperatures and the wife loves the color options on the display. The app for devices is easy to use, although changing the time setting was difficult, I did not select the ‘daylight savings’ box and had a difficult time changing it. That being said I called the help line and they talked me through it, kudos to the help desk. The operating manual did provide any help. 4 stars only because it’s not a Nest!

title: Thrilled
text:
I am in a wheelchair and don’t get a chance to crawl upstairs very often. So I installed this Wi-Fi enabled thermostat and cannot be happier! I can monitor the room temperature and the set point from my phone anywhere.  
The app gives you a monthly report of how much the AC and or the heat was on during the month.  The app will also allow me to get alerts on my phone if one of my kids is trying to “chill out “ in the summer!!  
I’m also going to buy another one for our vacation house so that I can turn the heat up before we get there. That way the house is nice and cozy when we walk in the door on a cold winter night.
It was a breeze to install and I highly recommend this unit to anyone!

title: Dislike new update!
text:
I own an iPhone X.  In the newest update, someone didn’t do their testing.  When you go into the “System” page where you can switch back and forth from heat to A/C, something we do frequently here in the summer in the PAC-NW, the red and green buttons you need to hit to make the system accept or cancel your changes are almost completely hidden below the black box at the bottom of the screen.

My second complaint is that in all previous versions I could stay logged in.  Now, each time I leave I am automatically logged out and for some reason my phone or the app. refuse to save my password so it means logging in *and* typing in my password every single time. Why can’t I just stay logged in as I used to?  It’s not like this needs to be a highly secure app.! It’s already protected by my phone. This is really irritating!

Finally, I wanted to contact customer service about these problems and could not find a phone number, email, or any reference as to how to contact them *anywhere* in the app.  I spent a lot of time searching with no success.  This information should be clearly accessable for the user.

Needless to say, I am not a happy user of this application right now.  I wish I could undo the current update! :(

title: Was initially good, but has gotten horrible over the last few years.
text:
They need to figure out how to get their servers to be more reliable. They have a lot of downtime, I don’t know many times I have come home to cold house because the app and web servers were down, and was unable to turn the heat up. And for when you are at home, they should  be able to connect to them through the local network. 

This year it has gotten so bad, I think I will end up looking for another device. It is great when it works, it just hasn’t worked that often anymore. And with a major company like Honeywell, you would think they would have something reliable. Look through other recent reviews, and you’ll definitely see more people with the same issues... 

updated November 2021. Still having network connectivity issues with app.

title: Don’t blame the Thermostat...
text:
I chose Honeywell because the majority of thermostats I have used over the years , (going way back to the old single dial units), have always been Honeywell. Programming any thermostat can be a bit clumsy, but all that has been removed with the ease and simplicity of the smart phone or computer “Total Comfort” app. Programming and making changes is a breeze and for use in our Airbnb and VRBO rental properties we love that we can do it all remotely.
 Adequately and efficiently heating any home relies on many variables. If you don’t feel your home is heating up or cooling down correctly, don’t blame it on your Honeywell thermostat.
This unit works great!

title: Love this thermostat
text:
Have to downgrade my rating after being forced to accept the new “term” that allows TCC to share ALL of my information with third party marketers. The terms includes that if you don’t want this you can opt out of each individual email. Depending on how many sales emails I am bombarded with, it may cause me to seek a new thermostat.

I initially thought I was having a connection issue while I was out of town. This turned out to be a user error which I figured out on my return. Once corrected I am loving this thermostat and the app. 

Bought it to monitor my unit when I am out of town but, being able to adjust from my phone or iPad before I come home from work or when I go to bed is such a fun convenience. The price is on the low end and I don't know what more anyone could want. I can even set or change the weekly schedule remotely.

title: Our Beach House on the Cape
text:
We have a beautiful house on the Cape, before installing our Honeywell wireless thermostat, we would drive from outside Boston to our house and during the winter, turn up the heat, and go food shopping for two hours so we were not in a 60 degree house freezing! After installing our TCC, we just raise the TCC to 70 the morning we plan to go to our beach house, and arrive at a warm house! We also do the same during the summer for our AC.
During the winter, if we expect a very cold spell, I’ll raise the house temp from 60 to 65 for those extremely cold days that we will not be visiting our beach house just to be safe from freezing pipes.
Thank you Honeywell!!!
/s/ Judy & George, very happy customers!!!

title: No more coming home to a cold house
text:
We installed this at least three years ago and we love it. You can change the temperature while laying in bed, laying on the couch, laying in the park, or laying under your car. We like to set the temp to 62 while we are on vacation and then turn the temperature back up when we are driving home. No more coming home to a cold house. 

My only complaint is that the instructions are nearly worthless if you have a modern dual fuel heat pump. It took hours, literally hours, of trouble shooting to get the thermostat to talk to my new hvac. I’m sure a tech could have figured it out quickly but I’m stubborn and cheap.   They really need to give you better wiring diagrams.

title: Working with Customer Service
text:
Installed the thermostat a few months ago and it has been great. It is in a garage that I work on a couple cars and some other things.  I just turn the heat or AC on a couple hours before I get there and I’m working in comfort rather than freezing or sweating. 

I did have an issue where the thing would not connect to the WiFi. I contacted customer service after trying all reboot options.  The tech was able to get inside of my thermostat and reset things and it works perfect now.  It took him some time because he couldn’t figure it out.  He was extremely patient on things.

title: Perfect for us!
text:
The thermostat came with our system. I was very excited because I can go on vacation and have the temp set lower in the winter and higher in the summer. Then, a few hours before I get home, I can use the app to adjust the temperature so the house will be comfortable when I get home.

It’s also great when I’m comfortable in bed and decide that I would like to increase or lower the temperature. I can do so without getting up. This is handy when I’m almost asleep and don’t want to start the process of falling asleep over again.

Later, when my thermostat stopped responding when I used the touch pad, I didn’t have to replace it because I can still use the app.

title: Sometimes works
text: I like to be able to check on house temp if I am gone for very long during cold Michigan weather. And so nice to be able to bump it up before getting home!  A couple of times it acted up but did resolve whatever was wrong. This time it kept telling me the house was 60 and I tried to turn it up before coming home. Opened and closed the app and nothing worked.  When I got home I was able to work thermostat manually . Internet is not down. It gave me no feedback on how to make it work. App will not work. It still sits here telling me it’s 60 even though I have warmed the house up. Now it is working again. I don’t know if it is because I activated the voice command. I Had to allow it which I didn’t want to do. I liked it just fine without the voice commands.

title: In control
text:
This is the best electronic device I have ever purchased and the price is ridiculously low. I have one for each of my homes and it's great to be able to see what the temperature is in each, and more importantly to try on the air-conditioning or heat when I'm on the way from one to the other. This was really a life changer!
Update: still love the device but since the update that changed the app to TCC the platform has become unstable for some reason. Almost every time I change the temperature I get the “red line of death “ saying change has not occurred even though if I continue into the settings it shows that the change did occur. Very annoying!

title: Wish it didn’t track my info
text: Works good most of the time. About once a month it just won’t connect with app and have to adjust manually. The one thing that bugs me the most is getting a year to year report of what I used vs what I use currently. Why is this info tracked? Why does this even need to be recorded? Seems like it invades my privacy when I never asked it or Honeywell to do this. Next annoying problem is asking every month to connect to xcel energy. I don’t want anyone adjusting the temperature in my house. Happened while I was away and overheated my dogs on second level and will never be allowed to happen again. Great tool to have if it didn’t track my usage and worked a little bit more regularly. Right now it’s just not cutting it. After over 2 years worth of use I’m ready to move on from this thermostat and app.

title: Good but needs a couple more features!
text: These units seem very capable and the app specifically is 8 out of 10 for user friendliness. I would really like to see a couple of energy saving features added to the app/thermostat if necessary. I would like to be able to know how often a unit runs each day, and I would like to know a history of manual schedule overrides. It would be helpful to know if people manually changed the temperature and when. It would also be nice to know how many hours a day the unit was running to tweak the schedule for maximum energy efficiency. I love being able to control them with this app and how it allows you to name the different thermostats to clearly manage all of your Honeywell thermostats.

title: Basic and Reliable
text: The user interface looks like it was designed in the iPhone 4 era or thereabouts and never really upgraded so the look and feel seem a little lacking.  That said it does what it is advertised to do.  It has about the same programmable settings of the 30 year old thermostat I replaced, and they can be more easily be adjusted on my smartphone than on the thermostat panel. It would be a nice feature to put the outdoor temp seen on the app onto the thermostat display. If I’m looking at my phone for outdoor temp, I’m not going to Honeywell app, I’m going to weather app.  But it would be helpful when without phone in hand in the house I could find that data on the thermo

title: Phil
text: I’m an engineer and a computer programmer.  For me, the unit was easy to install and operate.  The instructions were thorough and logical.  Programming was simple.  Anyone can do this provided they can exercise a little patience.  Took me less than an hour and I read everything.  Will do a second unit for my wife’s cousin next week because even my wife likes it.  Best of all is the information and control that’s offered on my iPhone.  This was the main reason for buying it as we’re only in the condo unit half the year and I wanted a reliable method to assess what’s going on with the heat/AC when absent.  Evaluated 2 others (Nest and Ecobee) and this was less expensive and preferred the interface.

title: Last Update Broke Login (updated)
text:
They just updated the app and broke the login. I can still login through the website with the same password, but cannot log into the app.  Found after a zillion attempts that if I uninstalled the app by deleting it from my phone, then reinstalling, the login worked. Not ideal. 

WRT features, the app is limited, but functional. App problems:

• No FaceID login
• No ability to turn off a vacation away setting that was set through thermostat
• limited settings. Most settings must be made through thermostat
• interface that looks like its from the late 90s or early 2000s
• requires additional hardware “gateway” to function with thermostat most thermostats as most of their thermostats lack built-in WiFi like nest. 
• app and thermostats lack the granular scheduling of a nest. You have only four periods during the day you can schedule: wake, away during day, home in evening, and sleep. 

We need an app that duplicates the thermostat. I need a thermostat that functions like a Nest with my variable speed heat pump. This is not it. If all you want is an app that lets you turn the heat up and down, adjust a very basic schedule, and activate the fan, then this is your app.

title: Great but as all electronics not perfect
text: I am a creature of habit and comfort like most of us.  It’s real easy to call something “junk” because it has some issues every now and then.  I don’t agree with this although I have uttered those words frequently. After the initial shock of not being able to use the device I go figure out why. Electronics are great but not perfect.  Saying that I have had this thermostat for a few years and it works very well 99% of the time.  When it doesn’t work I go reset my internet and wala it works again.  The device works great!! Thanks Honeywell for keeping the good products coming.

title: Web access and a user-friendly setup at the thermostat too
text:
I’ve had my new thermostat for about a week now and I’m very happy with it. I can update the temperature from wherever I happen to be. 

One small gripe, nit picking really, is that I can’t see all of the same menu options on my phone that I see when I’m in front of the thermostat. What I would like to see is status of the hardware while it’s on operation. I can see both primary and secondary for pump and air handler at the thermostat but I can’t see from the app. Maybe a Honeywell engineer is reading this and will include the functionality in the new release? Wouldn’t that be great!

But that’s the only negative. Easy to install and works as advertised. Go buy yours today!

title: The app is better than the thermostat
text:
I’ll start with the good; the app is easy to navigate and very user friendly. I feel anyone would feel comfortable using it. It also responds well with the thermostat, no long delay in data transmission. 

Now for the bad. The thermostat itself is not as good. It is easy to read and navigate through the functions. It would get five stars if it would follow the program I set, instead it does it’s own thing. When I’m not home, and have it set for a cooler temperature, it randomly decides to choose it’s own warmer temperature instead. I returned it thinking there was a defect, second one does the same thing. Tech support was useless. I’ll give it some time to see if things iron out. I’m not holding my breath.

title: Constantly loses internet connection
text:
Works great as a thermostat in offline mode. Learns when to start cooling or heating to achieve desired temp at the programmed time. Bought it to adjust temperature when I’m traveling and it constantly loses connection to the router in the same room.

Update: called support (long wait, but offered a callback option) and the agent was helpful, easy to understand, and was able to fix the connection issue (on Honeywell end, not my WiFi). Relatively painless fix and now working as intended.

As another reviewer stated, would be awesome if it recorded/reported daily runtimes so I could track cost-saving experiments, but that wasn’t advertised on the box.

title: At first was ok but then stop working- had re-register
text:
Clean design, worked great at first but then stopped working about 6 months ago (major PIA after getting used to having it) and the thermostat kept prompting me every 7 days to re-register- which I tried to do. To fix this I had to blow away my account and use a different account / email and re- setup from scratch. This worked and has been solid for the last week or so.
I wanted a Nest but my crappy contractor messed up the quote and stuck me with a Honeywell. Turns out that the Nest (via a co-worker) is not perfect either and has had some problems . I just bought a Nest E for a separate AC, guess I’ll find out for myself.

title: Top notch system.
text:
I have been using this app for three years now at my summer home and find it completely reliable and very handy. We have a forced hot air heating system and when I start coming up in April and May for weekends before moving up for the season in June, it is wonderful to be able to turn the heat on about an hour before I arrive and to get to a completely warm and comfortable home.  The air would be warm in much less time, but the hour gives the furnishings a chance to warm up as well. It's also nice on a cold morning to be able to push the temperature up a degree or two without getting out of bed!
Could not recommend the unit more highly.

title: Okay but…
text: This app is okay. It is handy when it works. In my case, it keeps showing wi-fi disconnected messages for dates and times that haven’t happened yet even though the time on the thermostat is correct. Maybe it can predict the future? Regardless, about 90% of the time I cannot access my thermostat because the app claims the thermostat is not connected when it is. When I contacted customer service they asked me to log out and log back in (which I have done many times) and remove and reload the app (which I have done a few times). Sometimes when I do this, it will reset briefly but then errors begin again. In short, a good app when it works and, in the app developers’ defense, perhaps the thermostat was installed incorrectly. I will be checking that next.

title: Intuitive!
text: Honeywell thermostats in my opinion, are one of the most reliable and intuitive available. The Total Connect Comfort app for remote access is among the easiest to use and also has an intuitive display of basic thermostat information. I always recommend Honeywell products to friends and family. That being said, the products and app lack options for reporting detailed temp, humidity, cycle counts, run time, energy usage, etc like most competitors offer. I am confident that Honeywell has the experience and know-how to implement these features and would love to see them in the near future. It would also be great if the 9000 series thermostats had a bit larger display and had a reenforced mounting back-plate.

title: Thermostats
text: Been running 3 Honeywell thermostats WiFi connected for about 3 years only having one slight problem but definitely not major problem one of the (same )thermostat goes off line occasionally but it doesn’t effect the controlling part. When we are away we like to control them or at least see what’s going on. Other than that no problems . Actually we we felt assured of the product we added another to a different location 1500 miles away and have had no problems. I recommend these units. Not sure when we will need to upgrade them or may never have to in the future. Maybe someone can advise

title: Needs help in accessibility
text: Don’t get me wrong, I love the thermostat. But I am a low vision legally blind user who uses accessibility options on the iPhone called voice over.  I understand that I only represent a small number of potential users for such a thermostat.  But there are areas on here that the voiceover accessibility option on the iPhone cannot read or even reach. One such area is the humidity for inside the home and it cannot read the outside temperature or humidity or even bring up the forecast.  I cannot read the area that tells me the current temperature in fan setting in My Home. I can however create a schedule and put the system on hold temporary and permanently. With a little work, I think the app can improve if somebody takes the time to understand the accessibility or lack of accessibility for a low vision or blind user.

title: RTH9585WF
text: The is full featured thermostat.  My main reason for buying it was it would go from hot to cold or cold to hot  automatically.  However, the activation of this feature was hidden in the opening screens and not in the quick start guide.  I complained and a Residio developer responded with instructions on how to access this feature.  Those instructions did not work either.  In frustration I downloaded the 76 page user manual, which was not included in the box.  Then I managed to blunder my way into activating the automatic feature.  This showed up on the unit’s screen and on my Ipad app.  Clearly some more work needs to be done to make this an easier process.

title: Love the app and thermostat
text: The Honeywell thermostat was installed in our new house, I saw the WIFI not connected message and decided to Google a manual to see what they had installed and read how to program it.  Being older than the app generation I didn't think I would use the app but I ended up setting up the account and getting the app on the IPad, sure glad I did, I love the app and being able to access the info from the computer.  I have not found one problem and recently accepted Xcel Energy's offer to join their summer cut back program to get their rebate, my expectations of Xcel are much lower than Honeywell, we will see how that program goes next summer.

title: Simple set up and easy to use
text:
I'm not sure I like the interface on the phone vs the web?  Yes they are similar enough, but couldn't find how to change the thermostat name.  The app itself seems to working well, have only had it a couple of days, so we will see....

Update: Now have two thermostats installed in two locations.  Renaming them is a must and, now I know how to do it...

I have to admit I really like this app now. So handy if you are traveling.  I also recommend using Alexa when indoors.  No need to physically go to the device or have your phone on you.  Please improve the stat functionality (weird function codes are not user friendly).

title: What happened?
text: Honestly this was a 4-5 star app because it did what it was supposed to do and fairly easy to use... until about a week or so ago, when finally noticed the issue. Thermostat says it's connected, it shows up in the app, so one would assume it's connected.... but any adjustments made through the app are not going through to the thermostat and hours later I'll get an email saying that the change didn't go through. I have logged out of the app and disconnected the thermostat from our network and reconnected and still no change. So what's the point of the app if adjustments dont actually get sent to the thermostat... or it randomly decides when that feature is going to work... and some time later, thinking it worked, you get a Change Failure Alert. You need to get this fixed quickly.

title: Honeywell - Total Control works great!
text:
I installed my Honeywell thermostat myself at our lake cottage. Installation and set-up was quite simple.
Since it’s a year-round home but we don’t use in much other than in the summer I’m able to monitor it from my phone which allows me to check up on it without having to take the long ride there. It’s also nice when we plan on heading that way and can adjust the temp so it’s very comfortable when we arrive.
Occasionally we lose power but both my WiFi and thermostat seem to get back online themselves.
I’ve had this unit for 6+ years, it is wonderful!
Thanks Honeywell!

title: Good, but . . .
text: The thermostat connected to this app is a dream.  While I would like a little more flexibility in an already flexible schedule template, it is really quite enough for most people.  The app, on the other hand, could use a little improvement.  The schedule interface, for instance, is a bit slow to link and, for me, organized backwards.  Rather than scheduling each day, I would prefer to make an overall schedule than input exceptions.  The connection is sometimes slow or spotty, but I have changed the schedule for my house in the overfly part of the US from Africa on occasion.  While it could improve, I haven’t found better.

title: Times do NOT stay programmed
text:
I have had Honeywell thermostats in three of my homes over the past 6 years. In the last 3 months I started to notice that the times that I programmed in were not being maintained. The app would consistently show a “temporary hold” when I never touched the thermostat or made a change in the app. In a region that can freeze this can be a serious issue if the wrong temperature is being “held”. 
Up until the past 3 months I would have given 5+ stars but now it only gets two because even though the programmed temperatures do NOT actually stay you still can spend your day checking your app and change the temperature back to the proper schedule. And as an aside there is no other person with my account info that is playing tricks.

title: Always the best
text: I have used this thermostat for years without any problems at all. The interface is easy to use and is detailed enough for you to program different areas of the house easily with each thermostat. I even use these Honeywell thermostat‘s on vacant homes that are for sale, to save my clients money in terms of unnecessary electrical bills.  When a showing is scheduled I program the app to cool down the house, or warm it up, an hour or two before the showing.  Then I can also turn every unit after the showing.  All from my office, 10 miles away, with my iPhone in my hand.  Extremely pleased with both product Nd this app.

title: Best thermostat out there .
text:
I had tried the Nest and it’s burning more boilers than any other regular thermostat . I asked many service techs and they said they have lots of costumer complaining about the Nest ruin their furnace . I had this thermostat since 2014 and no problems. Very reliable and actual and the communication between the app and thermostat is a second away almost instant. No problem if you only got a bar in your phone it works very well. Reads out humidity precisely. Like the warning options and very easy to control. And if you have a problem costumer support is very knowledgeable and they answer 24/7. 
Can’t go wrong  with this 9000 series thermostat

title: Completely awesome
text:
I purchased 2 of these a few months ago. I had a little difficulty getting them to connect to my router the first time but that was probably my fault as I am not totally proficient with wi fi.  

It is fantastic that while on the way home from a road trip the temp can be adjusted. It’s also great if you are completely lazy and don’t want to get out of bed to change the temp. Another great feature is that you can change the hold time to something other than the next set point. 
All of this can be done remotely even change the schedule. I cannot think of another feature that would improve this thermostat.

title: Love the new thermostat & TCC app
text:
Needed to replace AC unit at the beginning of this summer and asked for a WiFi thermostat.  Loving my new Honeywell thermostat and the Total Connect Comfort app. Wish I had installed one years ago. 

I have a place in FL and I plan to replace the thermostat there when we go back down latter this winter. Then I will be able to monitor both homes when I’m away and change the temperature hours or a day before I return. 

I did not get the Alexa compatible thermostat which is no big deal but was wondering why the Total Connect Comfort app couldn’t communicate with Alexa and therefore change settings on by voice.

title: I love it and it is easy to set and control.
text: On the internet or at the thermostat it is very easy to set and control the settings for both AC and heat. I love being able to set the temperature from the bedroom if it needs to be adjusted. I also love being able to set the temperature in the car or the airport when we have been away and want the house to be comfortable when we get home. I highly recommend! I don’t know how we got along without having the ability to adjust from anywhere.  The thermostat has worked flawlessly whether at the control or using my iPhone or iPad.

title: Works pretty well, bugs could be fixed
text: The app works great for its intended purpose, Honeywell did a good job of disassociating the thermostat with the first owner’s account. The only negative was the application on my phone kicks me out and tells me my credentials are wrong occasionally. I basically just have to reset my password, thankfully enough they don’t care if your new password is the same as the old so that’s a bonus. The app is an old version too, so it looks like my iphone 11 is an iphone 4 or older. This app probably just needs a good update to smooth everything out. Hopefully this actually happens, seems like this kind of support on this app is non-existent.

title: A very nice interface but should be so much more.
text: So I’ve installed three of these so far and absolutely enjoy using them. I like the fact the app is simple and not cluttered however there’s certain features that would make this app so much more beneficial to a user. It would be nice to have more history available to how many times the heat on mode is being activated throughout the day. Have a histogram of the set temp vs outside temp would be valuable. I also installed one in a barn with radiant heat and would like to set a threshold based on the outside temperature for example allowing the furnace to run based on the outside temperature differential of say 20°. Overall however it works very reliably, great display and set up instructions

title: Multi building fuel savings
text: I run a business in the cold state of Maine. We have three buildings used intermittently. The heat is kept very low when the buildings are not in use and so I can either schedule the heat for one or two days a week, or give the heat a boost if there is a once a month use in the space. All from the comfort of home, which saves me a 65 mile round trip just to adjust the heat. It’s so much more intuitive to program than other programmable thermostats, too. Additionally, because this is a rural area, I can tell if the electricity goes off in a storm by looking at the app! A great app for an affordable price.

title: Works great
text: I love the thermostat. It keeps our home more comfortable, the temp varies only a couple of degrees, it doesn’t cause our unit to run for long periods like the old one, and has GREATLY improved our electric bill. We didn’t realize how inefficient the old thermostat was until we replaced it with this one. I love having the app too for controlling the temp while away. Good internet wifi is essential for the app though.  We would occasionally lose connectivity but we’ve moved our modem closer and this should fix the problem. The internet issue didn’t affect the thermostat being controlled in the home. No other issues. I recommend the product.

title: Great ...WHEN it works
text:
We have had the thermostat for several years. It is so nice when it is working. It Randomly  tells us the password is not correct, then, then we’ve logged in to many times. Our passwords are locked in our devices & are saved or updated as needed. NOT wrong password being used. 
Last night & today, not working. So we have tried to go to developer site & are told “website unavailable” wth?! So now we are proceeding as we did before we started to go in the direction of a “smart” home. 
It is bad enough we can’t lof in, but then not being able to get to developer site to even ask for help...And this is not the first time.
Really poor consumer support. We are disappointed.

title: Limited capability
text:
This app works intermittently. Checked my local wireless connection and everything is fine, but many times the remote connection won’t work...and it’s typically the a problem with Honeywell servers. You rarely get a message from Honeywell when they have server problems so you have no indication if it’s on your end or Honeywell’s.

The app is pretty crude and missing some basic features. E.g. you only have 4 programs per day vs virtually unliking for other thermostats; you can’t program or change the vacation settings when you are remote (stay away for an extra day and you can’t change anything!! Just plain dumb). Their is no history, so you can’t see your usage over time and adjust accordingly.

Honeywell has making HVAC controls for a zillion years. How they are beat by the small thermostat providers is a mystery to me! They should be embarrassed by this app.

title: Awful since app icon update
text:
This app was fine, until about a week ago the company updated the look of the app as it appears on the home screen- no other updates really. Ever since the update the app malfunctions all over the place! The format will shift making you unable to select options for use, it quits unexpectedly and it doesn’t even express the true current functionality of what the thermostat is actually doing. Example: right now my app says that I only have the fan turned on, when in reality the air conditioning is on. This is not helpful at all when I am not home but need to control the thermostat. 

This never happened before the look of the app icon was updated.

Huge disappointment as the actual app itself needed much updating, not just the icon look. I wish I didn’t update!

title: Working well
text: I purchased this thermostat for a vacation condo I bought in Florida. I wanted a thermostat that runs a schedule and is connected to WiFi. For the price I think it works well, I can monitor the a/c temperature in my condo from my home in Indiana to make sure the system is running and keeping the humidity down when I’m not there. It also replaced an older Honeywell thermostat that fit the mounting holes perfectly so that was a bonus. My two year old home in Indiana came with a Honeywell WiFi thermostat installed by the builder and it’s been very reliable. I only wish it would give a humidity reading too.

title: Using Adaptive Intelligent Recovery, Love It
text:
Over the last three months of having this system, we have found the website is down to often and when this happens you are not able to use this app to access your system. Five times in three months is to many times. Its usually hours before your able to access. 

 This feature allows us to specify the temperature we want our house to reach at a set time. In our case we get up at 5am, so the thermostat over a few weeks figures out based on how cold it got over night when to start and gradually raises the house temperature to reach what we want by 5am. It been nice on those morning I’ve had to get us earlier for staff meetings and the house its freezing, but has already starting warming up. 

From the Users Guide:  Adaptive Intelligent Recovery (residential use only)—Over time, the Presitge® thermostat “learns” how long it takes your system to reach the temperature
you want. It turns on the heating or cooling system earlier to make sure you’re comfortable at the time you expect. The thermostat displays “In Recovery” when it turns the system on early.

Touch MENU and select Preferences, to change setting.

title: Best WiFi thermostat I’ve owned
text: I bought 2 of these to replace the round ones I’ve had for a couple of years. These are so much easier to use and it only took them a couple of days to figure out how long it takes to warm the house to the set temperature. The other ones never figured it out. Plus these show outside temperatures and weather. The idea of color schemes is nice except at night when the brightness is irritating. They should dim when the room is dark. The other minor issue I have is that at 2 AM one of them switches from black background to white until 3 AM or if I touch it.

title: Need auto select between heating and cooling
text: I’d have rated this app and thermostat a 5-star rating except for the lack of auto-sensing the indoor temperature and switching between heat and cool functions automatically without human intervention.  My home has 2 zones and the upstairs zone has the ability to switch automatically between the heat and cool functions based on the heating and cooling schedule programmed in using a Trane/Nexia thermostat and app.  If Honeywell Home could provide a downloadable firmware and software update that provides the upgrade to have the thermostat (which supports the first floor zone) as well as this app to support this feature, I’d readily switch my rating to 5-stars.

title: I love it!!!
text:
I just replaced my old thermostat with this Honeywell smart thermostat. The installation was so simple and straight forward. It took no more than 10 minutes. (Luckily the old thermostat had the C wire so that was not an issue).  With this app I can easily adjust the temperature, change the program, set temporary temps, etc. from my iPad or my iPhone. If I forget to lower the temperature when I leave, I can adjust it remotely with this iPhone app and set it to return to the program before I come home. So far the app and thermostat work flawlessly. 
I no longer need to go to the thermostat to make changes and I expect this will lower both heating and a/c costs.

title: Fairly happy with WiFi except inaccurate status display.
text: We are fairly satisfied with the WiFi thermostat (have one in each of two homes) except that the status (e.g. “heat on”, “fan on”, etc) is not always accurate.  I started noticing this when trying to remotely watch when the “fan on” status would shut off (status goes blank) on my other home and it never did which seemed odd.  So I then checked my fan’s status at the home I was in and noted the WiFi said the fan was on when it clearly was not.  I’ve noticed it will sometimes say “heat on” even after you hear the compressor and air handler shut off.    A little frustrating.  Especially when trying to use it to see what’s going on remotely.  Can’t rely on it being accurate.

title: Very good, but a couple improvements…
text:
First, I want to say I like the thermostat and the app overall. Two negatives I see are 
1) no timer/schedule for the fan. When I want to temporarily turn the fan on I have to remember to go back and switch it to auto mode. It should have a feature similar to temperature where it can hold until the next schedule change or until whatever time you choose.
2) no app access to vacation mode. I cannot set it remotely and I cannot change it remotely once it is set. So if I’m coming back from vacation earlier or later than I had planned, I can’t change it or take the unit out of vacation mode.

title: Best value for WiFi Thermostat
text: Love this as an upgrade for a 16 year old Honeywell programmable thermostat. This new WiFi thermostat looks and functions exactly like my old unit except we now have two thermostats controllable from our winter location.  Easy setup with excellent instructions. Only reason I knocked it down one star is that the software looks good and functions well but seems a little redundant for example after changing the temperature you need to hit <Submit> which is an additional step —verses another brand thermostat I have at our winter home when you adjust the temp its locked in. But overall impressed and would highly recommend.

title: Reliable + easy to use = a great investment!
text:
We’ve had this Honeywell WiFi thermostat since 2016 and are very satisfied with it. In all that time it has not worked only 3 times and 2 of those were because our home router failed. Only once was there a problem at Honeywell’s end and it lasted less than a day. 

It’s easy to program and change any time we want from our chair, bed or even our car on the way home from somewhere.  Outside temp and humidity readings seem to be quite accurate.  Same with the inside temp and humidity. 

Bottom line — we love it.  It’s been a great investment.

title: Easy to install and use
text: I had put an older Honeywell thermostat in our previous home. When it turned out our thermostat in our new townhome was not working, I went out and bought another Honeywell. This time, I bought the WiFi kind and installed it myself. It hooked up with our WiFi easily, and, so far, has worked like a champ. The directions were clear, and everything did what it was supposed to do. Now I can turn our heat way down when we leave Minnesota, and turn it back up in time to have the house warm when we come home. It’s great! Oh, by the way, I am a senior woman.

title: Not working right for weeks
text: We have a beautiful strong connection to the app.  However for weeks we have not been able to use it from our phones to adjust the thermostat due to what Honeywell is calling “ server issues”.  We send a command and it takes 1-2 hours for the system to receive it and respond which is frustrating and worthless.  Even worse there have been no communications from Honeywell  acknowledging  this!  We only found out by finally calling them after weeks of this crap and all they could tell us is “server issues” & were working on it.  Honeywell obviously doesn’t subscribe to the concept of communicating honestly with their customers or caring if they’re displeased.  We are researching other brands to replace our Honeywell- which is only a year and a half old 😡

title: Honeywell wifi thermostats
text:
I bought this wifi thermostat because of the honeywell reputation. I am very disappointed in this product. When it works, I really like it but it is unpredictable. There are times when it doesn’t respond. There are times when it responds and then tells me that it didn’t acknowledge the last input (but it did). 
Also if you want to change from heat or off or air cond. at the thermostat, Your finger tips have to be little girl size. 
When I had to change my router, the owners manual did not have the complete instructions. I had to call honeywell support for help. The technician (who was very nice) told me the manual doesn’t have complete instructions for a router change. 
I probably will consider another brand for my second home.

title: Reliable
text: I have had these thermostats for almost 4 years now.  Never let me down once. One in Arizona and one in Alberta. The two thermostats control both heating and cooling in both my houses. I have total control of both thermostats from anywhere in the world . The setup is simple thanks to Honeywells excellent and intuitive APP. At any time I can see the temperature in both houses. This is critically important especially in the cold winters in Alberta when I am away in Arizona. I absolutely recommend these thermostats for all you snowbirds, it will give you peace of mind knowing your water pipes are in good hands. Thank you Honeywell for a great product at a reasonable price.

title: Good, hope the keep it simple.
text:
Are we rating thermostat or the app?  All the thermostats are pretty much the same.  I DONT like the anticipation feature of the app where it tries to be at the temp you set it for at that time. It’s the Microsoft method, “let us determine what you want and we’ll make you do it that way, and we’ll ll make money off you”.  Listen to Bill Belichick,  do your job...  keep it simple and let us decide how to use it, stop monetizing my life.  
Biggest problem with the app is there are times where you can’t sign into it, it keeps rejecting your password. Usually you give it 15 minutes and it starts working again. Buggy cloud.

title: Pointless
text:
I got this so I could change the temperature on my thermostat wirelessly (duh). In the one day I have had it, I have had to get up to change the settings manually 75% of the time because the app fails to make the connection. This happens regardless of the device I am using, or its position. I have even stood in front of the thermostat, with line of site to the modem, only to watch the app fail to connect. What a disappointment. 

 Update: the company responded and I will call them to see if we can resolve the issue.

Update again: The device has started to work properly, albeit not consistently, so I have changed my star rating.

title: This app does the bare minimum
text: This literally does the bare minimum of what it should do for controlling my thermostats via my phone. It is nowhere near the app that Nest has. I mean literally the interface of this app is optimized for a iPhone 5. Not even full screen for an iPhone X which has been out for over 2 years. Trying to set a schedule on this app for your thermostats is worse than going to the dentist for an extraction.  This app really needs help to get it up to speed for 2017 and it’s almost 2020. You’re better off getting your thermostat on the Smart Things app but even then, it’s not much better for thermostats than this is. I’ve digressed now.  The only reason I gave this a 2 star rating is because it does do the bare minimum. Otherwise it would be a 1 star.

title: Works great
text: I had a new HVAC installed and the contractor recommended the HoneyWell thermostats.  I hesitated at first but I liked the idea of WiFi functionality.  Afterwards I’m glad I followed the advice of the contractor. The app has so much functionality.  The thermostats are partially locked so the kids can’t play with them and change heat to cool etc. yet I can change the system from heat to cool from the app during the seasons where it’s cool one day and warm the next.  I understand that it works with Alexa. I am looking forward to this feature because my wife is disabled and adjusting temperature by voice would be very useful .  The app is great as are the thermostats.

title: App not working
text: Not sure if there was an upgrade or not but for some reason the app and even when I sign on to the site on the Internet is not connecting and reading the settings I want. I would keep getting a message that I am not connected to the internet or that my changes were not made because of settings. When I view my thermostat, it’s connected to the internet. It’s just not connecting to the app. For example I want to turn on the fan. So I put it to the on position on my app, but the thermostat does not connect to the app so therefore the fan does not turn on. So frustrating! This is the whole reason I bought this WiFi thermostat and it doesn’t even work. I called customer service and the automatic message says they’re open, yet when I click the button to connect, it says to call back when they’re open. This is horrible.

title: Had for almost 5 years
text:
There were a few buggy things in the first year, not gonna lie. It works really well now unlike the POC (Radio Thermostat powered by EnergyHub) I have in another home. That one provides zero customer support. I mean absolutely none and it doesn’t function at all. Tangent - sorry. 
So the Honeywell awas buggy for about the first year and a half.  I had to call Honeywell about 8 times and the troubleshooting would take a good 30 minutes. It’s been trouble free for the past 2-3 years working flawlessly and I use it a few to several times a day almost every day.

title: Need to integrate all apps
text: With Honeywell’s spin-off of the Homes and Building Technology product portfolio, the newly formed company has been slow to develop software and integrate onto one platform.
