They have multiple apps for thermostats and I have a home with 5 different thermostats, and it is annoying to have to go into multiple apps to control the temp, humidity, etc.  The current technology is lazy and you have to bumble through to get things working.  The apps are full of glitches and sometimes the hardware looses connection to WiFi -I have an enterprise-grade wifi setup and there are no places in the home without full bars.  I have had these for a year and wish desperately that the newly formed company would gain a customer and product focus.  Nest has now integrated with multi-zone controllers, so that may be my next option.

title: I HATE THIS APP, but have no choice....
text: We got a new HVAC unit, and didn’t have a choice in thermostats, so we are stuck with one that has this poorly designed app.  Customizing temperature is just okay. Sometimes it carries over to the thermostat, sometimes not. Notifications are a complete JOKE.  They’re not pushed to your phone, they’re emailed to you. Which is absolutely useless when you don’t have your email pushed to your phone (why would I anyway) and only check personal email about twice a day.  And the emails are as useless as a bump on a log.  All I get are high humidity alert emails. I would much rather have push notifications.  I want more info as far as energy usage, someone changing the temp, etc....  I’m now trying to convince my husband to change the thermostats to Ecobee 4, but we can’t use Ecobee because of the variable fan speed on our HVAC unit. NOT HAPPY AT ALL. 😡

title: Great Convenience and Information
text: I recently installed my second Honeywell Redlink WiFi enabled thermostat. The app allows me to monitor and control the temperature and set up or modify the schedule at both homes. And the ability to have the desired temperature by the time I arrive sure beats coming home to s cold or hot house. I also like the ability to monitor the humidity so that I can make manual adjustments when I arrive. It would be nice if this were adjustable from the app as well, but now that I have an automatic humidifier that adjusts to outside temperature, this is not a requirement anymore. I really like having both homes conveniently monitored on the same app.

title: Lots of room for improvement
text:
It gets the job done, meaning I can remotely control the thermostat as I can from the unit. However, it lacks a lot of functionality it should have as a modern IoT device. 

I currently have four of these thermostats across two locations: two at my primary residence and two at a vacation home. It would be really nice to have preset configs for all devices. For example, preset settings that both lowers temps on my primary thermostats and raises temps at the second location. Currently I have to bring up each of the four thermostats and set each one individually.

Would also like to be able to see heating/cooling trending activity from the app. This data is tracked, as Honeywell sends it monthly via email. Would also be really nice to view this data on demand.

Lastly, I have to point out that the IOS app still has the GUI look and feel from several (many) IOS versions ago. Developers could at least make an attempt to keep the app fresh and up to date — beyond just the recent app icon change. 

Overall this thermostat and app have so much potential, but falls significantly short. Disappointing.

title: Easy to setup & use
text: I’ve been using the unit for several months now and have had no problems. I control my system from my phone more than on the thermostat directly, and enjoy the ability to turn my system on or off, or change the settings even while away from home. Setting up the unit is very intuitive and has worked flawlessly for me. The last couple months I’ve also been getting usage reports and comparisons with previous years, a nice plus.  Overall it’s affordable, intuitive, and dependable.  Best thermostat I’ve ever owned, would purchase again, and I have recommended it too.

title: Constant communication with thermostat issues. Time issues are also a problem.
text:
“Well back again and the issues have reoccurred. Worked right for 3 weeks but we are back to manually operating the thermostats. I surrender Honeywell has some kind of server problem. Error messages show goofy times of occurrence and times of the system are completely wrong.”

I wrote the above about 6 months ago and was prepared to drop 1 star. Things have changed since then and I feel to give 4 stars. I finally followed the warning notification and called in. Firmware was updated and it has worked flawlessly ever since.

title: Practical and dependable, needs HomeKit/Apple integration
text:
The app interface is easy to navigate and covers everything you need. There are times when there are errors- but having used this app at least five years now (maybe longer?) - the downtime is minimal compared to most IOT apps. 

The one thing missing is integration with Apple’s HomeKit. Because I knew this was not HomeKit compatible when I bought the thermostat, I didn’t subtract from the rating of the app. I thought it would just be a matter of time before Apple’s IOT hub would become a feature. Hopefully that comes soon.

title: Don’t buy
text: Honeywell WiFi thermostat such a hassle.  Our kids continue to get sick.  Every time our xfinity WiFi updates, we have to constantly reconnect the thermostat from wall and reset setting, didn’t know at first... the thermostat loses WiFi it goes to factory setting it’s just fall not even winter yet and our kids get sick when the factory setting does t provide enough heat at night.  Now I have to program the settings go downstairs unhook make sure the login works!! when first setting up to WiFi the thermostat showed connection but the app didn’t allow access, and I worried what if our WiFi goes out will our thermostat lose heat in winter and the answer is now yes, this is Not a reliable app or thermostat!!  Don’t buy, had it for six months and I have to reset it too many times and if you don’t want your kids to get sick avoid trusting this system!!!

title: Nice reliable thermostat
text: I’ve had this thermostat for approximately 6 months now and I absolutely have no complaints. I have programmed it for each day of the week and love it’s versatility and accuracy. It is great to be able to control the temp by your phone and it has never given me a problem. I have suggested this product to a number of my friends after they saw mine and now they love theirs also. It is cool that you can change the background color on the screen to sorta blend into your home decor. I have no complaints and it has performed flawlessly as long as your WiFi is up and running! Highly recommend!!

title: Value Thermostat
text: I’ve had my Honeywell thermostat for nearly 3 years. It accurately maintains temperature. It was easy to set up it is simple to program. Since my routine frequently changes and I’m sometimes away from the house for long periods of time, I often just set it for permanent hold. With either my iPhone or Alexa, I can easily warm or cool the house prior to returning home or, if I forgotten to before leaving, after I’ve left the house. I set an Alexa routine so that when I say good night, it automatically sets the house to my preferred nighttime temperature. The display is customizable and very easy to read.

title: Honey well thermostat
text: This thermostat has made it very easy to control our home and it also monitors temperature. This feature saved me a lot of money and also a very big mess. We where in Disneyland and I kept getting notifications that the temperature was too low in our home. I had programed in high and low set points and our propane tank was empty. I called my neighbor and he verified what I suspected. The tank was empty and if the thermostat had not alerted me we could of had our water lines to freeze. We had new hardwood floors, and I shutter to think what could of happened. Thank you Honey Well!!!

title: Basic on/off function works, but scheduling is buggy
text:
We just moved into a home with a Honeywell system, and we were pointed to this app for remote access. And indeed, using it as a simple remote thermostat usually works, though the app sometimes forgets my login credentials.

Unfortunately every time we set up a schedule, we find that the heat turns on and off at random. We’ve wiped out the schedule and started from scratch countless times, but somehow bad data is corrupting our schedule.

Combine that with the fact that initial setup is absurdly difficult—it requires a serial number that isn’t on the unit itself, but only on a printed card that was supposedly in the original packaging—and you begin to realize that the system needs a total overhaul.

title: What a piece of junk software from 1990s
text:
Paid $200+ for a thermostat only to find this application that was probably made at the same time when iPhone 1 was released and was never updated ever since then. Apparently people in honeywell do not care about aesthetics at all. #fugly #dated app, this is the oldest app I have ever seen on my iPhones in ages... what a shame Honeywell. Hire a web developer for christ sake. Or just pay $500 to a freelancer to redo this horrible app. I have no words for you. Your website looks like it was abandoned 20 years ago and the company is out of business.

——————-
Can’t believe someone is actually working on this all and updated something two weeks ago. That person should be fired, literally in fire! This app is a joke and looks like it was made a decade ago or even more, from windows XP time. And this sucker updated the ICON! You gotta be kidding me...

title: Time saver
text:
I had to replace 12 unit at three of our buildings for our church. We have been using these units for about three years now and I cannot tell you how much time they have saved us in keeping these buildings in control and we love the monthly reports on each unit. We love the remote monitoring of each unit. The thermostats haven very easy for groups to adjust and then the return to our set schedules. I do love the alerts that they send out on the rooms conditions and filter.
Thanks for making our facilities more manageable and giving us time to send on other church needs!

title: Very Nice Thermostat
text:
I have had a couple versions of the Total Connect Thermostat, all have done what they say they will do with no issues! My current thermostat is the first one used with a heat pump... still no problems, works well and is easy to operate/program.
One thing I would appreciate is the ability to control the use of the auxiliary heat-so I could set the heat temp at a higher amount and the heat pump alone would get it to that level regardless of how long it took. Now if I raise the temp more that 1 or 2 degrees in certain instances the auxiliary heat comes on immediately to get the temp up.

title: Fun!
text: I love being able to remote control the thermostats, and the app is easy to use. I can turn on the ac when we’re half an hour from home, or turn it off quietly from my bed. Gives a whole new stealth dimension to the ac wars (you know, where the kids try to override your settings...). Also it’s fabulous troubleshooting tool, as you can sit quietly in one place and set different parts of your system to cycle on and off to figure out what is making that pesky noise that’s bothering you. And it’s just plain fun to be able to open an app from anywhere in the world and see the temp and humidity at your house inside and out.

title: Shortcomings When the Power Goes Out
text:
Unlike competing products, when the power goes out when the thermostat is set to Vacation or Hold mode, to reactivate the thermostat setting when the power is restored, this thermostat actually requires a human to touch the screen.  Obviously if the homeowner is away on vacation this is impossible!  

This is a major disadvantage in comparison to other popular brands of programmable thermostats that restore to the vacation or hold mode when power is restored. This Honeywell thermostat does not allow the owner to restore the vacation mode or change the hold mode remotely from the Honeywell website or the Honeywell app.  

Someone was asleep at the wheel when this thermostat was designed.

title: Replacement for a competing product
text:
Purchased this product after much research to replace a competitor’s product that died after 7+years of use. Have used this smart thermostat for 4 months. 

Installation and Setup was straightforward and easy to perform for a DYI. 

Features - I am disappointed with the very basic feature set in the application. No push notifications, no usage reporting, vacation mode not accessible from the application.  I used all three of these features in my previous smart thermostat frequently. Using the web site on a mobile device was clunky. 

The basic feature set works very well. I can monitor temperature, set repeating schedules, hold temperature and see operating status easily. The thermostats held temperature well over the past heating season. I saw no significant difference in operating costs/energy usage. 

Value - Initially I was very disappointed with the thermostat cost versus features available via the app. I felt misled about the capabilities of the application vs the fuller web interface. I have mellowed a bit but still feel the app should deliver more of the thermostat features.

title: Great stat, but could use more screen features.
text: Graphing of indoor, outdoor humidity and temperatures would improve the stats functionality. 24 and 48 hour graphs would be helpful. Duty cycle graphics and statistics would help, especially if fuel estimates were included. Pulling local barometer, wind speed (and direction), weather, along with the already present outdoor temperature and humidity readings would enhance the device also. Having the room temperature show on the app graphic (like the clock app that shows the time) without opening the app would be cool. The present device and app is a good start, but improvements would make it a killer. Thx

title: Review
text: We bought this thermostat for our cottage. The set up was a nightmare with virtually no help from the support team x 2.  Eventually on our own we discovered we were using the wrong app and setting the thermostat up after we were on the correct app was much simpler. As for working with the thermostat over the past 6 months, it has performed with no problems. We live 3 hours away from the cottage so we are able to change the temperature on the thermostat as we leave our home and arrive to find the cottage at the set temperature. We are pleased so far!

title: Nice product
text: I bought the Honeywell wifi thermostat because we are always in a hurry and would often leave the ac or heater on. Unit was easy to install and even easier to set up a schedule. Had a problem 1 time where a power outage unset something in the thermostat. Used the online service and they promptly walked me through on how to set it up properly and had it working in no time. The app is updated often and I have no regrets purchasing the thermostat. Have had it for about 8 years and if it ever fails I would definitely buy another.

title: Not as good as it could be.
text: The reason for my low rating on this device is its inability to heat and cool at the same time. What I mean by this is to be able to heat when necessary and cool when necessary without me having to change the system from heating to cooling and so on.I live in Florida, sometimes in the morning when I wake up it’s only 40° outside. Later on in the day after sunrise the temperature warms up for example today when the sun rose it was only about 50° outside. Right now the temperature has gone up to 79°. So this morning or overnight I would’ve need heat,Later on in the day I need the air conditioning. I have to manually change the settings each time I want heat or air conditioning. This is the main flaw with this product.

title: Very Easy Installation and Startup
text: I replaced an existing Honeywell thermostat with the smart version about 3 weeks ago.  Though a different size enclosure I was able to use the same mounting holes to fasten to the wall.  The wiring was an easy swap to connect the right colored wires to the terminals. Once I powered up I simply connected to the network and followed the instructions on the quick start sheet to set up the account and download the app. All went flawlessly and has been working great since. This is for our cottage up on the bay and a real treat to have it warmed up before we arrive.

title: Nice to use
text:
To start, I would’ve gave 5 stars but the app has been having issues with logging in and keeping me logged in. I’m sure there will be an update that’ll address that issue...

I’ve got an older thermostat but it works good. The way my home is set up, the thermostat is in the hall in the back of the house and our master bedroom is in the front of it. It is nice to be able to grab my phone in the middle of the night and adjust the temp - when I first got it setup, my wife said that was just being lazy but now she too uses the app on her phone and now she loves it (as long as we’re not experiencing any login issues).

title: Incorrect temperature
text:
update:
This is a creepy app. It turned on the fan in the mid of the night while none of us ever touched the app. In the app it shows the fan is on. I contacted their customer service and trying to know what happened. They answered and say I need to monitor the voltage of it, great, so then it has nothing to do with their app and I need to buy some equipments which cost more than the thermostats and then monitor and record it 24/7. Well done Honeywell.
Original:
Ok, what is the most basic function? Set the temperature. It is showing different number in app and on the controller. Controller IS connected to internet and so does the phone. So, you thought you set the temperature, and it is not on, why? On the controller it is not reflecting the change. A mess app. If it is out of sync, at least should notify.

title: Total meets my needs
text: This is my second WiFi unit. I liked the ability to set/ adjust settings remotely and at the unit, and these complete both functions without problem. I also appreciate it when the thermostat loses connection with WiFi (which is a problem with my router, not the thermostat- which has been resolved). It may not have every bell and whistle for high tech officionados, but for folks wanting customizing your heating and cooling needs, this one does an excellent job.  Instructions are straight forward and clear. The app is simple. It does not compile stats. I receive those from my utility company.

title: Good App, Could Use Some Updates
text:
Overall the app works well but could use some work and added features. 
1. There is no way to see the history of what the system has done for any time period. **Fixed with monthly email summaries!!***
2. While the application gives you information regarding whether the system is running at that time or not, the wall unit does not. **Fixed!!**
3. There is no way to set the fan to run on a timer. This would be very useful. Right now I’m turning the fan on when I need it, and setting a reminder on my phone to shut it off at a specific time. I know I can schedule it, but it would be easier to have a timer than change my schedules every time I have a unique circumstance.

title: Honeywell Wireless Thermostat
text:
Have had a Honeywell Wireless Thermostat for 6 years.  Easy setup.  Use it all the time, especially for traveling.  Can set temp for heating low when traveling in the winter & then turn up on way back so home is warm when we arrive. Same for cooling in summer. Can be controlled wherever you travel. Also has notification when you connectivity with internet.
You can also have it set if temp drops below a certain temp to notify you, letting you know of a possible furnace malfunction. Even have it synced with Alexa to change temp by voice command.

title: No more sleeping walking at 2 am
text: I was simply just looking for a WiFi thermostat so I could turn on and off my heater from my iPhone when it gets too hot or cold in my house. I really got tired of having to walk down stairs at 2-3 am to turn on or off my thermostat because it was too cold or hot. With a simple touch on my iPhone I can turn on or off my heater from my room or Las Vegas. Lol Thank you so much definitely a blessing. As far as automatic temperature controls I don’t use them much but let’s be honest it hard to regulate automatic temperatures that are going to keep everyone happy.

title: Great thermostat
text:
Unit does exactly what I expect.  The ability to monitor and set the temperature is great.  Our primary residence is in Phoenix AZ bites have a summer home in Prescott AZ but must return to Phoenix once or twice a month for doctor appointments.  We leave the temp set to 85 but it is great to be able to log on not the thermostat the night before our trip down to our the valley and turn the setting down to 7( so the house has a chance to cool down before we get there.  The notification of power outages and restoration of service is very handy also.

No hesitation in recommending the unit to others.  Setup is easy and the app easy to use.

title: Use one at home and three in a Bible Education Hall.
text:
They offer great flexibility for scheduling temperature control for HVAC systems.  
The higher end T-stats have a hygrometer that records the humidity.  While I’ve only used the Stats for temperature control set points (SP) the humidity reading process variable (PV) has been helpful with scheduling temperatures.  
For the basement zone, If the humidity goes over 60%, I will make adjustments to the SP to cycle the system with greater temperature drops at night to pull more moisture from the zone.
I am only a user with limited privileges, but I believe the Techs can receive alerts on the app...

title: 5 year customer and it lacks updates/features
text: I’ve had 3 thermostats for 5 years. I keep hoping for some sort of update to the features but nope. This morning updated to the terrible looking updated icon. I see no new features, just a much worse looking (all red) icon. I’m about to switch over to Ecobee thermostats so I can see how often the unit runs, track temps as they change, etc. If you want a SUPER basic interface and control, then I suppose this is for you. Just don’t expect any updates or added features. The look and functionality of the app is at least 10 years old. Very disappointing. I have it two stars because it typically connects every time and hasn’t given me many issues for what it is. I’m done holding out for new features though.

title: Great app but no run times.
text: Overall really like thermostat and app.  Have 4 systems in house but only one of these and waiting as want to have daily run times and history of runtimes. Looking for other options unless the app updates add that feature.  My old existing ones work good for that and are basic touch display, but prefer the bright colored display with Honeywell’s touchscreen and other functionality. Also app feature to have multiple thermostats displayed on a summary screen, like see all 4 thermostats with ability up change temp from summary screen on any one of them. Then can drill down to detail screen for each to program, reach more details.

title: Very Disappointed
text:
This device keeps cycling my AC and heating units on and off unnecessarily.  I’m afraid my units will not last because of this.  This could easily be fixed by the swing function which is built-in but disabled by the manufacturer.

Also, the temperature reading is not accurate.  If it’s displaying a reading of 82 degrees for example, and I set it to 75, the temperature reading starts dropping rapidly when the unit is turned on and within 15 minutes will get to 75 degrees and then starts turning on/off in about 10 minute intervals.  The temperature reading is definitely not accurate and I have confirmed this using other temperature readers. Unfortunately, I bought two of these for the two units I have.  I’m very disappointed to say the least.  It could very easily have been a great device.

title: Gets the job done but could be better
text: App looks great and has most of the basic functions you would look for to control the WiFi Thermostat... But it could be better.  At minimum a simple “Away” function would be great.  This would allow you to quickly set the thermostat to away temps when leaving the house for several days without just turning off the system (circulate the air).  Geofencing would be awesome as well; here’s where the away function would come in handy. Have had some server connectivity issues during big weather events but other than that this app and the WiFi thermostats do their jobs adequately.

title: very limited functionality
text:
works for setpoint and mode changes only. can't program schedules. can't batch changes to multiple thermostats. does not allow weather responsive automation despite there being a weather forecast in the app display. the app could automatically switch systems off during pleasant weather or signal users to consider just opening windows. such a feature could also preheat or pre cool in advance of extreme weather that might exceed system capacity. but none of that cool stuff is implemented because of lazy software development. i'd even pay a small monthly fee, say $1/mo for really cool stuff like weather compensated setpoint automation. also no geofencing for automatic setback and recovery. no home kit/alexa/google home integration. missed opportunity for demand response aggregation with payments to flowing to end users should be possible but isn't. again because the developer isn't focused on this product or is lazy. 

there's a huge installed base of red link thermostats with tons of energy and environment saving opportunities that are foreclosed because of the unnecessary limitations of this app and service.

title: Worth having!
text: I’ve had the WiFi connected thermostat for a couple years now. It’s been a great product. The app is easy to use. It sure is convenient when you leave town for a few days. During the winter you can keep an eye on your home temperature from wherever you are in case something goes wrong. If you turn your heat down or your A/C off while you’re away for a few days it’s so nice to be able to turn it back from wherever you are and come home to a comfortable house again. I recommend the WiFi thermostat from Honeywell.

title: Works Well
text:
The thermostat (I have two of them. One at my residence and another at my mother’s house. This review applies to both) both are pretty straightforward with the install and function flawlessly. 
I DID have to add the ground wire however to both systems, but after that no issues.
They have far more features than we’d ever use, but they’ve worked since their install over a year ago. The same can be said for the phone app (iPhone 7). No matter where I am, I have complete control over the environment at either house .
Just what I needed.

title: Total Connect Comfort is just that!
text: I’ve owned my Honeywell WiFi thermostat for a few years now. It has never failed me!  It was easy to set up and is extremely easy to use. It is nice being able to heat my home before I arrive.  The system also alerts me when the power goes out. These alerts allow me to assess the length of time without power which is very helpful since I keep the refrigerator partially stocked in the winter. The app is very user friendly, flexible and intuitive. It also displays the local temperature weekly temperature predictions.

title: Ok expecting more (Former Nest User)
text:
7 months ago we had to replace all of our systems.  Each system was tied to a nest unit and we were very happy.  The installer suggested going to a Honeywell thermostat to match the features that we had along with better compatibility with the HVAC we purchased.  So far so good.  We have had to reboot the gateway connecting everything together a couple of times to restore the ability to remotely control our units. 

The biggest draw back / complaint is the lack of seeing run time inside of the app.  With the nest units I could see my run time and tweak the schedule based on findings.  Having that knowledge was extremely valuable and lacking with this unit.

title: Some apparent connection problems
text: Ever since your Total Connect Comfort App has been recently updated, it continues to show incorrect information for two of my three thermostats.   It says cannot make a connection, but when I click snooze and go to the thermostat anyway, the thermostat continues to respond to mt settings request. It shows those two thermostats red with a yellow triangle in the upper right of each box.  I also get a request that asks if I want to log out.  In no case do I get an indication on the thermostat display that indicates the internet connection is lost.  Must be something in your server.  These errors are disconcerting. If i’m away, I cannot guarantee that it took my commands. I have three 9000 series wi-fi thermostats.

title: Great thermostat
text:
Maybe I gave it 5 stars in relation to the useless one it replaced but I love this H’well’s functionality. I found it fairly easy to set up although I would like more definitions in the ‘advanced’ installer section to ensure I did it correctly...

The ability to check temps from anywhere has already paid off, having forgotten to set vacation temps. I was able to set temps back from the airport. I also like the notification feature because we live in a tropical area and humidity levels are critical and I now would know if our home’s level was exceeding the set parameters.

Overall, excellent unit, IMO.

title: Can’t live without It
text:
Gone are the days of burning up in the middle of the night and tromping downstairs half asleep to adjust the thermostat. 
We’ve had this for a few years now and LOVE it. It used to let us program the temps according to day and time, but I believe that stopped after an update early into our owning it. 
HOWEVER, the rare times when the system is down for maintenance is when you really appreciate this! 
My husband does all the programming of it and the WiFi so I can’t speak to that part of the experience, but I’ll never own a manual thermostat again. 
I love that I can change it just by picking up my phone and using the app!

title: Doesn't work 75% of the time
text: I have no idea how this app has so many good reviews. I've had it for a year now, and 75% of the time it just flat out doesn't work. It is the glitchiest app I have ever used. Often I have to force close it, log out and log back in, delete it and re-download it, etc. in an attempt to make it work. That works occasionally, but most of the time nothing helps. I'm going on 3 days in a row now of the app not working at all no matter what I do. I would recommend you buy a different brand of thermostat from a company who actually cares about quality control. From a developer's perspective, this is a basic app to maintain, so if they put any effort into it at all it would work just fine. But apparently once you've bought their product they don't care about customer service anymore. What a shame.

title: Great Thermostat
text: If you have an oil furnace this Wi-Fi thermostat is very simple to install and works perfectly every time. it’s not complicated like some of the more expensive fancier types - resetting is simple you just remove the faceplate. customer service is also excellent if you have for have to troubleshoot it. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants a trouble fee the Wi-Fi thermostat. I’ve had mine for several years since they first came out and I just love it. It’s great to be able to check your temperature and change it if you were not at home.

title: Updates are a problem
text:
I’ve been using this thermostat for over three years now. I like the functionality of the thermostat but the updates cause problems. It seems as though every time there’s an update I have problems getting the thermostat to work properly for a few days. I wish the updates weren’t so disruptive because then I’d be giving it 5 stars.
Update. It seems a lot of the bugs have been worked out. I’ve had much fewer problems in recent months. Also love the comparison from year to year energy usage with daily temperatures.  Keep up the good work!!

title: Very pleased
text: Very pleased with these thermostats. I have 5 controlling my 2 systems with 5 zones. Incredibly reliable!  I switched from the Honeywell Z-wave thermostats that were terrible unreliable (z-wave chips constantly failed) and frankly aesthetically ugly. The only downside is I can’t control them through my Tuxedo controller or Total Connect app, but using the Total Comfort Control is not overly burdensome. The TCC app is just like using the actual thermostat directly, with full control. Another huge drawback of the old z-wave thermostat was almost not functionality at the app. No ability to change schedule. No ability to do permanent vs temp hold.

title: Love it, when it works
text:
I’ve had this thermostat for over 2 years.  Great invention, but can be very frustrating.
I lose connection often, even when everything else in my home is connected to WiFi.  My iPhone will show “not connected to Internet” and may tell me to login.  Most recently, I go into the app on my iPhone to turn the system off and it says device is off but it isn’t.  I then have to go to thermostat on the wall to turn it off.  Same happens with turning it on or adjusting the temperature.  I have reset my wireless router and pulled the thermostat off the wall to reset it.  Called Tech Support and the recording said they have too many calls so try another time!  Ridiculous

title: User Friendly
text:
The user interface on the App is pretty much a mirror image of the interface on the unit installed in the house.

The only thing I needed the instructions for, was connecting the app to the device, which was also simple.

I have not programmed the unit yet, however it all is self explanatory and in plain English. When do you want it to start, end, what temp, etc.

I'm excited to program it for this winter, we like having the house cooler at night and warmer during the day. Now we won't have to remember to change the temp manually anymore, or before we come home from shopping...we can turn up the heat remotely for a nice warm welcome home.

It's been nice this summer to be able to monitor the house temp when away during the day and make the house more comfortable for our pets. Yeah, a little ridiculous to pay for AC for our pets, but a neat feature to see the house temp remotely none the less.

I've been telling my friends and family about this. Pretty cool stuff!

title: Very nice App
text: This review is for the total connect comfort app. I’ve read other reviews which discuss limitations that are actually with the thermostat and have nothing to do with the app. This app is a very well designed and very intuitive. It syncs with the thermostat almost immediately and provides all the necessary functionality you need to control the thermostat remotely. It does not include access to the advanced features on the thermostat itself as you would expect anyway. The layout is very clean and easy to navigate. It’s exactly what I would expect.

title: OK, but missing a great opportunity
text:
Functions fine, but every time I look at the "72*" icon, it pisses me off!  To be proactive about climate change, nobody should EVER have their thermostat set at 72, but we have this "set and forget" mentality and the icon totally reinforces that.
So... it would be great if good energy conservation was BUILT INTO THE THERMOSTAT AND THE APP!! -Even suggesting or building in defaults that are a few degrees higher in summer and a few degrees lower in winter would have a very good impact on energy use and GCC emissions AT A NATIONAL LEVEL!!
Could even let folks choose their desired conservation level/algorithms and give them estimates of $$ and emission reductions (projected and real-time)!?  Sure we could!!!
I have more good ideas!!

title: Excellent so far
text: No difficulty setting up the device for internet access. Using only 2.4Ghz WiFi was not an issue for my router. Wiring to my furnace was simple too. Did it by myself using same wires on an old (really old) Honeywell bi-metallic thermostat. In the past few years, have only lost contact with the device on two occasions due to server side issues but no outage lasted more than a few hours. Couldn’t be happier now that I can get the house warm before arriving. Also have a Honeywell thermostat at work with similar capabilities and no issues.

title: Saved us!
text:
Having the thermostat app on my phone saved us from a disaster.  The new thermostat was installed with a complete new HVAC system.  We planned to be away from our home for 2 months during the heat of the summer.  After 4-5 days, when checking the temperature from my phone it was over 90 degrees indoors and I couldn’t remotely set it lower.
I notified the contractor, who came to the house to find the condensate drain plugged with installation debris.  Had I not had the remote, the unit could have overflowed from the attic installation and caused major damage in the house.

title: Excellent but NO GEOFENCING Yet
text: Most everything about this Honeywell thermostat appeals to me. It works very well and reliably locally and from my iPhone. The thermostat display is outstanding. At a glance I see current settings, inside, and outside temp/ humidity data - all clearly displayed. In fact, I recently removed a Nest thermostat and reinstalled the Honeywell thermostat because the Nest display is so incredibly lacking. The only thing lacking, and this is a major deficiency, is geofencing. That is the only reason for the three star rating. My iPhone already communicates with the thermostat so I cannot see a single reason why the phone software cannot monitor the phone’s GPS and do this as Nest and others do.

title: Works consistently well
text: I’ve had this for 4 years or so.  Long enough to know if it sucked, or got bogged down by upgrades that would complicate it or change the functionality in some dumb way like the weather channel apps tend to do.  No bad news to report whatsoever.  It’s a decent simple app that is consistent, and separates zones and functions appropriately, and has good alerts.  It’s nice to go to use an app in a rush and have it be what you expect.  Much Better than iHome app and the Apple home thing, both of which i use to control other items and both of which are mediocre or stink.

title: No more midnight barefoot runs to the thermostat!
text:
Step aside watch. Move over light bulb. Take a knee internal combustion engine. 

This app and the thermostat that goes with it are the modern inventions that will take human life to the next level for an incredibly small amount of money.

This app gives me full control of the thermostat in my home from anywhere I have cell service. No more wondering if I left the heat on during vacation. No more stumbling down the stairs to the thermostat when my wife is uncomfortable in the middle of the night. No more waking up babies sleeping when I trip over toys on the way to said thermostat.

title: Simple to use once set up
text: I needed help from a friend to get it set up and connected to my furnace (which is just over 20 years old). Once it was set up it has been easy to use. I really like as I travel I can check on temp inside and know it’s working (live in a very cold climate in winter). This gives me peace of mind and I don’t have to have a friend check on my house to make sure it’s ok. Also as I drive back home after having it set lower while out of town I can turn it up a couple of hours out and come home to a warm house. Perfect!

title: It’s been pretty good
text: After about a year of using TCC to control the electric baseboard heaters in my Colorado Aframe I am pleased with the system and I would never want to go back to the stupid little rheostat dial controls on each unit. This has made my cabin much more manageable and comfortable and I’m pretty sure it must have paid for itself in savings by me being able to turn it down remotely when cold weather is not a risk of damaging my property.  I definitely recommend this system and would install it in any other similar properties I end up with.

title: Absolutely terrible!! STAY AWAY!!!!
text: I bought this honey crap for thè sole purpose of the wifi option and being able to control the unit through my phone. Every time I enter the application it tells me that my wifi has been disconnected. I’ve checked my thermostat multiple times and the signal strength has always been great! Every night at 2-3am I have to wake up and walk to the other side of the house to either turn down the heat or turn it on. I’ve tried to return this piece of crap but they wouldn’t return it. Now I’m stuck with it. I’ve seen many complaints about this issue through these reviews that have been posted 2+ years ago and you guys still haven’t addressed this issue. So if you’re here reviewing the product before purchasing, STAY AWAY!!!!

title: Nearly 3 years after the announcement of the iPhone X, this app finally fills the whole screen.
text:
One of my biggest pet peeves is when developers don't care enough to update the aspect ratio of their app to fill the screen on iPhone X and newer. It's such an easy thing to do. The most recent update finally fixed that issue, however there are still some bugs. The most noticeable is that sometimes the temporary hold temperature will read the wrong number after setting the hold (even though the thermostat itself got the change). 

In general, the app just looks tacky and outdated, and it's slow to respond sometimes. Otherwise it works fine.

title: Great idea, poor execution and frequent issues
text:
When the system works everything is great and it’s very nice to be able to monitor and change temperatures remotely or from your couch at home.  

The problem is that the hardware/app are not fault tolerant and most of the faults occur on Honeywell’s side from what I can tell.  

I have a 1gbit network connection with solid WiFi coverage throughout my house yet I routinely have to reset one of my thermostats to reconnect because it lost WiFi connection.  Another routine problem is that I have an inability to login to the app whereas I can access their website fine at the same time.   Or, occasionally, the status displayed on the app is completely out of sync with the thermostats.   

So I would steer clear of this app and Honeywell thermostats in general if you need to control your system remotely for an extended period.   

If you’re home most of the time and are willing to put up with occasional headaches then the app is fine.  But that’s an unacceptably low bar from my perspective. 

I really hope Honeywell is able to fix the issues and I’d be happy to write a more positive review at that time.  

.

title: Works well now
text:
But before I could get it to work I had to remove my linksys 1200 and install a  much older Wi-Fi access point. I could not get it to link no mater what to the linksys. That slows down the other things I use the internet for in the shop .  Secondly the actual thermometer only goes down to 40 deg F I needed a Wi-Fi thermometer just in case because I’m not always there and didn’t want the shop to freeze. I can’t see why the actual temperature couldent be sent to the app above 40 works. So to
Me if they would fix that snd also just install a tiny WPS button for automatic Wi-Fi that would make it perfect

title: Remote Control
text: We have a lake home and when we are not going to there, being able to monitor temperature and adjust heat and humidity is awesome. We were alway nervous to leave for a few days in the winter but can now relax with a comfort level we know what’s going on. It does require the internet to be working but if you have good internet reliability  I highly recommend Honeywell thermostats. Ours are six years old, we have them in our townhome also and they have been flawless.  Can monitor and control both homes from the same app!

title: Good Tech
text:
I have three installed and all work as promised.  Note that you need a common wire and 2 of my 3 installations didn't have this existing so it took a bit more work to install. The other issue is I still have not been able to resolve is on one stat, the virtual buttons are not synced to the touch screen.  You need to touch the screen below the actual button.

Link my stats to my Wink hub home automation system which works well.  One stat often looses WiFi connection. 

. I have 2 different model thermostats and a Honeywell alarm system and each requires a different app.  Could be more integrated.

title: Almost there
text:
This app works pretty well. My biggest complaint is it seems to randomly not log me in user and pw are in my keychain so they are correct. It just seems finicky. I guess that’s better then letting everyone in😎.
However it’s really nice to be able to modify the settings from any place in the world.
I travel a lot and it’s wonderful to be able to set the temperature to be comfortable when I arrive back home. Saves a lot of energy because I can now adjust even for quick 2-3 day trips I did not used to do for because of the hassle of coming back to a hot or cold home.

title: New Privacy invading Residio Terms & Conditions
text: Buyer beware/read the fine print!! There is now a new Residio T&C that users are required to accept in order to continue using remote control features. Of course, the new T&C requires consenting to the unfettered collection of all device usage and virtually every data point they can possibly collect about your home. Your usage habits can be used by Honeywell/Residio and shared with nameless 3rd parties to market to you, without any guarantees to anonymize your data. Most Americans would be uncomfortable with this and so am I. Declining the T&C renders the smart features of my thermostat useless, since there are no local network control options/APIs. I will be ripping out my Honeywell thermostat, deleting my TCC account, and replacing with a smart thermostat that doesn’t spy on my home. I encourage other users to do the same.

title: A second grader can develop a better app
text:
I can’t understand how Honeywell has such a low level basic app. The worst part is every other time I open the app, it is logged out. My user and PW are saved, so, I click to login. It doesn’t connect and tells me the connection was lost. This is garbage. It’s been happening since I got the thermostat and app in Mar 2016.

Another weak feature, or, lack thereof, is changing the temp. I have my system on a schedule, but, on these hot days in FL, sometimes when I get home in the mid-evening, it’s still very hot. When I walk in, I will grab my phone and drop the set temp two degrees so the unit will run for a few minutes, giving me a quick cool-down. The problem is, there is no dial to select the start/stop time to adjust the temperature change versus the scheduled time. So, instead, the time is set at 11:30 pm and I have to click the time in fifteen minute increments. Meaning, that if I want the temp to stay at the desired new temp for four hours, I need to click the down or up button 16 times (fifteen minute increments). 

That is ridiculous. A seven year old can realize this is lame. So many apps use a dial system such as iPhone’s clock app.

One star, sorry.

title: Losing patience
text: This is the 4th WiFi enabled thermostat I’ve installed in 4 different homes. I kept buying Honeywell for each new house because of the features and peace of mind that our vacation property was heated when we were in our primary home. I’m considering going to another brand due to random outages. Last time the app was down for several days on all devices. Tech support got back to me two weeks later saying “we assume your app is working by now”. Now I can’t get one of my two thermostats to show up on the app (professionally installed 4 years ago). The WiFi works, the thermostat is connected to the internet. The app isn’t registering that the thermostat is connected to the app. Instead of coming home to a warm house I’m still troubleshooting why I’m cold. Defeats the purpose of the technology. Researching alternatives.

title: Love my new Honeywell Wi Fi Thermostat
text: Purchased my Honeywell Thermostat about 3 months ago and so far it is working real good. I’m using at our cottage about 225 miles from our home. In colder weather I change the temp in the cottage from 55 to 72 degrees when we are about 70 miles from the cottage. When we leave I reset the temp to 55. In the warmer months if it gets real hot I can bring the temp down to around 75, again when we are about 75 miles from the cottage. We can also monitor the temp from home and make any changes or corrections. System also will alert us if temp falls out of range. Great system.

title: Overall, great!
text:
The app, the thermostat work perfectly and it’s terrific real time I can go see the status online and change the thermostat just like I was there. We have a mountain house 7 hours away and can be months before we get there. Now with our Verizon WiFi we set up for ourselves, we can control the HVAC along with other devices and cameras we have.  

The ONLY negative I can say is the website seems to be up and down often enough to where you worry about when you can connect again. Outside of that, as long as their site it up, this thing works perfect!  They work on their site’s reliably some and it’s golden!

title: Resideo has ruined this product
text: I have been using this app for over 10 years and have 71 thermostats at multiple locations for our customer.  It was great until Resideo bought it from Honeywell.  Now the server is extremely slow, multiple alerts for failed commands received by thermostats, 20-30 seconds just to open the app (connect to servers) ghost thermostats appear when adding to your location, the list goes on.  The customer service rep try’s to help resolve issues and is courteous but has no understanding of the products themselves.  I am a licensed contractor and am speaking honestly about how bad this has gone downhill in quality.  This product will most likely fall into the poor category very soon unless Resideo corrects these issues quickly.

title: Great App!
text: This app is everything we could hope for. Clean and intuitive layout and operation. We have three Total Connect Honeywell thermostats, two zones at our primary home for both heat and A/C, and one at a vacation cabin also controlling heat and AC there. We are always monitoring and controlling one home from a distance and the thermostats and this app have worked flawlessly for us. In fact it works so well even for the home we are in at the time we adjust thermostat settings and system controls from the app, not the thermostat on the wall!

title: Love my thermostat
text:
I never dreamed I would say that about a thermostat......but it is true.  I can be all settled in my easy chair deep into a book or journaling and feel slightly cool or warm. With a quick opening of my phone app, I can adjust my heat or cooling 1 degree, 4 or 10 degrees with equal ease.  I can be at the office, check our home temperature and adjust it up or down to match my time of arrival.  So easy. 
As much as I like that thermostat simplicity, my favorite new option is the Circulate mode.  It so keeps our home uniformly heated and cooled all with no additional equipment!!

title: Automation Rules
text: I bought Honeywell because of the reputation and my history with their products. I really like the screens and the ease programming. I have three controllers one for a downstairs freestanding heater, one upstairs and one downstairs. I have a dual heating air-conditioning system. Works very well once in a while there’s a glitch but I can usually figure it out pretty quick. I know I have saved quite a bit of money because of the control that I have when I’m at home and when I’m away. Plus the cost to buy them was reasonable.

title: Works ok, but clunky and outdated
text: We got this as part of a furnace upgrade, and the thermostat itself works ok, but the whole thing is outdated and behind in capabilities compared to competitors. We had a Nest in our previous house that could do much better than this, including learning behavior and anticipating when to turn the heat up or down. This only has a day and night setting, which is disappointing, as we don’t want to run the same temp when we’re gone at work. It also doesn’t have smart capabilities to learn and optimize/save money when we aren’t there. The overall interface and app UI is outdated and slow, and needs a full upgrade to be on par with other apps of its kind.

title: Needs Work
text:
I like the thought behind the app, but it needs work.  It should have so much more functionality that resembles choices and functions on the actual thermostat.  Especially the air filter warning.  It’s as if they don’t understand how people use the app. The purpose of the app is to replace going to the thermostat. Yet only the wall thermostat has the alert for the air filter.  And if you have your thermostat set to turn the display off when not touching it you will miss when it’s time to change the filter. 

Also, there will be numerous times that the phone app loses connection with the thermostat and you have to log back in.  And when you check the thermostat it never lost connection with the internet.  It was on the app side.

title: Some very important updates needed
text:
This app functions Ok for the most part. 

Two things that need updates:

1). In Arizona we have peak energy times. During 3-6 pm I would like to be able to schedule the thermostat to pre-cool before that time and turn off during the peak time. 
I still have not been able to make that work without leaving the air on cool all morning only to turn to “Away” mode during the 3-6 period. Which kind of defeats the purpose of a programable thermostat. 

2) second is not as big of a deal to me, but the look and feel of the app is a little outdated. When I first downloaded the app I felt like I purchased an old thermostat. Always nice to feel like you purchased something of quality when there are so many other options out there to choose from that seem to be more focused on the customer experience. 

I work for Honeywell’s aero devision and chose this thermostat to be loyal to our brand, but without some of these updates I could see myself updating to a thermostat that has more programming options for the Arizona area.

Thanks!

title: Dependable
text: I have a Honeywell TCC in my vacation home for about a year now.   It has performed perfectly. The home being in a very hot climate in the summer, a thousand miles away gave me concern if the HVAC system control was to go haywire or if I was unable to connect and control form my permanent residence. I have had a few scares when it didn’t connect first time but I closed the app and tried again and it connected. There were a couple of instances where the Honeywell network was down but it came back up in an hour or so. All and all a solid product, easy to setup and operate. Buy it

title: Very simplistic functions and extremely dated
text:
I would hope Honeywell’s apps for their  newer equipment are better, but they seem to have pretty much abandoned this one. You can change the current temperature (oh, and get a half-baked weather report and plenty of marketing content), but not much else. Just to do this much, it needs its own hub.

This app was written in 2011 or so, and hasn’t had any significant improvements since then, even though my HVAC contractor installed this system in July of 2018. And the newer apps from Honeywell don’t support my system at all.

I’m seriously considering replacing the thermostat and the whole zoning controller, which is barely a year old, so I can switch over to an all Ecobee system.

title: Great app, now that I’ve had it for a while
text:
I like the app. It’s easy to use. I’d like it much better if it had detailed controls for multi stage units. 
I’ve had it for a few years now.  At first, the server stability wasn’t great.  The online service wasn’t always up, but in the last year I’ve seen a huge improvement.  Now it rarely has trouble finding the online service.
The user interface is beautiful (especially when compared to the Honeywell Home Connect app by Resideo).  It’s easy to use and is very reliable.

title: Very satisfied
text:
We are very please with these thermostats that we placed in our church. We especially like the scheduling feature and the ability to change the schedule remotely.

If there was one improvement that could be made, it would be the ability to have more than one schedule available per day.  I have two periods on Saturday, so I have to manually change the schedule every Saturday to support the second schedule, and then change it back.  Thank Goodness for reminders on my phone!

title: What has happened to this app?
text:
Used to be a great app, but the last month, it continually can’t establish a connection and I get a pop-up message Honeywell is experiencing problems.  I have had Honeywell wifi programmable thermostats for 6 years.  When I replaced the most recent 2 years ago, I stayed with Honeywell (instead of Nest).  Maybe time to rethink staying with Honeywell.

This was the  response to my negative review: “Hi there, we are currently experiencing high traffic which is increasing the amount of time it takes your thermostat to process changes sent via the app. Changes may take up to 20 minutes. We apologize for any inconvenience."

Ummm.... why would I purchase any wifi thermostat that takes 20 minutes to change the temperature???  Useless.

title: Love it
text: I absolutely love the fact that it looks exactly like my old one but with WiFi . My husband isn’t very tech savvy so if I change it to one that’s all new with touch screen and all new gadgets he can’t handle the change and gets frustrated. This thermometer is awesome to me because it looks exactly the same as the one I already had only an added bonus with the WiFi. I love that I can turn the heat off from my phone when I forget it’s going to get warmer later and I’m at work. Maryland weather is wacky so this is perfect !

title: Simple and basic but lacks
text: Having a wireless thermostat is great. Not having the data showing your run time per hour, day, week, etc. renders its function of a rotary thermostat that you can control from your phone. So much energy savings could be realized if the runtime data was shown... giving the user the ability to choose to save energy. Clearly you motives for NOT providing this data is because you are bought out by the oil and gas companies ? that want you to USE more carbon fuels ? Why not even show how much you could save if you lower the temp in winter cold months and higher in summer months. Hire a programmer to rewrite your simplistic app. ?

title: Not too impressed on one point
text: I may have missed something but I can't seem to understand why the thermostat doesn't automatically change from heat to A/C when there are settings on the schedule for each temp.  It seems this should be a feature that makes the app better than standing in front of the thermostat all the time.  My older, less smart thermostat would switch according to which side of the temp settings the temp moved away from (colder = heat came on, warmer = A/C came on) so how is it a smarter thermostat can't do the same, especially from a company with the tech of Honeywell.

title: Great Easy to Read & Understand App!
text: I am a senior citizen & like the fact that the thermostat & the app are Easy to Read & Operate!  The Temperature Control is Fantastic & since my thermostat is a RedLINK model, the Portable Comfort Control has been a Fantastic Devise!  It has sat on my bedroom nightstand for Over 10 Years!  I can press a button & it Senses & Controls  the temperature (instead of the thermostat)... so I can be 100% Comfortable, anywhere I take it in the house!  It also makes temperature & system mode adjustments, Extremely Fast & Easy with no smartphone (or app sign-on) necessary!

title: Control from anywhere
text:
The Honeywell controller and App are awesome in so many ways.  It is nice to be able to check in and see what's happening with my three heat pumps.  I have generated schedules for all of them.  Nice to be able to turn the upstairs unit off when the kids are out of town or if you forget.  

I did not give it 5 stars as it would be nice if you could program multiple thermostats at the same time.  Also, would be nice if you could lock out local control of the thermostats from the app.  There is no way to lock out these thermostats or have some kind of password to change set points at the thermostat.

title: App needs overhaul / thermo sensors inaccurate
text:
A bit disappointed. Was expecting a lot more. This app needs a significant update and new features added. Thermo controls and settings are very limited from app. Many settings can only be done at thermo itself. App is very elementary at best. Needs reporting, usage and run time data like the Emerson Sensi.

As for the Thermo, it overruns (as others have noted) and overheats the house past the set point temp. Verified with several other nearby thermometers and they all show +2 degrees over Honeywell thermo temp. Temp on the Honeywell RTH9585 is wrong. Not updating frequently enough.

I expected better from a name like Honeywell and a $160 thermo. My old 1997 (programmable only) Honeywell was more trustworthy. Thinking of returning this WiFi one and switching back to my old one.

title: Good app but not always reliable
text: This is a good app to control the thermostat but I’m annoyed that it’s not always reliable especially in the last few weeks. I’ve tried to see if there’s been any updates that I needed to do but none. I also deleted it and reinstalled the app but still glitches. I get log in errors and errors that the thermostat did not receive the change I was trying to send. The whole purpose is to be able to adjust the temp of the house remotely and it’s not always doing that. I hope they fix whatever is going on with this app. I’ve got two Honeywell thermostats and it’s annoying when this app fails over and over again to do its job

title: Not getting it done
text:
This product does not deliver what it says it will do.  I installed this thermostat with the app about a year ago. It’s just flat out not reliable.  If you’re lucky, you can use the app and adjust the temperature in your home. If you are unlucky, then you’ll just have to do it manual the way. It’s frustrating, because this product is sold as something you can program and adjust remotely, but you can’t do so reliably.  

I’m not going to spend hours on end trying to troubleshoot what is exactly wrong, but after re-starting my Wi-Fi, uninstalling the app from my phone and reinstalling, it seems like there is a problem with the servers the Honeywell thermostat is connected to. But who knows?  All I know is the thing isn’t working.

title: Loving It
text: Been using the thermostat with the app 5 years. It works really well and it's great when you're already in bed I need to adjust the temperature. Especially during the fall months when you need to toggle between air-conditioning and heat. It's often will work when you are offsite and need to adjust it. It works fully just like your thermostat. There are many times it goes down or reports incorrectly. It will say it is on or the fan is on when it is not. It causes panic to check your system but remember this is an app and your thermostat runs your system.

title: Best thing I could have got.
text: Replaced my heating/cooling system and had them put in a Honeywell WIFI thermostat. In conjunction with this app. I am able to go to sleep and at midnight it drops the temperature down and brings it back up before we wake. I also programmed it to drop down during the day while we are at work and warm back up prior to our return. The best thing is when the wife says it’s to hot or cold, I can pull out my phone and set the temp. to what she wants, without getting out of my chair.  It works extremely well.

title: Honeywell programmable Wi-Fi thermostat
text: I’ve had my thermostats for many many years I don’t use the programming, all I do everything manually but I do use the Wi-Fi I can control my thermostats from anywhere the application is terrific I have zero complaints! I wish there were a way to access the Wi-Fi on the thermostat from my phone it’s a little tricky to do it standing next to the thermostat and logging into the thermostat but I’ve only had to do that maybe twice in about 10 years!  Will bye honeywell and use App forever!

title: Works but not keeping up with the times.
text:
Even Apple has recently changed the way you enter times and other data. Honeywell wrote an app a bunch of years ago and is just sitting there watching it get stale.
Further, it occurs to me that there should be a reminder built into the App. If you have a forced hot air system , you need to replace a filter at certain intervals. Or, if a boiler is present, maybe a weekly reminder to check water levels. Or, if you have coils for hot water in your boiler, a heating/non-heating season reminder to change water levels to cover or uncover the coils. 
I don’t know who Resideo is, but it doesn’t seem to be Honeywell anymore.

title: Love this app!
text:
This is our first wi-fi thermostat and I don’t understand why we didn’t install one sooner.
The ease of turning on and off, setting up a schedule, and changing said schedule is so easy!  You can even set a vacation schedule so you don’t have to modify the main schedule.  I also love the fact that each day can have its own schedule.  Our last programmable thermostat just had “weekday” and “weekend”.
No more running downstairs at night because we forgot the hold function had been set.
Love this app!!

title: Great App with practical UI
text:
I’ve been using this App to control 3 thermostats in my home for more than 4 years now, and I’ve probably only been to any of the physical thermostat less than 5 times in total in all that time. 
I’ve been able to setup and control cooling and heating schedules for my home all year round without any need for manual Intervention in all that time. 
The alerts are on point when there’s been a power failure or Wifi disconnection. 
In all I’m very happy with the App as well as the Honeywell thermostat that it controls.

title: Uninspiring
text:
The good news is that the app/service works most of the time. When things fail, there’s nothing you can fix yourself. Registration once the Honeywell server has lost your thermostat identity requires tech support voodoo. When the server decides to nap moments before you leave on vacation, be patient and pray your registration is recovered. 

When all else fails, just run it like your old thermostat and delete the app. 

The app is only good for remote access or from your easy chair (when the server is alive). Nothing worthwhile emanates from the Honeywell server otherwise. All the server based reporting is crap. The app is merely the conduit between the “intelligent” server and the dumb thermostat. What could go wrong?

title: iPad Connection thru website to thermostat is unstable
text:
Have owned my Honeywell wifi thermostat for a week and 3 times I could not connect to thermostat from iPad due to website being down. I called Cust Svce once and they didn’t know the servers were down. Pretty low tech operation to not have backup servers to keep the Wi-Fi connection up.
Then, I could not connect using iPad but would connect using iPhone. Error message said bad password. Been using it for a week and somehow my password in the app using iPad only got changed? Re-entered password and entered system successfully.
Seems like the Wi-Fi connection to thermostat via Honeywell servers is a circus. Stability is hit and miss so I give 3 stars out of 5.

title: Great App
text: This app is wonderful. It allows me to make the house comfortable before I ever get to the garage. That is a convenience when I am coming into the house with small children.   It is important to me that the house be warm in the wintertime and cool in the summertime. I find the app to be reliable and easy to use. I also like the fact that it tells me the outside temperature. Most mornings, I check the temperature as soon as I get up in the morning on my way to make my breakfast tea. I can recommend this app for people who want to monitor and/or have the ability to adjust the house temperature remotely.

title: Great App!
text:
Great app!
I love having the ability to set my Thermostat via this app. It has actually saved me money, by allowing me to control the Thermostat remotely on occasions when I would have forgotten to do so & left my home for a long weekend or vacation.
I have a regular schedule set, but I also like to modify that when I’m going to be away, and if I’ve forgotten to do so before I left, no problem, I can do that from anywhere with this App.
Overall I’m very pleased with this.  Ps I live in Florida so A/c is a way of life, but if I’m away, being able to modify the routine schedule is so cost efficient.

title: Glitchy
text: The app works most of the time but on a more than intermittent basis experiences problems that prevent you from accessing your thermostat. The company is not transparent as to when they are having outages nor do they have any customer service reps that respond in a timely manner. It’s not the end of the world for me because I live in TN and our seasons rarely get too hot or cold, nor do I often leave our house for extended periods of time. So I can always walk down the hall or wait until I get home to change the temp. But for people that rely on this app to make needed changes to the temps in their house, especially those that are away for extended periods of time, look for something else.

title: Awesome App so far.
text: Months ago I replaced my retired long overdue thermostat with a new touch screen non-wifi model because I didn’t have a “C” wire. Months later, I learned how to install “C” wire and because I wanted to control my thermostat wirelessly specifically inside my bedroom and so I bought the RTH9585WF model along with the app Total Connect Comfort. Now I don’t have to get up my bed and adjust the thermostat anymore. It’s a total comfort for me and that’s why I give you 5 stars. Keep up the great work and keep inventing for the benefit of every customer.

title: Nice Thermostat but,
text:
It works as I wanted a WIFI Thermostat to work.  It is far more accurate than the original Round thermostat I replaced, by 5 -6 degrees warmer or colder.  When we thought we were at 68 it was really 63 degrees.
That’s how much of a difference in the temperature in my home.  So there is definitely a good reason to replace older model thermostats.
That being said, it did have to return the first Unit, because it was constantly shutting down and restarting.  Sometimes 4 - 5 times an hour.
The replacement seems to be working fine now.  At least no on and off restarting so far.
As for Honeywell Service, that’s another issue.  You will wait on hold for 45 minutes or so, to speak to someone.  They do have a call back service, and they do call you back, but it all takes time.
With all this being said, I do like the looks, features and accuracy of the unit.  For the money.

title: Two homes, two units
text:
We have a summer home in Wisconsin and a winter home in southern Alabama.. I love these units to keep track of the temp, humidity and forecast in the home we are away from. I like the option that shows me when the furnace or AC is on and watch how long it takes for the furnace to respond when I change the settings. 
The only thing I would like is to be able to adjust the brightness of the numbers as they are bright. I know I can adjust the background brightness but not the white text. Maybe future upgrade. Other than that I love them..

title: Ok when it works
text: I had unit 1 month. Working good. Then lost connection during Christmas. Couldn’t get help. And everything that said go “here” to see videos would send me to main home page where there are NO VIDEOS. Well Lowe’s had these marked down cheap   So got another one and installed and set up Christmas Eve. That worked 4 days before it lost connection. 30 min on hold to find out they are having problems on their end. 2 more days working. Then stopped in evening to start back later that night. That has happened 3 times so far.  So. Is good when it works. But I am not happy with it. And it sends email alerts when someone changes temp. Wished it was text messages

title: The app is fine. Thermostats are crap.
text:
I’ve used Honeywell programmable thermostats for years because, well, they’re the best. 

The WiFi thermostats are a different story. They regularly lose connectivity (while all the other WiFi smart home devices in my house stay connected just fine). Sometimes multiple resets of the wireless router will restore the connection, but sometimes the thermostat had to be reset — which has to happen at the thermostat itself. That’s a problem when you buy a WiFi Cloud thermostat to monitor and control HVAC in a remote home that is hours away from you. Next time around I will not buy Honeywell. They just blame my Internet connection, or my wireless network, even though I have a dozen other devices on the same network that don’t lose connectivity at all.

title: USER FRIENDLY PROGRAMMABLE THERMOSTAT THAT MEETS EVERY NEED!
text: HONEYWELL PLEASE ALWAYS SUPPORT THIS APP AND THE RED LINK WIFI!!  This thermostat can do it all. I can set a schedule that is adjustable up to 4 times per day for winter heating and for summertime cooling. All great! But even more flexibility if I want to temporarily or permanently override the settings - and ALL but the set schedule programming CAN BE DONE FROM THE APP!  Additionally there are simple options to override for a day off work, vacation time, etc. Can’t ask for a better programmable thermostat. HONEYWELL PLEASE ALWAYS SUPPORT THIS APP AND THE RED LINK WIFI!! WOULD BE SAD IF I NEEDED TO REPLACE THIS THERMOSTAT AS NEWER TECHNOLOGY TAKES ITS PLACE. THANK YOU!

title: App needs a lot of work.
text: The thermostat itself was easy to install. For some reason, whenever I tried to run the heat feature, it blew cold air. I thought perhaps I made an error in connecting the wires. I DID NOT. I pulled the thermostat off the wall and reset it. Now it blows hot air in the heat feature. The app is constantly crashing. The WiFi feature is a joke. It rarely connects, which is annoying. I have to manually turn it on. When I leave to work early in the AM I leave the heater on ( my children are still sleeping). I cannot turn it off from the app, so the heater will probably run the entire day, till I get home. Same goes for the AC feature. Currently looking for a replacement thermostat.

title: “Smart” thermostat
text:
It’s a thermostat and works as well as you can expect from one.
The smart part is way off. This product is supposed to anticipate the schedule you have set and learn how long it takes to heat your home to the set temperature by the time set in the schedule.
My morning wakeup is set to 68F by 5:00am, it starts heating around 3:00am, even though my house only takes 20-30 minutes to heat from 62F to 68F.
That means there’s a good 90mins that heat is being wasted. I have to anticipate this smart thermostat by setting the schedule to heat 90mins later.
It could be a simple software fix but the app and controls don’t allow for that other than by fooling the thermostat through later scheduling.

title: Not Great but ok
text: This was my first WiFi thermostat. Now I have four, only one Honeywell. The unit works well when it’s connected to the internet, but it drops connection more often than I’d like. The temperature display is good and I like the submit button feature. I scheduled the setting to drop the temperature to 62 degrees at night when everyone has gone to bed and then back to 75 degrees in the daytime. That’s also a nice feature and it works well. I’m giving only three stars mainly because of the internet issue I mentioned earlier. You also cannot link this thermostat to Apple Home Kit. My other WiFi thermostats are Emerson Sensis and I love those.

title: Excellent product
text: I am using this in a cottage that we use every few weeks throughout the year.  I use it to warm the place up when we are heading up there (having previously encountered frozen mattresses) and occasionally when we have not drained the pipes to make sure the inside temperature does not allow the pipes to freeze.  I this capacity it has been wonderful.  Installation went smoothly. The only complaint I have is that periodically the device goes offline even though the wifi is working and I have found no way to correct that remotely.

title: Honeywell Wi-Fi thermostat
text: Awesome, super easy to install no issues or surprise installed really well on the first run, the wi-fi setup is a piece of cake, I love it, the thermostat is easy to interact with, very nice piece of equipment for the house, wished I would of done it sooner, able to see the house temperature while at work or elsewhere this is too cool, the fact you can change the background color to whatever color is really a nice touch as it's part of your room well done Honeywell!! Also like the monthly monthly comparison with last years data.

title: No accountability
text: Last week, the whole network went down. Couldn’t connect. Couldn’t call anyone. No email responses. Total Connect has my email address, because they just sent me an email asking to review their product. So, why didn’t they send me an email letting me know there was an issue and they were working on it instead of leaving a whole bunch of users hanging. Very disappointing. My experience with this product and company has been challenging. I’ve had two 9000s replaced also. That coupled with the lack of communication on a nationwide outage doesn’t make me feel so good about the company or the product. If they can fix that stuff, I’ll change my review.

title: Intermittent problems
text:
Unfortunately I’ve experienced communication problems with the thermostat. We have a cabin approximately 3 hours from our home. It is in a populated area lake resort and the Spectrum Wi-if works well. However I’ve had multiple occurrences where the thermostat does not respond to the app. The only method I’ve had that seems to be successful is to remove the thermostat and re-install. That seems to clear the “hung” state where the thermostat is non-responsive. That’s problematic enough when you are on site but obviously not an option when we are away and would like the cabin to be heating up as we head that way ( the only reason we went to a wi-fi thermostat. 

I’ve seen nothing in the literature to address this issue.

title: Very pleased
text:
This thermostat replaced a different programmable thermostat this summer along with my furnace, and it gave me the wi-fi options for the first time.
