I am very pleased with how quick and easy it is to use; I can turn the system on and set the temperature in seconds from anywhere (especially nice on cold mornings before I get out of bed, or heading home on a blistering hot summer day).
The app has worked perfectly and is extremely easy to understand and use. I have high standards and expectations, and I have yet to find anything negative about this thermostat.
Very, very happy with it!

title: Bumpy start but fab app!
text: I’m very happy with this.  A small glitch with install that needed intervention by the company but they fixed it immediately.  I’ve appreciated the anticipated heat time so it’s at XX degrees at X time.  I’ve been able to put off how soon I warm my home in winter due to this and it has saved energy.  My phone app allows me to override my home system if I’m not home at scheduled time.  Why heat the house when no one is there??  I can open my app and adjust the time down as needed.  A great investment, thrilled I went WiFi to monitor temps on my phone and make adjustments as needed remotely.

title: Buy a Sensi
text: I purchased and installed the Honeywell a year ago, since then I purchased a Sensi and replaced it. The Honeywell has multiple limitations that the Sensi does not have. The first is the scheduling options. The Honeywell limits the settings for each day to (wake, leave, return, sleep), where the Sensi has unlimited scheduling options 6, 8, 10 or more settings per day. The circulating option on the Sensi gives you more options than the Honeywell and the one that miffed me the most is once you set the Honeywell stat to be away you cannot rest the stat from the app, must be undone at the stat, where as the Sensi can be turned on and off remotely.

title: Honeywell Thermostat (WiFi)
text: I Love my Honeywell Thermostat. It was simple to install, setup app, day/ night settings. I’ve wanted a programmable WiFi for so long but I didn’t have internet. I can be anywhere to see what the temperature is in my home during winter and summer months. I can control from my phone. Last week I had my unit off when I left. The outside temp was dropping so I was able to turn on my furnace. Then the very next day it got hot and muggy so I turned on my air conditioning. My only problem is I wished I got it sooner.

title: Love this thermostat!
text: We bought this thermostat so we can keep the temperature where we want it at our cabin when we’re not there. So, in the winter if the temperature is going to be at a freezing point we can up the temp so our pipes don’t freeze. Love being able to control the temperature remotely!! Makes our life easier and we don’t have to worry about what the temperature is set at when we’re not there because with this thermostat we can change the inside temperature from anywhere at anytime!

title: Don’t wait, buy one today
text:
This thermostat works awesome it was a breeze setting up and going into it I knew I needed to add a c-wire as mine was only a old style 2 wire and that was easy to all you have to do is purchase a 24vac plug-in transformer and add the new two wires 1-to the C terminal and one to the RH it being a AC voltage there is no preference what wire goes to what terminal as long as you use the RH & C connection terminals and remove the little jumper wire.
I connected it to my WiFi without any issue too downloaded the app and I check my house temp from anywhere.

title: A++ Works great with Alexa !!
text:
I purchased to enable remote setting of temperature when we travel and my mom house sits. This has worked great!

However, with Alexa compatibility configured, it has been even better - now, my wife can relax on the couch and just say Alexa, set temp up (or down) 1 degree or set the temp to a certain temp. It’s great, I highly recommend it. 

Lastly, on a monthly basis, I receive email notifications reporting how our gas bill compares to other households on the street and we are always saving more than the others. This is primarily due to the easy scheduling settings. It offers 4 per day on Heat and the same for Cool. It automatically adjusts to whichever schedule is appropriate. 

It has paid for itself many times over in both reduced bills and convenience. Just fabulous!

Oh, and you can pick different color settings, which is nice based on wall color or aesthetics.

title: New Thermostat
text:
I purchased the system based on the company who installed my new ac/heating system recommendation and that I could monitor my system and make changes from other locations when I wasn’t there for several months. Thermostat worked well for a few months then got a notice it was off line. Contacted company and they advised that I lost my internet connection. Internet provider restablished internet. Company could not remotely restablish or reset connection to thermostat. Wondering now if I should of stayed with a standard thermostat that worked well for many years. 

Update:  I’m In New Jersey and the thermostat is in my home in Florida. I cannot physically reset the thermostat as your reply suggested.

title: Convenient, but missing some expected features
text:
This is a convenient app, but I’m surprised I can’t set alerts for when the indoor or outdoor temp reaches a specific number. This would help with monitoring my AC/Heat. I could open windows rather than running the AC if I was alerted the outdoor temp dropped lower than the current indoor temp.
I also recently noticed the temps weren’t following the schedule I set. After some troubleshooting I found out the thermostat was off by a day. Since it’s connected to Wi-Fi, you’d think it would automatically update the date/time by connecting to the world clock. It might do this and I don’t realize it.

title: Simple and Easy
text: This app is simple and easy to use.   I love the 5 Day Forecast feature.   The user interface is professionally designed with aesthetically easy to read graphics and simple user interface.   The built in intelligence feature works as intended.   The programming is simple and intuitive.   Previously, I had an older programmable thermostat but with no WIFI, no app.   This is far far better.  I love the convenience being able to adjust from anywhere (at home or away) with my iPhone.

title: Lost connection after recent update
text: I updated the iPhone app while at work. When I got home I noticed the thermostat had loss connection even though it showed it had a WiFi signal. I easily reconnected it to WiFi and even though it said cooling on the thermostat and the app it was running heat. Before I could decide what to do the temperature rose 10 degrees. I decided to reset the WiFi and after it was completed it started cooling like the thermostat and app said. I’ve been using the thermostat for about a year and have been very happy with it reliability and functionality. Hopefully this issue was an isolated one.

title: Extremely dependable
text: I have two thermostats in two separate locations in my home. They worked great for the first year. I frequently travel out of town and I require the accessibility to my thermostats to maintain my home. When the Internet ability was lost they normally would kick back on. But the last time it happened they lost the ability to transmit to me my app and the ability to change things was unavailable   When I tried to call the Honeywell customer support I never got through. I tried 7 different days. I was on hold for up to one hour with one on ever coming on the line. I sent a text and still no response. So when they work they work great but customer service is horrible. And after 3 months my thermostats are still not working via the app.

title: Would be 5-star if it worked al the time
text: Love the ability to heat up or cool down house while away. How on earth did we ever get by without this?  My main negative is that in the last 6 months or so, the 2 thermostats we own frequently lose connection - and our internet is not the issue. What. The. Heck. Both thermostats are at 2 separate houses. Clearly this is not a single faulty thermostat issue, but maybe a firmware issue in the units?  Was there an update in the last several months that brought this problem?  Anyway - when they work, these units are amazing.

title: So easy so good
text: Because of the price I didn't expect it to be very responsive.  After a little confusion with the setup all was very good.  The "confusion" was the assumption that what they said of the factory setup was correct.  I found that the settings (one or two) were not correct.  I have a conventional gas heater and electric A/C.  That was what it was to be set as out of the box.   Nope.  It was set as heater only.  It was very simple to change this once I found out why the heater stayed on and not allowing the A/C to work.  The wifi is really very good and straightforward.  Would recommend with 5 stars.

title: Works great
text: I bought the thermostat 2 years ago for around $80. It works fine, no glitches. But I don’t use the scheduling function, so can’t evaluate that. The iPhone app works great to set temperature or verify the HVAC system is working when away from home. The monthly report on heating/cooling usage is nice. Once or twice the Honeywell servers were down so the app did not work, but the thermostat itself continued to work fine. Overall the app is far more stable than the automation apps I have for cameras and pool. A good value.

title: App review
text: I wish I could provide a better review. After signing into this app it takes you to their website only to sign in again. The app doesn’t control the thermostat only the website would. I have another Honeywell stat on Honeywell Home app which works good. I used the import function to take the stat on the total comfort app into Honeywell home. It worked well for half day and now it shows offline. When I try to sign back into the total comfort app it says my sign in is wrong. I know it’s not wrong and so I don’t recommend the total comfort app at all. Companies the size of Honeywell should have flawless software and apps but they never seem to have their act together

title: Awesome T-stat app
text:
This is the next greatest thing since sliced bread in my opinion. I run an AirBnB so it helps tremendously. Keeps guests from cranking the heat to 80 and the AC down to 60. It definitely helps my unit from being overworked. 
I’m able to everything from anywhere. Change the temperature, set the schedule, adjust the temp when we, as a family, return home from a trip. 
And it’s an added bonus to have it linked to show your current weather conditions so you know the most efficient temp settings.

title: Love This App
text:
This is App is perfect for all my families needs.  I love the feature that allows us to turn on the heater remotely and has worked great for us so far with no problems. We have been using the app for a little over a year.  
Super user friendly, simple to navigate and has all the features I need.  
It has been extremely reliable and has not failed us once.  I live in the Mts.  So we use it more often throughout the year then most people would.  And it has definitely proven itself!

title: Love love love
text: I use this thermostat in a vacation rental home.  I can adjust the temperature from anywhere. It’s easy for my guests to adjust the temperature to their liking or I can even do it for them remotely and I can adjust the temperature to save energy when the place is not occupied. I can even adjust the fan, change the program, pretty much do anything.  I love that I can set the fan to circulate the air every so often even when the AC or furnace isn’t running to keep hot or cold spots from developing when the house is unoccupied.

title: Disappointed
text:
One of our primary reasons to want a WiFi connected thermostat was to remotely control the system while away on vacation. There are times when we are away we may wish to either extend or shorten our trip and have our house ready when we return. Imagine my surprise when my app informed me I cannot change vacation mode via the app! In fact, I couldn’t even create a vacation schedule via the app! 

Bottom line? Do not buy this thermostat if you want to use the vacation mode. From my perspective this makes this thermostat virtually useless if I cannot do everything remotely I can do while standing in front of the thermostat.

We will be replacing it soon - and it will not be with another Honeywell.

title: What Thermostat am I seeing?
text: This is an early review, so rating may change later depending on my education with the app.  All seems to be working fine, except I have not found a way to name my 3 thermostats that are ganged in a single location.  Also, I’m stuck with the thermostats shown in the order they were installed on the app, so now my two thermostats in one HVAC service area are split by another serving a separate HVAC.  Being able to rearrange them would help, but being able to give them names would be even better.  So I have thermostat, thermostat and thermostat staring at me instead of Studio, Bedroom and Public Area.  Grrr.

title: Love this!  Great control!
text: First time I’ve ever had a thermostat that I can control with my smart phone. I love it! It was fast and simple to load on my iPhone8+. It loaded and worked the first time. Simpler to program than any thermostat I’ve ever had.  I had it installed in my office building and I love that I can be home and check to make sure my employees didn’t leave it on over the weekend; and to warm up (cool down) the office if I go in early.  Totally worth it. Tiny down side, screen on thermostat in the office could be a little more responsive or faster. No big deal though.

title: Why does it have to go thru your website to control?
text: A previous smart thermostat I could communicate directly with it through my home wifi as my cell phone is connected to the wifi and the Honeywell thermostat is connected to my wifi so why does it have to go to a website that is almost always being updated when I wish to change the setting on the thermostat? I end up having to go to the wall where the thermostat is at and manually change it there, so no 5 stars, can’t work it remotely as it should!!!!!

title: Perfect for Bay House
text:
We have a second home on the Chesapeake Bay.  We have two of the Honeywell remote thermostats controlling our two heat pumps via my iPhone-multiple versions.  They have been in use for at least five years.
In fact I recently got a message to change the batteries on the outside temperature sensors.  It’s great being able to walk into a warm or cool-depending on the season-house.  They have always worked properly, are easy to use and always recover from power outages.  I would buy again.

title: Still a few bugs
text: Still a few bugs with this app. I have to reboot all the Devices that connect the thermostats to WiFi every 3-6 months. This takes two people talking over cell phones. Everything will  be fine for a couple of months then each thermostat on the phone will gradually turn red and give an error message that it is not connected to the server. It says that the thermostat isn't getting the message but it does. Eventually they are all red and I have to reboot them again. I wish Honeywell would fix this.

title: Getting an authentication failure
text:
I’ve been using this app for a few months now with no problem. However today the app has locked myself and my wife out with the same message. I’ve attempted to log onto the website and or reset my password several times to no avail. Populated an error message. It is in the low 50’s outside I was wondering since this is the only available form of communication if I could get some assistance/possible contact info.

Problem resolved. Took several days to receive a response but all is well now.

title: Good thermostat and application
text: I have been using my wi-fi thermostat for a few years and I am very happy with it. Only problem I had for installation was that I did not have a wire for 24v for the thermostat so I had to run a new wire. I like the app to support the thermostat since I can set-up alerts for when the temperature gets too hot or too cold in the house. I have gotten the too low temperature alerts and discovered that the boiler had a fault and shutdown. I also use the app to check on if I have power at my house when e get s bad storm and I am not home. If the thermostat is not responding, then I assume there is no power at the house.

title: Great unit
text:
Great improvement, I replaced a standard Honeywell thermostat that was working good but this is a different world😁. The old one didn’t need the ground wire as this one does. There was a wire in the wall and in the a/c outside. Checked into the make for my unit....hooked up bout ends and wallah it works! 
 It’s nice to be able to turn the thermostat down at night during the winter and while still in bed raise the temperature ( has heat not heat pump). Also go away for several days and set the temperature up or down depending on season, then on the way back home put it back on the schedule!!!

title: Can’t Get it to work remotely
text: We spend the winters in Florida while the thermostat is in Pennsylvania.   We have tried a minimum of 50 times to try and set the thermostat to 58 degrees remotely while in Florida, but it always shows the temperature at 68 and the outside temperature as 40 no matter what the real temperature is outside.  We were worried about the excessive heating bill we would have when we returned in the spring so we called the customer support center to see if they could help.  They showed no problem with the app or thermostat and could do nothing else.  Since one of the other reviews mentioned that it was corrected 1 YEAR LATER, there’s nothing else we could do but wait and see how high our bill was.  We were very dissatisfied with the app.   Still waiting for it to fix itself!

title: Alerts are via email, not a text message
text: Very functional and easy to use. Selected this, many years ago, over others because it sends alerts. However, the alerts are only to your email. Since I get so many garbage emails I’m forced to turn off my new email notifications, rendering my thermostat alerts useless. I’ve requested in the past that Honeywell would consider sending a text alert along with email, simply stating I have an email, so that I know to check my email alert. For some reason they don’t be willing to do so.

title: Easy functionality. Reasonable prices.
text: Actually easier than operating the in house keypad. I like being able to monitor& adjust. System while away. UPDATE July 2018: We recently had to switch Internet/wifi vendors, using a different router of course, and even that switch was easy with my smartphone and the Honeywell thermostat. Honeywell makes a great product and their web sight is helpful. They even sent me an email alerting me that our unit has been offline and included links to instructions on how to fix things! THAT is great customer service.

title: Inconsistent
text:
Does not always work as described. When attempting to adjust settings I frequently get messages in the app that I am "not connected to the internet" when all devices are indeed connected and functioning normally. I then I have to sign into the account via Honeywell website to make adjustments. Preset timer does not always work. Thermostat will sometimes change setting randomly anywhere from 15 to 45 minutes earlier than setting. Just change setting at the time I set please.
Update- app continues to underperform. Frequently ignores schedule, error messages abound about not being connected to Internet (I am securely, entirely and functional connected). Any change in the schedule seems to co fuse the app. It applies permanent holds when temporary changes are made.
FIX IT

title: Nice app but one problem for me.
text: I like the app works well. I have one problem with the recent change to the user interface. If a person has one thermostat in their home, why can’t it come up immediately in the app. I shouldn’t have to click three times to change the temperature. A software change to go to the thermostat screen right away would be great. Especially having only one thermostat and one location. It used to work that way and I loved it. An Apple Watch app to simply change temperature would be great too. Thanks.

title: Simple WiFi Thermostat
text: I’ve had this system for about two years after Michael and Son no longer installs Nest pro which died after a year and was under warranty. I like Honeywell thermostats because they are reliable but this one is pretty basic. After having a smart thermostat and going to just a thermostat that offers touch technology and WiFi, it is time for me to move on to a Honeywell T9 or above. This system is great for people who have not had a smart thermostat or no desire to use one and want the ease of controlling your thermostat from any location.

title: Early adopter
text:
Been using since their first WiFi thermostat came out.  Mostly awesome & one of my favorite & most useful programs.  Simple, control your AC using your phone.  
   What pisses me off is all the random times it won’t connect to the unit or won’t let me log in, “login failed, try again.” “Login failed, try again.” 
   “You’ve tried too many times.  Wait 5 mins & try again.”  
Nothing has changed.  My logins have been the same for almost a decade.  Happens a lot in the middle of the night when I’m tired and don’t want to walk downstairs to turn down the temperature one degree.  Aside from that it’s amazing.

title: More fan control  or “Green options”
text: Would give it 5 stars if it had more control over the fan. The only option is only while the furnace runs or 24 hours a day. Being able to control the blower when it runs and how long after the furnace or AC is done would set this thermostat ahead of the rest. Being able to run it at certain times during the day and longer cycles after the furnace shuts off would greatly help equalize the temperature in the house. When it’s really cold or really hot it just leave the blower on 24/7 kinda wasteful but no options. It’s 2019 get with it.

title: Great Thermostats
text: We have 3 units each in 2 different homes and they work great. Easy to set up and we have never had an issue with them. No connectivity issues or dropped connections and the temperature control is very stable for both a forced hot air and baseboard heating units. The app is simple to operate and it is nice that you can quickly go on the app and adjust the temperature prior to arriving home. As we have not had any issues at all and it is so easy to operate I would recommend this unit. I give it a 5 rating.

title: What have you done???
text:
The update today (4/2/20) has made the app unusable - it is totally frozen and the buttons do not work. Before today, I would have given 5 stars.

Well, it has been one month, and the iPad app is STILL unusable (and, clearly from the app comments on the Apples Store, I am far from the only one with this issue). If you can not fix it, at least roll back to the prior version so we can have a functional app. The major reason for purchasing this thermostat was to be able to access it remotely from my iPad - you have totally destroyed it’s ability to do so. At this point, I wish I could rate my overall experience ZERO STARS. Do I need to start looking for another brand with functioning remote access???

title: Works very well for me.
text: I am a relative newbie to the world of Wi-Fi controlled devices. I have found this device to be simple to use and easy to understand.  I can't think of any other functions that I would like to add to it. Experienced users may think it is too simple, I don't know, but for me, simpler is better. It does everything that I need it to do. The smart phone interface is so easy to use, it is just as easy as being there. Actually, I think it is easier than being at home.

title: Seriously Dated Interface
text: While the Honeywell VisionPRO thermostat device has aesthetically pleasing style and advanced functionality, this app looks like it was designed for iOS 6 and the iPhones from 2012. The iPhone X series of phones are coming up for a third iteration in 2 days from the time of this writing. It would be a pleasure to see this developer get with the times and at least update the interface for today’s iPhone resolutions. Additionally this is the only app on my iPhone XS that randomly crashes on a regular basis. Since I use this to control my central AC a few times a day, this is unacceptable. I am worried what will happen with the iOS 13 release that will also be released this month. Will this app work?

title: I’ve been having problems for months!!!!
text: Everything was working fine until one day the total comfort lost connection with the WiFi and since then it tells me that lost connection and that I will not be able to make any changes from my app and that is true, it keeps showing the options on grey color meaning I can not make any changes from the app, I’m getting so tired and so frustrated, I have called the 1-800 number, they fixed it momentarily but it goes back to square one where I can not make any changes while I’m away from home, I really do not know what to do to this point, I do not know if the unit on the wall has to be replaced or what because this is been going on for 3-5 months already and my patience is running extremely lowwwwwww!!!!!!

title: Good enough app, nothing fancy, does the job.
text:
Overall this works well. Some of the logic for alerts is a bit odd.

It would be really nice to be able to get a daily and monthly report of use with energy use. It would be nice to input information about my furnace and AC system to have the system automatically give approx energy use ie kWh and CF or therms of gas.

It should have more statistics reporting in the app. It is nice that I now get a monthly report by email from Honeywell of furnace run time but it would seem the app could give me that same information directly. If the app allowed me to input the specs of my equipment it could directly give me energy use feedback.

Lots and lots of opportunity to offer the user statistics but overall doesn’t fulfill that.

The app and the equipment are very reliable and do exactly what they were designed to do. I am very pleased with the existing function as it allows me to know what is generally going on at my home. 

I just want more.

title: Landscape? Why?
text: This is a fairly serviceable app that has one basic function and that is to control your thermostat.  Why, oh, why does it require you to use landscape mode on the iPad when almost every other app in the world is portrait? I can understand landscape if there were some long horizontal needs, but this app's graphics are 95% blank space and all the rest are discreet buttons that take up little space.  I envision the programmer saying, “What? If we include portrait mode, that will take another two hours of programming!  That will cost you another $45, Honeywell!” And at that Honeywell deciding, it’s good enough.  Just like their thermostat design process, this app is good enough and they don’t care to spend more time on it.

title: Really Pleased
text: This app is easy to use and works really well. I can adjust temperature as needed from my bed or office and I like that I can adjust it when I leave or plan to return. I have a different Honeywell app for my second home that has an additional feature - geofencing. With that app the system will automatically change to a preset temperature when I am away. I don't know why I can't control both systems from the same app; nor why this system doesn't allow geofencing. If it were not for that, I would give this app 5 stars.

title: Does everything I need.
text: I love this thermostat and app. I compared to Nest and many others. While they are very good units they had more than I needed at a price I didn’t want to spend. This is my first wifi thermostat and I love it!  The screen has excellent information and the ability to do everything from the app is wonderful. The fact that it learns when to turn on in advance of me getting home to have the correct temperature in the house is great and the scheduling capability is everything I need.

title: We LOVE This App
text:
Nothing like going out for the day, setting the thermostat (before going out the door) for unoccupied temperatures, and then remoting in to get it to start heating/cooling for when you get home. Or if we forgot to set for unoccupied before we left, we can set it from the highway, on our way to wherever.  

The other night, someone turned off the heat, turned on the air, and it was 60° in the house by time I woke up in the middle of the night, so I switched the thermostat to heat, without getting out of the bed.

title: Honey-well I like you too!
text: It was a cold winter night and I was tucked in good. I dreaded de-tucking to go turn up Mr. Heater. I remembered I plumb had the TTC app on my phone. I was like yay, yay,yay! I whipped out the phone, fired up the app and told Mr. Heater to turn up 2 degrees...mere seconds later Heater man was chugging along nicely! I told the thermostat to turn up the heat and it was nice enough to tell Mr. Heater with no jibber jabber. In the morning I when straight to the Thermostat who I lovingly call Thermy and said thank you! Thank you so much! Now I know thermostats can’t really hear me say nice things to them but one can pretend...ya know? Anyhoo, Honeywell rocks! Hafer

title: Works Great!
text:
I have the Honeywell 
Prestige IAQ thermostat in my home for the last 3 years. It’s been Awesome! Set it and forget it! Turns on the heat when it gets cold and turns on the AC when it gets hot. I don’t need to do a thing... when you have pets in the house now more worrying if they are cold or hot whiles your away. 
*** if you have an older system like we do you will have to use the Fan wire to power the thermostat but have a local service tech come out and install it should be much. 

It also sends monthly energy reports to your email if you sign up for them.

title: Loses connectivity to server therefore useless most of the time
text:
Would be 5 stars if it weren’t for the server issues. I’ve checked everything on my end and there’s no problem. T-stat shows connected w/strong signal. (We have high speed internet and WiFi gives about 200mbps and we have high performance laptops and iPhones with latest software) Only had Vision Pro 8000 T-Stat 3-4 weeks and it was working great until the server issues started. 

Emailed customer service and they admitted there’s been intermittent server problems. I hope it gets resolved soon as I don’t have confidence in this Honeywell T-stat right now. Concerned for when we’re away from home.

title: A must if you have pets or are a caregiver!
text: Been using it for five years, a very reliable app. Works well with a thermostat that’s programmable. Lets you know when your thermostat fails via email, if you have pets or you are a caregiver that’s so important. Change temperatures on the way home or if there’s a drastic weather change. Laying in bed at night and it’s too cool/hot don’t get up, just grab your phone. I highly recommend it. If your thermostat isn’t programmable, get one that is (Honeywell) and you’ll be glad you did. (And I don’t work for them, lol).

title: New issues
text:
Added my second thermostat on Monday, and the app does not show the schedule. I scheduled everything on the t-stat, and it is following the schedule, but the app will not show the schedule. My original t-stat showed the schedule immediately and still does. I called Honeywell, and they have a recording stating they are having some issues. 
  We’ll see if and when it clears up, I do like the t stats very much though!

  Five stars now. Looks like Honeywell got the issues on their end and everything is working perfectly!

title: After TCC update system setup messed up
text: Boo Honeywell. This is happening every time the TCC app gets updated and is just frustrating. The updated TCC app complains that connection cannot be establish although the thermostat indicates that it is still connected to home WiFi router. After successful reconnection to the router, furnace blows hot air instead of cool. Well, all was working fine and then boom. Sort of disappointing. I guess this is happening because the system setting are set back to default after an update and they need to be reset again. The default system is heat pump so if you have heat/cool system in your house you are in trouble. If you don’t know that you perhaps will call for service and waste your time and $. All you need to do is just reset system setting.

title: A tad confusing
text: Setting heating and cooling schedules is a bit confusing but can be figured out. (Even though I haven’t ). I run on permanent hold to seek a consistent temperature. Placement is critical. Our thermostat is in a hallway that has limited air flow and thermostat runs cool in summer because of warmer hallway temperatures. My air conditioner seems to cycle on more frequently and I have noticed higher electric bills because of this.  The Wi Fi feature is great. Works well with Google assistant for voice and the app is responsive. Outdoor temperature reading is off by a few degrees but close enough to give your a feel. Overall its not a bad buy.

title: Two Houses One Thermostat
text: I have had Honeywell online thermostats in both houses for over eight years and they have performed flawlessly.  My first time installation on a heat pump required my calling for support and I was professionally walked through the steps required. Since that day I have never needed to call support again. Traveling from house to house I love being able to preset the temperature. My thermostats alert me to internet failures and provide peace of mind when checking on house temperatures while away.

title: It works but is ugly
text:
So the app works and pretty much does what it’s supposed to. The sad thing about this is the UI hasn’t changed since it came out like 10 years ago. Disappointed that you can’t set it to an auto mode on the system. It’s either Cool, Heat, or Off. This is most likely a limitation of the thermostat. Fan can be set to circulate, but not sure if this is also on a low setting, or periodic. Unlike Ecobee and Nest, you can specify how many minutes an hour the fan will run to circulate the air. 

So definitely not a high end thermostat or app. It is nice to control when away from the house and even with Alexa.

title: Email me back
text: My first complaint is that there is zero methods for contacting the company for support. They hide behind inadequate FAQ and lesson videos that fail to cover any and all questions and concerns. Now the concerns: changes to schedule do not remain in system. You set to 67 and when it is supposed to be that temperature it indicates 50. Recent no changes were saved after submission. The old clunky interface, online and app, needs a serious remodel. You can’t simply enter the time and must press repeatedly to adjust settings. No 24-hour clock because in their tiny font AM and PM look the same leading to mistakes.

title: Fan and ‘between seasons’ issues
text: We have 8 preschools using these thermostats. I LOVE that I can monitor the temps remotely. However, here in New Mexico, there are cold nights and warm days. Between seasons (late fall/early winter) you sometimes need the heat early in the morning and the air in the late afternoon. The controls don’t allow for automatically switching from heat to air depending on outside temp. That would be a valuable feature for our application!  Also, I CANNOT get our teachers to stop turning the fans to ‘on’!  I wish there was a lockout for that.  Overall it’s a good app.

title: Constant problems
text:
Whether it’s what is being called  “connectivity issues” or the company’s server itself, which is what I suspect is really behind those connectivity issues, this “app” continues to always seem to be experiencing some sort of problems! Always signing me out! It isn’t really an app- it’s a website shortcut/app hybrid- the plague of mobile computing cop-out semi-solutions! Like Zaxby’s “app” used to be; like Panda Express “app”. Junk.
You guys need to either get it together and get it straight so it works ALL the time- build a new real actual APP, or stop pretending- hire some real professional programmers to do it correctly.
If it continues to be problematic I have no compunction about changing brands. I’ve waited a year. I won’t wait another year.

title: Works well, not very sophisticated
text: The app is useful and fairly stable. We have time-of-use electric supply, so it was necessary to turn off the predictive features, which was not easy to do. We also participate in our utility’s energy conservation event scheme, and overriding those in the app are difficult or not possible (the tstat can still be adjusted manually). The inability to set separate schedules for summer and winter is also a frustration but this is a limitation of most of Honeywell’s tstat, still a software workaround should be possible. So yes, the app works well, it’s not very sophisticated.

title: App not talking to thermostat
text: I have 4 of the wi-if thermostats and have been satisfied until recently.  I realize that app maintenance is a necessary thing and acknowledge that Honeywell did notify us of it.  That said, the current situation is completely unacceptable.  Thousands like me are struggling to main safe temperatures in our properties during the coldest weather in over a generation.  Unbelievably, the maintenance continues during this dangerous weather and there is nothing from Honeywell acknowledging the difficulties they are creating, or even identifying when service might be disrupted.  Like so many others writing negative reviews, you have caused me to lose all faith in what had been a pretty solid product.  Regretfully, you have probably done irreparable damage to your once good reputation.

title: Works great
text: I have two total comfort thermostats installed at my house one for the main and one for an addition. They were very easy to install and program. I can monitor via the phone app both systems very easily and make adjustments. I have an iPhone 7, the phone app is very reliable. I’ve been able to monitor the system internationally. You can set alerts if the temperature goes to low and receive a message, extremely important if you live up north and you’re on vacation during the winter. You won’t be disappointed.

title: Overall it’s easy to use and works great
text: I love the simplicity.. and I find that this app works great. The only thing is it would be nice to be able to save my settings for future usage..like to have a seasonal schedule saved or an away or a vacation schedule saved and then to be able to set it for the future like by a date or calendar, even days in advance so it counts down to the start (with a reminder the day or two before the scheduled changes are activated).

title: Smart, easy. One small complaint
text:
I chose this over Nest. No regrets. Clean & thorough interface. 
One aggravation: The thermostat has a filter change reminder that the user can set for x weeks. This is so wrong; it could have been easily coded the right way, which would be to record accumulated run hours, or, better yet, fan hours (because the thermostat can be programmed to run the fan-only without heat or a/c). In my case, my filter needs to be changed after 350 hours of fan runtime; in my climate and with my user prefs, it takes 5 months to accumulate 350 filter hours in winter, but 4 weeks in summer.

title: Peace of mind
text: I am looking for peace of mind when it comes to managing the temperature in my homes. We live in a hot and humid climate in winter and spring and a cool mountain climate summer and fall. While away from either we still must heat or cool.  In the harsh mountain winter or the hot/ humid summers we must know quickly if there is a heating/cooling failure. Honeywell and this app has provided peace of mind that I will be able to call service in time even though I am 1,000 miles away. I also use the ability to adjust the temperature in anticipation of arrival. Never an issue with either thermostat.

title: WHEN it works, it’s fine
text: I’ve had the Honeywell Wi-Fi thermostat and the Total Connect Comfort App installed for about a month now. Sometimes it works with Alexa, most of the time it doesn’t. Sometimes it works from the App on my I-Pad and many times it doesn’t. Sometimes it works from my I-Phone and a lot of the time it doesn’t. The network signal is strong. As I sit and type this the furnace is running (because I set it from the thermostat itself) and the app finally showed that the heat was on, but did not show the temp change. Alexa says thermostat has been changed to x degrees, but the the thermostat doesn’t change. Very frustrating if you can’t rely on accurate monitoring or adjustment away from home. I’ll give it more time, but a Nest May be in the future.

title: Awesome thermostat and app,
text: We have had this thermostat for about 3 years now. It's so neat to be able to control it with my smartphone or iPad from anywhere. We can set it down in winter when we leave for the day or the weekend and turn it back up about an hour from home same in reverse for summer. Occasionally loses wifi signal but this is very rare and it automatically reconnects in a short time. Very user-friendly. Love the way we can customize and change the background color to match our mood for each season.

title: Crazy Settings
text: We have two Total Comfort thermostats.  One at our cottage which has only gas, forced air and the other on our home geothermal system.  The cottage thermostat works great but the one on geothermal is a pain.  We are on a varied, hourly electric rate schedule and this thing has stupid settings like sleep, wake up, leaving home and returning.  Now you would think this relates to hours of the day but no, the thermostat is programmed to be at the designated temperature described by the setting.  This makes following our electric hourly rate schedule nearly impossible.  Total Comfort please change this to strictly hourly designations.

title: Does not follow schedule
text:
Update June 2019. Have menu set for temperature to set to 73* at 11:00pm. At 9:00pm it changes the temperature to 73*. What is the point of setting schedule if it does what it wants? I have tried resetting with no luck.

Update 8/1. Only works half of the time.

Update 3/6. When I first updated had some issues but now works great and as advertised.

Update 1/26. The new "On" feature doesn't work. It shows "Heat On" when it is off and "Fan On" when it is off. I wish it worked and yes my thermostat is one that is compatible.

After having a new A/C installed I had the contractor install a Honeywell Wi-Fi thermostat. I have enjoyed having the ability to adjust the temperature from my mobile device. The only issue I have is you don't know if the unit is on or running, there is no indication of it's status. The other issue is the "outside temperature is always 10' warmer than it actually is. I have tried to find out where it gets this information from but to this point I have not. It says it is getting from Internet but all my mobile devices have the correct temperature on them so I am puzzled.

title: Nice and warm
text: Bought a smart thermostat so I could change the temp from my bed, on my way home and to check when I was away from home. Works excellent for that. Extremely easy to build or change a schedule compared to using the thermostat! I checked the temp response (when the unit comes on or off) b4 & after installing and saw no difference at all. The app was easy to set up and use. I hooked up to my Echo Dot (Alexa) so don’t even need my phone anymore. It didn’t get 5 stars as the app occasionally locks up and I have to reboot my phone. Would highly commend upgrading to a smart thermostat

title: Excellent Unit
text: I live out-of-state from my vacation rental where this unit is installed. I can keep track of the heating and cooling when guests aren’t there, saving money when I turn it down. Once the unit saved me when I saw the temperature dropping and I couldn’t get the to turn on in the winter. Turned out there was no gas in our tanks— the company had never delivered it on time. I quickly got the company to deliver gas before a catastrophe. The only time the unit fails is when the WiFi goes out. Otherwise it’s worked perfectly for 3 years

title: Works great but....
text: The app itself has worked great but I have a remote for upstairs and it would be really nice if I could control the remote from the app as well since I have the thermostat reading from the remote and for some reason in the last couple months keeps reverting back to reading from thermostat, I get an alert when it does but the only way to change back to the remote is on the remote itself so if I'm not home then have to wait until I get home to change it back and then the temp is off. NEEDS WATCH APP!!!

title: Good app
text: I’ve been using this app for about 5 years now. Overall I have found it very useful. The only flaw which has bothered me since day one is there is no scheduling or timer for the fan only. Sometimes I just like to have the fan running on my central air to allow for circulation. It’d be nice to have a timer for it to shut off or go back to its auto schedule after a set period of time. I use ecobee on another property I own and their app has this. Very useful. But overall this app works well and is nice to have at your fingertips.

title: So far so good
text:
Just had a new Dual system ( heat pump & propane ) installed a week ago and I like the App so far. 
Since I am running a dual system I wish the app would tell me if the heat pump is running or the propane system is running.....Currently is just tells me “ Heat is on “ so Im not sure which is on.... only way I know if I go look on the Thermostat on the wall.
Also it would be nice if it kept a run log on how long it cycles on and off as well just so I could monitor it when Im away from the house.

Hopefully someone at Honeywell reads these reviews since there is room for improvement but I am happy with the app so far!!

title: Worst app I have ever downloaded
text: Wow I honestly cannot believe these positive reviews. From day one I have had nothing but problems with this app. First the obvious...they have not changed the design, updated the features, or fixed any bugs in YEARS. They could care less and it shows, it's like an app from the 90's... When it WORKS!! EVERY DAY this app gives me trouble. I change the temp, I get a message it didn't register and I have to change it on the thermostat. Then it randomly logs me out, won't let me log back in, and says I have "exceeded my maximum attempts to log-in, please try again in 5 minutes." I wait 5 minutes, try to access the app again, get the same message! I have to wait days sometimes. USELESS APP if I can't control our two units remotely!

title: Very Satisfied
text: Have had my digital Honeywell thermostat now for about a year. Performs as advertised. Really like the remote feature which you can use to check the temperature at your home while you are away and change it if you want. This comes in very handy in the summer to lower the temp and get the house cooled off before you get home if you are away on a trip and similarly in the winter to raise the temp and warm up the house before you get back home. Overall very satisfied. Forgot to mention the tech support is outstanding.

title: Great Sense of Mind
text: I have a total of 4 thermostats between my 2 homes and love these thermostats. The programming is simple and you’re able to setback temperatures at times you’re not in the household. The ability to connect with any of them while on the road or in one of the opposite homes gives me great sense of mind in knowing I can pull them up on the internet to check internal temperatures or turn any of them off or on at my convenience. I highly recommend these thermostats. In my opinion they are much better than the competitor!

title: Outdated App UI
text: Functionally, the app works just fine with my Honeywell thermostat, but aesthetically it’s ugly. My thermostat has a more modern and visually interesting user interface than this app counterpart. Not once in the three years that I’ve had the app/thermostat has the user interface on the app been revised to make use of the larger displays available on today’s smartphones- so I get black bars above and below the app UI every time I use it. If I was using an iPhone 4, this would be fine- but at this point it’s laughably bad. Honeywell was able to update the app icon recently, so hopefully they’ll be able to update the app user interface as well.

title: Service and app issues
text: Normally the app works perfectly but in the last few weeks I’ve had a lot of issues with alert messages that are hard to clear that I’ve required me to delete and re-add the app in several times. Once I delete it and add it back in it works fine but there should be an easier way to clear alerts or reset the thermostat somehow for connectivity purposes. Here in Florida we have a lot of electrical outages due to thunderstorms and heat. Would be nice if there was I better work around.

title: Vacation mode & App look
text: Love the thermostat, have had it for a couple of years now. We travel a lot and I love that I can set it for a set number of days while we’re gone to a constant single hold temperature. What I don’t like is that you can’t change that remotely if we come home earlier or if I set for a day longer than our actual day back home, leaving us to come home to an uncomfortable house temperature. Please address this! Otherwise, it’s the best thermostat we’ve ever owned! Secondly, go back to the previous App look...the red is generic and ugly, looking like any other solid red and white App.

title: Great app
text: We recently replaced the non-smart thermostat in our home with a smart Honeywell one. We had a Honeywell in our previous home and I had liked the ease of use of the Total Connect Comfort app. This model is a little different but the app interface was the same so it allowed me to immediately be able to set up my thermostat. The app is really easy to use, especially if I wake during the night and want to adjust the temp from my bed. It also works with Alexia.

title: Very good basic app but needs improvement.
text:
This is a very good basic app but needs improvement in daily start and stop times (Wake, Leave, Return, & Sleep) as I like to warm up the house slowly such as @ 05:00 I’ve set to 65* then @ 06:00 66* and so on but being limited to only 4 per day doesn’t quite cut it. I also would like to be to monitor run time’s on both heating and cooling. 

Other than the two above the interface is clean and simple and that’s the reason I give this app 5*****.

title: Basic features work, but expect more
text:
Basic features like setting temperatures work o.k. within their limitations of times per day they can be set (4).
The “look ahead” setting is nice to be at temperature when wanted, but overshoots by a couple of degrees before it settles back to the set temperature over time. I have big old cast iron hot water radiators that hold a lot of heat. There is no way to adjust for this and the “look ahead” and has not adjusted on its own.
Would like to get better usage statistics than just a monthly report of hours used to compare to previous year.
Would also like an IPhone app

title: Disappointing wall thermostat
text: I installed this thermostat as Honeywell is a good brand name. The thermostat on the wall is not very good and the push buttons remind me of a first generation touch screen. My family has stopped trying to push the buttons as it takes several attempts to get the settings to actually change. The app works well on my phone, but loosing the ability to change settings at the wall thermostat is not a fair trade. We have had this thermostat for over 4 months and at this point I will look to replace with a different brand thermostat out of frustration and disappointment. I would not recommend this wall thermostat to anyone.

title: Honeywell makes one of the easiest devices for controlling heating and cooling.
text: My time with this device has been easy to install, easy to operate, and wonderful tool when I’m away. One specific item I would recommend any owner of this device; before calling the hvac guys, go through the manual and make sure everything is checked or unchecked on the device interface. There are specific settings that can create havoc, understand what type of ac/ heating unit you have. Heat pump, heat pump with auxiliary, it’s important read the manual.

title: Used to work nicely until upgrade about 4 weeks ago.
text: Not so good since the upgrade and icon change. Was that necessary?  Won’t connect anymore since upgrade and keep getting error messages that my override requested 2 Days in the future has not been accepted.  Dates are obviously wrong in initial setup. Finally that aggravating error message went away but now there is no connection at all. Email notifications to alert me of problem that I set up to go to work and home are no longer going to home email and filling up my work mailbox like crazy- doesn’t help when Im on vacation.  Can’t seem to find help.

title: Could use more functionality
text: I have used this thermostat for several years and it works okay. The temperature seems to hold close to the set point. I like the ability to set different temperatures for various times of day. The vacation mode is useful as well. It is great to be able to connect remotely and monitor the indoor temperature. This keeps the question as to whether or not we turned the furnace off prior to leaving at bay. As another reviewer noted, the ability to report run times for both furnace and air conditioner would be very useful and would garner the thermostat a five star review.

title: App Works Good-See Update Comment
text:
On vacation set thermostat to HOLD Permanently while away from Home (6 Days). 
While returning from trip programmed thermostat to follow regular schedule-heat would increase from 63 to 68 deg. Hear did not change to 68 deg per schedule.  Thermostat on wall showed “Heat On” but furnace was not On.  Turned furnace Off then back On using wall switch.  Checked thermostat and it indicated “Updating”. Wanted a while and system was bank to working - Heat was On and Furnace was producing heat(natural gas). Checked this scenario later in week and everything worked as programmed.

title: Useful App
text: I've had this application for about two years. Works very well with thermostat, especially the remote monitor and control function as I have had people in the house that needed adjustments to be made but were too intimidated by the touchpad to use it. Wi-Fi works perfectly. Have also recently started to use with Alexa app. Was apprehensive at first but it works well with Alexa so now using voice control to monitor temperature and to make adjustments. Looking forward to the next upgrades but so far works very well.

title: When it works...
text:
It works fine. Easy to check temperature and schedule. One of my thermostats is in an inconvenient place to check on the wall. 

But, from time to time, I get “incorrect login” errors. Since the login is saved, it’s clearly not an error of the login. Usually, the login error resolves itself right after I find the support ticket system. 

A more informative error message like “cannot connect to TCC servers” or “difficulties with site” would be nice, since after it resolves itself with nothing changed by me, it’s clearly not a bad password or login email.

title: I love this thermostat!!!
text: I bought it because my old one stopped working. I was kinda worried about the smart part at first but it works amazingly. I have it set on a schedule so we don’t have to worry about anything. It is set to 75 during the day and 68 at night! I love the ability to change it from my phone depending on whose home or not. I highly recommend this for anyone! The registration was a little tricky but you have to actually read the instructions!!

title: Works great.
text: I have used them for many years. They work perfect for us. They keep an accurate temperature in the house. Some nice advantages is that you can check on the heat when not home for long periods of time (winter vacation) and the ability to turn up heat before arriving home when your normal schedule changes. Also a monthly emailed use report every month. No need to ever go to a thermostat since it is easy and convenient to operate them from phone and iPad.

title: I love it
text: I wanted a WiFi capable thermostat that would let me control the outside fresh air damper and this was the only one.  Not even the Nest can handle the outside fresh air damper.  I love being able to wake up and reset the temps from my bed for both the upstairs and downstairs thermostats, and do the same at night when we go to bed.  I also love being able to turn on the outside fresh air damper when when cooking smelly foods.  All this is possible due to the Honeywell total control app.

title: 90% of the time it works 100% of the time
text: I’ve had this for over 2 years. Every naw and then the servers go wonky and the app won’t connect. But the actual thermostat always functions. Installation and set up were pretty easy. And I’m no expert. I read that away mode disconnects remote functionality so I don’t use it. When I go away I just set it to permanent hold at a higher temp.  That’s my favorite part. As soon as the plane lands, cancel the hold from my phone and walk into a cool house.

title: Waste of money and gas
text:
After several months of use have found it uses more energy than the old manual thermostat we replaced. This thing shuts off and reboots frequently, leaving the furnace running without any control whatsoever.  Unless you’re staring it it for a while you may not realize it’s happening until it empties the LP prematurely. We went through 600 gallons of LP in 3 months and wondered what was going on. 
Would’ve been a simple and useful thing to provide a logging function to know how often it runs the furnace and for how long, etc, but no. 
So just get a good simple reliable manual thermostat and enjoy the peace of mind Honeywell doesn’t seem to want to provide even at their premium price point.

title: Awesome
text: Couldn’t be happier. The thermostat was a cinch to install. The anticipator circuitry works great. The house feels warmer and we’ve actually set the thermostat lower by 1 degree. The app is exactly what we needed. Most thermostats are Monday thru Friday with Saturday and Sunday being the weekend, and there is no alternative. My girlfriend works Tuesday thru Saturday, and her hours vary. So it’s a snap for me to adjust the program. And the best part is that if we want the temperature changed a bit we don’t have to walk half way through the house to adjust the thermostat. We just use the app.

title: Very convenient but connection is intermittent
text:
When it works, it’s great. Thermostat doesn’t always respond to remote commands from app however. There are no WiFi issues on any of the dozen other devices using it. 
Sometimes it will “misbehave” for several hours or more - up to a whole day. After trying thermostat resets and using a different phone with no results I just wait a while. Frustrating. Thermostat always shows strong WiFi connection it just doesn’t get the remote commands at times. 
Seems to be a Honeywell server issue since the app doesn’t “talk” to thermostat directly. (So you can control from anywhere)

title: Great device but needs some tweaking
text: Easy to install, use manage... I wish everything was this cool... Err warm... You know... however I hate the microphone feature and that you cannot turn it off. I also do not know why the house is colder now with this device then with my previous one... I’ll get an HVAC person to validate that system is functioning correctly and see how to account for the 3° delta I see the house set at and he actual temp. Lastly the device does not follow the schedule it is set at. 330am it turns on and although  it’s set to stay at temp until 6am, the device turns heat up to 67 although I have it set at 64° until 6am.

title: Remote control functions lacking
text:
Upgraded from non wifi programmable thermostat a few days ago. Only reason i bought a wifi thermostat was so i could monitor and change temp setting if setting was changed by other family members. I was able to do that just fine, until my remote access was easily blocked by turning on a vacation hold.  Some type of password access should be added to certain features.  Also as others have requested, the app needs to be able to send push notifications and/or txts. Only sending email change messages is very outdated. 
The unit was easy to install and setup. Connecting to my non-broadcasting wifi ID was easy.

title: It’s a solid app, with one big flaw.
text:
Lots of problems for iPads now. The latest version shrinks the current room temp on an iPad so you nearly need a magnifying glass to read it. And room humidity has DISAPPEARED. And the temporary adjustment buttons are now out of place. A bad update. The app worked great before. Now it is a clumsy looking mess. Many of us use this app on an iPad at home. Fix your app.

Update: Much improved, everything now works fine, and the built-in weather forecast is quite accurate.  One added star.  But the latest ‘improvement’ is merely analytics, aka watching you.  Shame, Resideo.

title: Unacceptable
text:
Every since Honeywell went to the new app logo. This app and WiFi thermostat has been totally unacceptable. Totally jacked up!!! I have not been able to use the thermostat via WiFi since September 3rd. Their 1-855 number would not let you through to talk to tech support. After 14 days and four attempts to get through to tech support. The problem was fixed after multiple steps and 45 minuets later.
The fact is it should have never came to this. Totally unacceptable!!!

Update 1/21 pretty close to worthless. Works 50% of the time.

Update 3/7/21 I don’t know how many times that a person has to complain about an app not working before something happens. This morning I raised the temperature twice to get the house warm for the day. Because we keep the thermostat at night at 64 degrees. Nothing never happened at all with the app after I raised the temperature it would it turn clear itself. So my wife complained how come I have not raised the temperature and I told her what happened and she raised the temperature on the thermostat itself on the wall.

title: This thing is terrible
text: It loses wifi every 10 minutes.  I have tried everything to get it to work.  Restarted it over 20 times.  Went to the website which has nothing about wifi connection at all.   All the website tells me is that the thermostat lost Wi-Fi connection.   Ya!!!   I kinda already knew that.  The unit is about 20 feet from my router.  I do a speed test right next to the unit from my cell phone.   It shows around 300 Mps  speed.  Which show be more then enough to handle the unit.  Very frustrating for what i paid for this Wi-Fi thermostat.  Im stuck for now with this junk.  Hope you all have way better luck then I did.   I gave it 1 star ... only cause i had to get it something.

title: Happy homeowners
text:
We are extremely happy with our programmable thermostats. We are snow birds and it is easy to manage and get alerts. It has saved us a couple of times. We live in Minnesota and can’t go without heat. 

One time one of our furnaces wasn’t working and we received an alert that we had dropped below temp set. We had a friend check property and then we called for service. They came out and serviced and then we received the alert again. They had to come back again to get the new furnace working properly.

Another time we got an alert that thermostats were offline. Which was a small area power outage. It wasn’t showing up in our electric company’s website.

Also we turn heat down when we go away for a few days or more and it is nice to turn up remotely so it is nice and toasty when we get home.

title: App Just Stopped Working
text: All of a sudden the app stopped working. When I attempted to log in the app indicates I’m not connected to the internet when in fact I am. I when to the thermostat and noticed the wifi con toon was lost, so I reset the wifi. Still the app indicates I’m not connected. I clicked support and I get a blank screen Http/1.1 Service Unavailable. I monitor two thermostats with this app one of which is for an elderly person. So I’m disappointed, to put it mildly right now. What is going on?

title: Good function; Software could stand update.
text: Installation was simple as I had C wire. A 5 minute job. Programming initial setup was easy and only took a short time. Very intuitive. Programming the schedule of operation was very straight forward. Been in service 2+ months with no problems. The software upgrade I’d like to see is the manual change to the schedule. While I can make a temporary change to set points, I cannot put an end time to temporary change. End time defaults to next scheduled change. I will be purchasing another Honeywell thermostat for a second system.

title: Schedule
text: Love our new thermostat. We like having the three displays of the outside temp, the current temp and the set temp visible.  The outside temp and humidity is nice to have but it’s about 1-3 degrees difference from the thermometer we have outside - not a big deal though. Still trying to figure out why the scheduled programming doesn’t work consistently, I haven’t read the directions yet, I'm sure it’s something I need to look up. Love that we can adjust thermostat from the wall or app.  Would buy this product and app again.

title: Monitor energy usage
text: I think it is absolutely great to have data on the monthly usage of my energy consumption, whether heat or cold.  I am seriously considering replacing my two other zoned thermostats with connected thermostats to allow remote adjustments, applying changes via my Alexa with verbal commands, and also monitor the total energy usage in my household.  I just love the Honeywell products, system software, and technical support.  I would not even consider any competitor products.  Keep up the great work.  I am a very content customer.

title: Works, kinda. Looks like crap on iPhone X
text: This app does its job, sometimes. I find often that I’ve set a temperature on the app but my device hasn’t updated itself. After setting it a second or even third time I will see it finally update on my device, which was connected to the internet the entire time. It seems that the app hasn’t been updated from a graphical standpoint because it does not use the extra available space on the iPhone X’s screen, and instead acts as if the screen is of standard ratio. The interface is old and clunky and it’s clear this app is in dire need of a refresh of the UI. Honeywell marketing, if you’re reading this, the people want an update!

title: Great Control
text:
Last fall I replaced/upgraded my 2 HVAC systems in my 5000 sq ft home. The installers thought it would be a good time to replace the thermostats so I sent to the local home improvement store and found the Honeywell display I wanted WiFi control and needed 2 stage furnace control.
I grabbed 2 RTH6500’s install was easy, fast and WiFi is great.
Only one problem it uses a separate app, not Honeywell’s Total Home Control that didn’t pop off the side of the box so now I use 2 apps.
I don’t like my thermostats to look like a dark stop on the wall

title: Great
text:
I guess going from a mercury thermostat to this I'm just spoiled. I like it Alot. I really don't want push notifications. If I want to know the temp I just look at my app. I don't want to know if someone changed the temp. 
One thing I didn't like about Honeywell was they allowed some of their customers going out of business to sell these to people and then they sold them on eBay and the sellers didn't know that they were coded and had to be listed through Honeywell. Therefore no warranty. That was a ripoff. The product is ok but the company???

title: Nice when it works
text:
I live in Michigan, and own a Florida condo for the winter months.  After replacing my old a/c and heating system , I was pleased to have a wifi enabled thermostat so I can check my system when 2000 miles away.  Well all went okay , but suddenly the thermostat started dropping off of the internet and would go up and down daily.  Now it stays off.  I have it reset by a neighbor, it stays up for an hour or so and then drops off again.  The thermostat still works, but I can not view it remotely.
Vision Pro 8000 model.

title: One small flaw
text: We have two thermostats and are very pleased with them.  The Smart function works well and we manage the temperature from our phone with very few lapses.  My only issue is the thermostat is too bright.  By necessity due to our floor plan, one of our thermostats was installed just across from our bedroom door.  The light from the thermostat is quite bright and disturbs our sleep, especially when it brightens as the unit kicks on.  We’ve tried several different color combinations to no avail.  Wish there was a way to turn the light off entirely.

title: Total peace of mind
text: I have had my Honeywell WiFi thermostat for several years and through three furnaces I have been totally satisfied. I used to regularly. Spend my winters in Florida and got a lot of comfort by being able to check the status of my home In Minnesota via the internet. I have never felt the need to change or upgrade my thermostat since it does everything I would like it to do simply and reliably. Have strongly recommended to others.

title: Close, but no cigar...
text:
While the App looks pretty and has some nice features, the actual core function — setting the heat/cool schedules — is not straightforward. This latest version is buggy as well.  
When transitioning from summer/winter — i.e. cool to heat or the reverse, the scheduling isn’t clear at all. Sometimes, like right now, I can’t make a schedule switch because the continue button is greyed-out. Restarting the App sometimes clears this up, sometimes not. You can always make a temporary hold change, but that’s no different than doing it at the thermostat itself. 

If I were Honeywell, I’d rewrite the entire App. It’s been essentially the same for 5 yrs...

title: Works great and love the WiFi connectivity!
text: I have enjoyed these Honeywell thermostats as well the connectivity and easy scheduling tool available in the app.  It’s also great peace of mind to be able to check temperature conditions when traveling away from home for a few days. Overall it loads and operates smoothly and has been one of my most stable home related apps I have used. Much better than the many WiFi light applications I have.  Well done!!

title: Perfect for me
text: I looked at, and read reviews of a few different devices before purchasing. I settled on the Honeywell after also seeking advice from HVAC pros. Could not be happier. After Hurricane Irma  took out power to most of Florida, my home was without power for 9 days. I was staying at the home of a friend nearby whose power was on and while sitting in her kitchen talking, suddenly my phone alerted me to the fact that my thermostat thought it was too warm in my house. Power was back. Love my thermostat.

title: Like It
text: I tried one of these in my house since I travel for work.  It has worked well (once I got the c-wire issue sorted out).  Just bought three more for three zones in my lake house.  The instructions were straightforward - more importantly, it worked.  I was able to add the three new thermostats to the app and can now control the heat from literally anywhere I have cell service or wifi (like in a plane).  The one in my house has been there over a year.  The new ones only a few weeks.  Work great so far.

title: Great thermostat
text: We originally bought this thermostat a few years ago, and really loved it.  So much, that we bought it again when we moved to a new home.  I love the app, and having the ability to turn it up/down from bed, or if we’re out & want to turn it down while no one is home.  I like the look of this one much better than the nest thermostat (it always reminds me of those super old round thermostats that my grandparents had).  I also like the option of changing the display color.

title: Think twice
text: I'm not a technical person so this comes from a lay person's viewpoint. The app almost always says the unit is not connected to the internet which isn't true. I just ignore the message on the app and make changes which go through. The unit also doesn't indicate connection issues.  I also don't like that I set the schedule but the unit decides what to do. For example, my off peak time starts at 8 pm so my unit is set to cool after that when rates are cheaper. But if I set it to change to 76 degrees at 845 and it thinks it will take an hour to get it to 76, it will start cooling  at 745 and not 8.  It would be nice to have some control so that I could set the times on and off more accurately.

title: Still Working
text: We have had this thermostat for about 3 years now and it is still working very well. I like to be able to change the settings from my chair or from bed if I forgot to adjust it. I lost the internet connection once but once I updated the app it was working again. After 3 years I feel qualified to give an honest review. Quite often reviews are given to early. I would recommend this product and app.

title: Excellent WIFI thermostat
text: I would say this thermostat works really well for me.  I read other reviews on the cycle times but have not experienced under/over cycling situations.  Easy to install and best of all easy to read.  Older programable unit had no backlighting and no wifi so had yo use a flashlight just to adjust.  This unit has easy to read features and buttons.  Love the outdoor temp and humidity readings too!!!  Was not sure on the wifi aspects but lately really like it.
